         <header class="book-titlepage">
            <h1>The Tragedy of Coriolanus</h1>
         </header>

               </p>

                           </span>

                        <a href="#R.1.6">4. ACT IV</a>
                     </span>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.2">1. SCENE I.  Rome. Before a gate of the city.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.3">2. SCENE II.  The same. A  street near the gate.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>

                              <a href="#R.1.6.4">3. SCENE III.  A highway between Rome and Antium.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>

                           </span>

                           </span>

                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.8">7. SCENE VII.  A camp, at a small distance from Rome.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </li>

                     <span>
                        <a href="#R.1.7">5. ACT V</a>

                           </span>
                        </li>

                           </span>
                        </li>

                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.4">3. SCENE III.  The tent of Coriolanus.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>

         </div>
         <article class="preface" id="R.1.2">
            <header class="preface-titlepage">
               <h2>Dramatis Personae</h2>
            </header>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">CAIUS MARCIUS, Afterwards CAIUS MARCIUS CORIOLANUS.</span>
            </p>
            <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
               <tr>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">
                        <span class="personname">TITUS LARTIUS</span>
                        <span class="personname">COMINIUS</span>
                     </span>
                  </td>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">generals against the Volscians.</span>
                  </td>
               </tr>
            </table>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">MENENIUS AGRIPPA, friend to Coriolanus. </span>
            </p>
            <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
               <tr>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">
                        <span class="personname">SICINIUS VELUTUS</span>
                        <span class="personname">JUNIUS BRUTUS</span>
                     </span>
                  </td>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">tribunes of the people.</span>
                  </td>
               </tr>
            </table>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Young MARCUS, son to Coriolanus.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">A Roman Herald. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">TULLUS AUFIDIUS, general of the Volscians. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Lieutenant to Aufidius. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Conspirators with Aufidius.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">A Citizen of Antium.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Two Volscian Guards.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">VOLUMNIA, mother to Coriolanus.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">VIRGILIA, wife to Coriolanus.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">VALERIA, friend to Virgilia.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Gentlewoman, attending on Virgilia. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Roman and Volscian Senators, Patricians, Aediles, Lictors, Soldiers, Citizens, Messengers, Servants to Aufidius, and other Attendants.</span>
            </p>
            <p>SCENE  Rome and the neighbourhood; Corioli and the neighbourhood; Antium.</p>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.3">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 1. ACT I</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.2">1. SCENE I.  Rome. A street.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.3">2. SCENE II.  Corioli. The Senate-house.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.4">3. SCENE III.  Rome. A room in Marcius' house.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.5">4. SCENE IV.  Before Corioli.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.6">5. SCENE V.  Corioli. A street.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.7">6. SCENE VI.  Near the camp of Cominius.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.8">7. SCENE VII.  The gates of Corioli.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.9">8. SCENE VIII.  A field of battle.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.10">9. SCENE IX.  The Roman camp.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.11">10. SCENE X.  The camp of the Volsces.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  Rome. A street.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter a company of mutinous Citizens, with staves,
clubs, and other weapons</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">Before we proceed any further, hear me speak.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">All</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak, speak.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">You are all resolved rather to die than to famish?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">All</div>
                     <div class="line">Resolved. resolved.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">First, you know Caius Marcius is chief enemy to the people.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">All</div>
                     <div class="line">We know't, we know't.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">Let us kill him, and we'll have corn at our own price.</div>
                     <div class="line">Is't a verdict?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">All</div>
                     <div class="line">No more talking on't; let it be done: away, away!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">One word, good citizens.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">We are accounted poor citizens, the patricians good.</div>
                     <div class="line">What authority surfeits on would relieve us: if they</div>
                     <div class="line">would yield us but the superfluity, while it were</div>
                     <div class="line">wholesome, we might guess they relieved us humanely;</div>
                     <div class="line">but they think we are too dear: the leanness that</div>
                     <div class="line">afflicts us, the object of our misery, is as an</div>
                     <div class="line">inventory to particularise their abundance; our</div>
                     <div class="line">sufferance is a gain to them Let us revenge this with</div>
                     <div class="line">our pikes, ere we become rakes: for the gods know I</div>
                     <div class="line">speak this in hunger for bread, not in thirst for revenge.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">Would you proceed especially against Caius Marcius?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">All</div>
                     <div class="line">Against him first: he's a very dog to the commonalty.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">Consider you what services he has done for his country?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">Very well; and could be content to give him good</div>
                     <div class="line">report fort, but that he pays himself with being proud.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, but speak not maliciously.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">I say unto you, what he hath done famously, he did</div>
                     <div class="line">it to that end: though soft-conscienced men can be</div>
                     <div class="line">content to say it was for his country he did it to</div>
                     <div class="line">please his mother and to be partly proud; which he</div>
                     <div class="line">is, even till the altitude of his virtue.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">What he cannot help in his nature, you account a</div>
                     <div class="line">vice in him. You must in no way say he is covetous.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">If I must not, I need not be barren of accusations;</div>
                     <div class="line">he hath faults, with surplus, to tire in repetition.</div>
                     <p>Shouts within</p>
                     <div class="line">What shouts are these? The other side o' the city</div>
                     <div class="line">is risen: why stay we prating here? to the Capitol!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">All</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, come.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">Soft! who comes here?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter MENENIUS AGRIPPA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">Worthy Menenius Agrippa; one that hath always loved</div>
                     <div class="line">the people.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">He's one honest enough: would all the rest were so!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">What work's, my countrymen, in hand? where go you</div>
                     <div class="line">With bats and clubs? The matter? speak, I pray you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">Our business is not unknown to the senate; they have</div>
                     <div class="line">had inkling this fortnight what we intend to do,</div>
                     <div class="line">which now we'll show 'em in deeds. They say poor</div>
                     <div class="line">suitors have strong breaths: they shall know we</div>
                     <div class="line">have strong arms too.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, masters, my good friends, mine honest neighbours,</div>
                     <div class="line">Will you undo yourselves?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">We cannot, sir, we are undone already.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I tell you, friends, most charitable care</div>
                     <div class="line">Have the patricians of you. For your wants,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your suffering in this dearth, you may as well</div>
                     <div class="line">Strike at the heaven with your staves as lift them</div>
                     <div class="line">Against the Roman state, whose course will on</div>
                     <div class="line">The way it takes, cracking ten thousand curbs</div>
                     <div class="line">Of more strong link asunder than can ever</div>
                     <div class="line">Appear in your impediment. For the dearth,</div>
                     <div class="line">The gods, not the patricians, make it, and</div>
                     <div class="line">Your knees to them, not arms, must help. Alack,</div>
                     <div class="line">You are transported by calamity</div>
                     <div class="line">Thither where more attends you, and you slander</div>
                     <div class="line">The helms o' the state, who care for you like fathers,</div>
                     <div class="line">When you curse them as enemies.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">Care for us! True, indeed! They ne'er cared for us</div>
                     <div class="line">yet: suffer us to famish, and their store-houses</div>
                     <div class="line">crammed with grain; make edicts for usury, to</div>
                     <div class="line">support usurers; repeal daily any wholesome act</div>
                     <div class="line">established against the rich, and provide more</div>
                     <div class="line">piercing statutes daily, to chain up and restrain</div>
                     <div class="line">the poor. If the wars eat us not up, they will; and</div>
                     <div class="line">there's all the love they bear us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Either you must</div>
                     <div class="line">Confess yourselves wondrous malicious,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or be accused of folly. I shall tell you</div>
                     <div class="line">A pretty tale: it may be you have heard it;</div>
                     <div class="line">But, since it serves my purpose, I will venture</div>
                     <div class="line">To stale 't a little more.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, I'll hear it, sir: yet you must not think to</div>
                     <div class="line">fob off our disgrace with a tale: but, an 't please</div>
                     <div class="line">you, deliver.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">There was a time when all the body's members</div>
                     <div class="line">Rebell'd against the belly, thus accused it:</div>
                     <div class="line">That only like a gulf it did remain</div>
                     <div class="line">I' the midst o' the body, idle and unactive,</div>
                     <div class="line">Still cupboarding the viand, never bearing</div>
                     <div class="line">Like labour with the rest, where the other instruments</div>
                     <div class="line">Did see and hear, devise, instruct, walk, feel,</div>
                     <div class="line">And, mutually participate, did minister</div>
                     <div class="line">Unto the appetite and affection common</div>
                     <div class="line">Of the whole body. The belly answer'd--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, sir, what answer made the belly?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, I shall tell you. With a kind of smile,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which ne'er came from the lungs, but even thus--</div>
                     <div class="line">For, look you, I may make the belly smile</div>
                     <div class="line">As well as speak--it tauntingly replied</div>
                     <div class="line">To the discontented members, the mutinous parts</div>
                     <div class="line">That envied his receipt; even so most fitly</div>
                     <div class="line">As you malign our senators for that</div>
                     <div class="line">They are not such as you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">Your belly's answer? What!</div>
                     <div class="line">The kingly-crowned head, the vigilant eye,</div>
                     <div class="line">The counsellor heart, the arm our soldier,</div>
                     <div class="line">Our steed the leg, the tongue our trumpeter.</div>
                     <div class="line">With other muniments and petty helps</div>
                     <div class="line">In this our fabric, if that they--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">What then?</div>
                     <div class="line">'Fore me, this fellow speaks! What then? what then?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">Should by the cormorant belly be restrain'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who is the sink o' the body,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, what then?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">The former agents, if they did complain,</div>
                     <div class="line">What could the belly answer?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I will tell you</div>
                     <div class="line">If you'll bestow a small--of what you have little--</div>
                     <div class="line">Patience awhile, you'll hear the belly's answer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">Ye're long about it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Note me this, good friend;</div>
                     <div class="line">Your most grave belly was deliberate,</div>
                     <div class="line">Not rash like his accusers, and thus answer'd:</div>
                     <div class="line">'True is it, my incorporate friends,' quoth he,</div>
                     <div class="line">'That I receive the general food at first,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which you do live upon; and fit it is,</div>
                     <div class="line">Because I am the store-house and the shop</div>
                     <div class="line">Of the whole body: but, if you do remember,</div>
                     <div class="line">I send it through the rivers of your blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">Even to the court, the heart, to the seat o' the brain;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, through the cranks and offices of man,</div>
                     <div class="line">The strongest nerves and small inferior veins</div>
                     <div class="line">From me receive that natural competency</div>
                     <div class="line">Whereby they live: and though that all at once,</div>
                     <div class="line">You, my good friends,'--this says the belly, mark me,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, sir; well, well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">'Though all at once cannot</div>
                     <div class="line">See what I do deliver out to each,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet I can make my audit up, that all</div>
                     <div class="line">From me do back receive the flour of all,</div>
                     <div class="line">And leave me but the bran.' What say you to't?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">It was an answer: how apply you this?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">The senators of Rome are this good belly,</div>
                     <div class="line">And you the mutinous members; for examine</div>
                     <div class="line">Their counsels and their cares, digest things rightly</div>
                     <div class="line">Touching the weal o' the common, you shall find</div>
                     <div class="line">No public benefit which you receive</div>
                     <div class="line">But it proceeds or comes from them to you</div>
                     <div class="line">And no way from yourselves. What do you think,</div>
                     <div class="line">You, the great toe of this assembly?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">I the great toe! why the great toe?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">For that, being one o' the lowest, basest, poorest,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of this most wise rebellion, thou go'st foremost:</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou rascal, that art worst in blood to run,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lead'st first to win some vantage.</div>
                     <div class="line">But make you ready your stiff bats and clubs:</div>
                     <div class="line">Rome and her rats are at the point of battle;</div>
                     <div class="line">The one side must have bale.</div>
                     <p>Enter CAIUS MARCIUS</p>
                     <div class="line">Hail, noble Marcius!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Thanks. What's the matter, you dissentious rogues,</div>
                     <div class="line">That, rubbing the poor itch of your opinion,</div>
                     <div class="line">Make yourselves scabs?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">We have ever your good word.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">He that will give good words to thee will flatter</div>
                     <div class="line">Beneath abhorring. What would you have, you curs,</div>
                     <div class="line">That like nor peace nor war? the one affrights you,</div>
                     <div class="line">The other makes you proud. He that trusts to you,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where he should find you lions, finds you hares;</div>
                     <div class="line">Where foxes, geese: you are no surer, no,</div>
                     <div class="line">Than is the coal of fire upon the ice,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or hailstone in the sun. Your virtue is</div>
                     <div class="line">To make him worthy whose offence subdues him</div>
                     <div class="line">And curse that justice did it.</div>
                     <div class="line">Who deserves greatness</div>
                     <div class="line">Deserves your hate; and your affections are</div>
                     <div class="line">A sick man's appetite, who desires most that</div>
                     <div class="line">Which would increase his evil. He that depends</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon your favours swims with fins of lead</div>
                     <div class="line">And hews down oaks with rushes. Hang ye! Trust Ye?</div>
                     <div class="line">With every minute you do change a mind,</div>
                     <div class="line">And call him noble that was now your hate,</div>
                     <div class="line">Him vile that was your garland. What's the matter,</div>
                     <div class="line">That in these several places of the city</div>
                     <div class="line">You cry against the noble senate, who,</div>
                     <div class="line">Under the gods, keep you in awe, which else</div>
                     <div class="line">Would feed on one another? What's their seeking?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">For corn at their own rates; whereof, they say,</div>
                     <div class="line">The city is well stored.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Hang 'em! They say!</div>
                     <div class="line">They'll sit by the fire, and presume to know</div>
                     <div class="line">What's done i' the Capitol; who's like to rise,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who thrives and who declines; side factions</div>
                     <div class="line">and give out</div>
                     <div class="line">Conjectural marriages; making parties strong</div>
                     <div class="line">And feebling such as stand not in their liking</div>
                     <div class="line">Below their cobbled shoes. They say there's</div>
                     <div class="line">grain enough!</div>
                     <div class="line">Would the nobility lay aside their ruth,</div>
                     <div class="line">And let me use my sword, I'll make a quarry</div>
                     <div class="line">With thousands of these quarter'd slaves, as high</div>
                     <div class="line">As I could pick my lance.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, these are almost thoroughly persuaded;</div>
                     <div class="line">For though abundantly they lack discretion,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet are they passing cowardly. But, I beseech you,</div>
                     <div class="line">What says the other troop?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">They are dissolved: hang 'em!</div>
                     <div class="line">They said they were an-hungry; sigh'd forth proverbs,</div>
                     <div class="line">That hunger broke stone walls, that dogs must eat,</div>
                     <div class="line">That meat was made for mouths, that the gods sent not</div>
                     <div class="line">Corn for the rich men only: with these shreds</div>
                     <div class="line">They vented their complainings; which being answer'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">And a petition granted them, a strange one--</div>
                     <div class="line">To break the heart of generosity,</div>
                     <div class="line">And make bold power look pale--they threw their caps</div>
                     <div class="line">As they would hang them on the horns o' the moon,</div>
                     <div class="line">Shouting their emulation.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">What is granted them?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Five tribunes to defend their vulgar wisdoms,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of their own choice: one's Junius Brutus,</div>
                     <div class="line">Sicinius Velutus, and I know not--'Sdeath!</div>
                     <div class="line">The rabble should have first unroof'd the city,</div>
                     <div class="line">Ere so prevail'd with me: it will in time</div>
                     <div class="line">Win upon power and throw forth greater themes</div>
                     <div class="line">For insurrection's arguing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">This is strange.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, get you home, you fragments!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter a Messenger, hastily</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">Where's Caius Marcius?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Here: what's the matter?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">The news is, sir, the Volsces are in arms.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I am glad on 't: then we shall ha' means to vent</div>
                     <div class="line">Our musty superfluity. See, our best elders.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter COMINIUS, TITUS LARTIUS, and other Senators;
JUNIUS BRUTUS and SICINIUS VELUTUS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">Marcius, 'tis true that you have lately told us;</div>
                     <div class="line">The Volsces are in arms.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">They have a leader,</div>
                     <div class="line">Tullus Aufidius, that will put you to 't.</div>
                     <div class="line">I sin in envying his nobility,</div>
                     <div class="line">And were I any thing but what I am,</div>
                     <div class="line">I would wish me only he.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">You have fought together.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Were half to half the world by the ears and he.</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon my party, I'ld revolt to make</div>
                     <div class="line">Only my wars with him: he is a lion</div>
                     <div class="line">That I am proud to hunt.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">Then, worthy Marcius,</div>
                     <div class="line">Attend upon Cominius to these wars.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">It is your former promise.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, it is;</div>
                     <div class="line">And I am constant. Titus Lartius, thou</div>
                     <div class="line">Shalt see me once more strike at Tullus' face.</div>
                     <div class="line">What, art thou stiff? stand'st out?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TITUS</div>
                     <div class="line">No, Caius Marcius;</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll lean upon one crutch and fight with t'other,</div>
                     <div class="line">Ere stay behind this business.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">O, true-bred!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">Your company to the Capitol; where, I know,</div>
                     <div class="line">Our greatest friends attend us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TITUS</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>To COMINIUS</span>                Lead you on.</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>To MARCIUS</span>  Follow Cominius; we must follow you;</div>
                     <div class="line">Right worthy you priority.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Noble Marcius!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>To the Citizens</span>  Hence to your homes; be gone!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, let them follow:</div>
                     <div class="line">The Volsces have much corn; take these rats thither</div>
                     <div class="line">To gnaw their garners. Worshipful mutiners,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your valour puts well forth: pray, follow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Citizens steal away. Exeunt all but SICINIUS
and BRUTUS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Was ever man so proud as is this Marcius?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">He has no equal.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">When we were chosen tribunes for the people,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Mark'd you his lip and eyes?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay. but his taunts.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Being moved, he will not spare to gird the gods.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Be-mock the modest moon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">The present wars devour him: he is grown</div>
                     <div class="line">Too proud to be so valiant.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Such a nature,</div>
                     <div class="line">Tickled with good success, disdains the shadow</div>
                     <div class="line">Which he treads on at noon: but I do wonder</div>
                     <div class="line">His insolence can brook to be commanded</div>
                     <div class="line">Under Cominius.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Fame, at the which he aims,</div>
                     <div class="line">In whom already he's well graced, can not</div>
                     <div class="line">Better be held nor more attain'd than by</div>
                     <div class="line">A place below the first: for what miscarries</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall be the general's fault, though he perform</div>
                     <div class="line">To the utmost of a man, and giddy censure</div>
                     <div class="line">Will then cry out of Marcius 'O if he</div>
                     <div class="line">Had borne the business!'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Besides, if things go well,</div>
                     <div class="line">Opinion that so sticks on Marcius shall</div>
                     <div class="line">Of his demerits rob Cominius.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Come:</div>
                     <div class="line">Half all Cominius' honours are to Marcius.</div>
                     <div class="line">Though Marcius earned them not, and all his faults</div>
                     <div class="line">To Marcius shall be honours, though indeed</div>
                     <div class="line">In aught he merit not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Let's hence, and hear</div>
                     <div class="line">How the dispatch is made, and in what fashion,</div>
                     <div class="line">More than his singularity, he goes</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon this present action.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Lets along.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  Corioli. The Senate-house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter TULLUS AUFIDIUS and certain Senators</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">So, your opinion is, Aufidius,</div>
                     <div class="line">That they of Rome are entered in our counsels</div>
                     <div class="line">And know how we proceed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Is it not yours?</div>
                     <div class="line">What ever have been thought on in this state,</div>
                     <div class="line">That could be brought to bodily act ere Rome</div>
                     <div class="line">Had circumvention? 'Tis not four days gone</div>
                     <div class="line">Since I heard thence; these are the words: I think</div>
                     <div class="line">I have the letter here; yes, here it is.</div>
                     <p>Reads</p>
                     <div class="line">'They have press'd a power, but it is not known</div>
                     <div class="line">Whether for east or west: the dearth is great;</div>
                     <div class="line">The people mutinous; and it is rumour'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Cominius, Marcius your old enemy,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who is of Rome worse hated than of you,</div>
                     <div class="line">And Titus Lartius, a most valiant Roman,</div>
                     <div class="line">These three lead on this preparation</div>
                     <div class="line">Whither 'tis bent: most likely 'tis for you:</div>
                     <div class="line">Consider of it.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">Our army's in the field</div>
                     <div class="line">We never yet made doubt but Rome was ready</div>
                     <div class="line">To answer us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor did you think it folly</div>
                     <div class="line">To keep your great pretences veil'd till when</div>
                     <div class="line">They needs must show themselves; which</div>
                     <div class="line">in the hatching,</div>
                     <div class="line">It seem'd, appear'd to Rome. By the discovery.</div>
                     <div class="line">We shall be shorten'd in our aim, which was</div>
                     <div class="line">To take in many towns ere almost Rome</div>
                     <div class="line">Should know we were afoot.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">Noble Aufidius,</div>
                     <div class="line">Take your commission; hie you to your bands:</div>
                     <div class="line">Let us alone to guard Corioli:</div>
                     <div class="line">If they set down before 's, for the remove</div>
                     <div class="line">Bring your army; but, I think, you'll find</div>
                     <div class="line">They've not prepared for us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">O, doubt not that;</div>
                     <div class="line">I speak from certainties. Nay, more,</div>
                     <div class="line">Some parcels of their power are forth already,</div>
                     <div class="line">And only hitherward. I leave your honours.</div>
                     <div class="line">If we and Caius Marcius chance to meet,</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis sworn between us we shall ever strike</div>
                     <div class="line">Till one can do no more.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">All</div>
                     <div class="line">The gods assist you!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">And keep your honours safe!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">All</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  Rome. A room in Marcius' house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter VOLUMNIA and VIRGILIA they set them down
on two low stools, and sew</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray you, daughter, sing; or express yourself in a</div>
                     <div class="line">more comfortable sort: if my son were my husband, I</div>
                     <div class="line">should freelier rejoice in that absence wherein he</div>
                     <div class="line">won honour than in the embracements of his bed where</div>
                     <div class="line">he would show most love. When yet he was but</div>
                     <div class="line">tender-bodied and the only son of my womb, when</div>
                     <div class="line">youth with comeliness plucked all gaze his way, when</div>
                     <div class="line">for a day of kings' entreaties a mother should not</div>
                     <div class="line">sell him an hour from her beholding, I, considering</div>
                     <div class="line">how honour would become such a person. that it was</div>
                     <div class="line">no better than picture-like to hang by the wall, if</div>
                     <div class="line">renown made it not stir, was pleased to let him seek</div>
                     <div class="line">danger where he was like to find fame. To a cruel</div>
                     <div class="line">war I sent him; from whence he returned, his brows</div>
                     <div class="line">bound with oak. I tell thee, daughter, I sprang not</div>
                     <div class="line">more in joy at first hearing he was a man-child</div>
                     <div class="line">than now in first seeing he had proved himself a</div>
                     <div class="line">man.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIRGILIA</div>
                     <div class="line">But had he died in the business, madam; how then?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Then his good report should have been my son; I</div>
                     <div class="line">therein would have found issue. Hear me profess</div>
                     <div class="line">sincerely: had I a dozen sons, each in my love</div>
                     <div class="line">alike and none less dear than thine and my good</div>
                     <div class="line">Marcius, I had rather had eleven die nobly for their</div>
                     <div class="line">country than one voluptuously surfeit out of action.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter a Gentlewoman</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Gentlewoman</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, the Lady Valeria is come to visit you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIRGILIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Beseech you, give me leave to retire myself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Indeed, you shall not.</div>
                     <div class="line">Methinks I hear hither your husband's drum,</div>
                     <div class="line">See him pluck Aufidius down by the hair,</div>
                     <div class="line">As children from a bear, the Volsces shunning him:</div>
                     <div class="line">Methinks I see him stamp thus, and call thus:</div>
                     <div class="line">'Come on, you cowards! you were got in fear,</div>
                     <div class="line">Though you were born in Rome:' his bloody brow</div>
                     <div class="line">With his mail'd hand then wiping, forth he goes,</div>
                     <div class="line">Like to a harvest-man that's task'd to mow</div>
                     <div class="line">Or all or lose his hire.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIRGILIA</div>
                     <div class="line">His bloody brow! O Jupiter, no blood!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Away, you fool! it more becomes a man</div>
                     <div class="line">Than gilt his trophy: the breasts of Hecuba,</div>
                     <div class="line">When she did suckle Hector, look'd not lovelier</div>
                     <div class="line">Than Hector's forehead when it spit forth blood</div>
                     <div class="line">At Grecian sword, contemning. Tell Valeria,</div>
                     <div class="line">We are fit to bid her welcome.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit Gentlewoman</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIRGILIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Heavens bless my lord from fell Aufidius!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                     <div class="line">He'll beat Aufidius 'head below his knee</div>
                     <div class="line">And tread upon his neck.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter VALERIA, with an Usher and Gentlewoman</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALERIA</div>
                     <div class="line">My ladies both, good day to you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweet madam.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIRGILIA</div>
                     <div class="line">I am glad to see your ladyship.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALERIA</div>
                     <div class="line">How do you both? you are manifest house-keepers.</div>
                     <div class="line">What are you sewing here? A fine spot, in good</div>
                     <div class="line">faith. How does your little son?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIRGILIA</div>
                     <div class="line">I thank your ladyship; well, good madam.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                     <div class="line">He had rather see the swords, and hear a drum, than</div>
                     <div class="line">look upon his school-master.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALERIA</div>
                     <div class="line">O' my word, the father's son: I'll swear,'tis a</div>
                     <div class="line">very pretty boy. O' my troth, I looked upon him o'</div>
                     <div class="line">Wednesday half an hour together: has such a</div>
                     <div class="line">confirmed countenance. I saw him run after a gilded</div>
                     <div class="line">butterfly: and when he caught it, he let it go</div>
                     <div class="line">again; and after it again; and over and over he</div>
                     <div class="line">comes, and again; catched it again; or whether his</div>
                     <div class="line">fall enraged him, or how 'twas, he did so set his</div>
                     <div class="line">teeth and tear it; O, I warrant it, how he mammocked</div>
                     <div class="line">it!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                     <div class="line">One on 's father's moods.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALERIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Indeed, la, 'tis a noble child.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIRGILIA</div>
                     <div class="line">A crack, madam.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALERIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, lay aside your stitchery; I must have you play</div>
                     <div class="line">the idle husewife with me this afternoon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIRGILIA</div>
                     <div class="line">No, good madam; I will not out of doors.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALERIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Not out of doors!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                     <div class="line">She shall, she shall.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIRGILIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Indeed, no, by your patience; I'll not over the</div>
                     <div class="line">threshold till my lord return from the wars.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALERIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Fie, you confine yourself most unreasonably: come,</div>
                     <div class="line">you must go visit the good lady that lies in.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIRGILIA</div>
                     <div class="line">I will wish her speedy strength, and visit her with</div>
                     <div class="line">my prayers; but I cannot go thither.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, I pray you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIRGILIA</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis not to save labour, nor that I want love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALERIA</div>
                     <div class="line">You would be another Penelope: yet, they say, all</div>
                     <div class="line">the yarn she spun in Ulysses' absence did but fill</div>
                     <div class="line">Ithaca full of moths. Come; I would your cambric</div>
                     <div class="line">were sensible as your finger, that you might leave</div>
                     <div class="line">pricking it for pity. Come, you shall go with us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIRGILIA</div>
                     <div class="line">No, good madam, pardon me; indeed, I will not forth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALERIA</div>
                     <div class="line">In truth, la, go with me; and I'll tell you</div>
                     <div class="line">excellent news of your husband.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIRGILIA</div>
                     <div class="line">O, good madam, there can be none yet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALERIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Verily, I do not jest with you; there came news from</div>
                     <div class="line">him last night.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIRGILIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Indeed, madam?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALERIA</div>
                     <div class="line">In earnest, it's true; I heard a senator speak it.</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus it is: the Volsces have an army forth; against</div>
                     <div class="line">whom Cominius the general is gone, with one part of</div>
                     <div class="line">our Roman power: your lord and Titus Lartius are set</div>
                     <div class="line">down before their city Corioli; they nothing doubt</div>
                     <div class="line">prevailing and to make it brief wars. This is true,</div>
                     <div class="line">on mine honour; and so, I pray, go with us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIRGILIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me excuse, good madam; I will obey you in every</div>
                     <div class="line">thing hereafter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Let her alone, lady: as she is now, she will but</div>
                     <div class="line">disease our better mirth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALERIA</div>
                     <div class="line">In troth, I think she would. Fare you well, then.</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, good sweet lady. Prithee, Virgilia, turn thy</div>
                     <div class="line">solemness out o' door. and go along with us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIRGILIA</div>
                     <div class="line">No, at a word, madam; indeed, I must not. I wish</div>
                     <div class="line">you much mirth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALERIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, then, farewell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.5">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>4. SCENE IV.  Before Corioli.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter, with drum and colours, MARCIUS, TITUS
LARTIUS, Captains and Soldiers. To them a
Messenger</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Yonder comes news. A wager they have met.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LARTIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">My horse to yours, no.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis done.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LARTIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Agreed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Say, has our general met the enemy?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">They lie in view; but have not spoke as yet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LARTIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">So, the good horse is mine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll buy him of you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LARTIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">No, I'll nor sell nor give him: lend you him I will</div>
                     <div class="line">For half a hundred years. Summon the town.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">How far off lie these armies?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">Within this mile and half.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Then shall we hear their 'larum, and they ours.</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, Mars, I prithee, make us quick in work,</div>
                     <div class="line">That we with smoking swords may march from hence,</div>
                     <div class="line">To help our fielded friends! Come, blow thy blast.</div>
                     <p>They sound a parley. Enter two Senators with others
on the walls</p>
                     <div class="line">Tutus Aufidius, is he within your walls?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">No, nor a man that fears you less than he,</div>
                     <div class="line">That's lesser than a little.</div>
                     <p>Drums afar off</p>
                     <div class="line">Hark! our drums</div>
                     <div class="line">Are bringing forth our youth. We'll break our walls,</div>
                     <div class="line">Rather than they shall pound us up: our gates,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which yet seem shut, we, have but pinn'd with rushes;</div>
                     <div class="line">They'll open of themselves.</div>
                     <p>Alarum afar off</p>
                     <div class="line">Hark you. far off!</div>
                     <div class="line">There is Aufidius; list, what work he makes</div>
                     <div class="line">Amongst your cloven army.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">O, they are at it!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LARTIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Their noise be our instruction. Ladders, ho!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter the army of the Volsces</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">They fear us not, but issue forth their city.</div>
                     <div class="line">Now put your shields before your hearts, and fight</div>
                     <div class="line">With hearts more proof than shields. Advance,</div>
                     <div class="line">brave Titus:</div>
