               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LARTIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">How often he had met you, sword to sword;</div>
                     <div class="line">That of all things upon the earth he hated</div>
                     <div class="line">Your person most, that he would pawn his fortunes</div>
                     <div class="line">To hopeless restitution, so he might</div>
                     <div class="line">Be call'd your vanquisher.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">At Antium lives he?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LARTIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">At Antium.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I wish I had a cause to seek him there,</div>
                     <div class="line">To oppose his hatred fully. Welcome home.</div>
                     <p>Enter SICINIUS and BRUTUS</p>
                     <div class="line">Behold, these are the tribunes of the people,</div>
                     <div class="line">The tongues o' the common mouth: I do despise them;</div>
                     <div class="line">For they do prank them in authority,</div>
                     <div class="line">Against all noble sufferance.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Pass no further.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Ha! what is that?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">It will be dangerous to go on: no further.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">What makes this change?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">The matter?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath he not pass'd the noble and the common?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Cominius, no.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Have I had children's voices?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">Tribunes, give way; he shall to the market-place.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">The people are incensed against him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Stop,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or all will fall in broil.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Are these your herd?</div>
                     <div class="line">Must these have voices, that can yield them now</div>
                     <div class="line">And straight disclaim their tongues? What are</div>
                     <div class="line">your offices?</div>
                     <div class="line">You being their mouths, why rule you not their teeth?</div>
                     <div class="line">Have you not set them on?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Be calm, be calm.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">It is a purposed thing, and grows by plot,</div>
                     <div class="line">To curb the will of the nobility:</div>
                     <div class="line">Suffer't, and live with such as cannot rule</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor ever will be ruled.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Call't not a plot:</div>
                     <div class="line">The people cry you mock'd them, and of late,</div>
                     <div class="line">When corn was given them gratis, you repined;</div>
                     <div class="line">Scandal'd the suppliants for the people, call'd them</div>
                     <div class="line">Time-pleasers, flatterers, foes to nobleness.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, this was known before.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Not to them all.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Have you inform'd them sithence?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">How! I inform them!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">You are like to do such business.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Not unlike,</div>
                     <div class="line">Each way, to better yours.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Why then should I be consul? By yond clouds,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me deserve so ill as you, and make me</div>
                     <div class="line">Your fellow tribune.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">You show too much of that</div>
                     <div class="line">For which the people stir: if you will pass</div>
                     <div class="line">To where you are bound, you must inquire your way,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which you are out of, with a gentler spirit,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or never be so noble as a consul,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor yoke with him for tribune.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Let's be calm.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">The people are abused; set on. This paltering</div>
                     <div class="line">Becomes not Rome, nor has Coriolanus</div>
                     <div class="line">Deserved this so dishonour'd rub, laid falsely</div>
                     <div class="line">I' the plain way of his merit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell me of corn!</div>
                     <div class="line">This was my speech, and I will speak't again--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Not now, not now.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">Not in this heat, sir, now.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, as I live, I will. My nobler friends,</div>
                     <div class="line">I crave their pardons:</div>
                     <div class="line">For the mutable, rank-scented many, let them</div>
                     <div class="line">Regard me as I do not flatter, and</div>
                     <div class="line">Therein behold themselves: I say again,</div>
                     <div class="line">In soothing them, we nourish 'gainst our senate</div>
                     <div class="line">The cockle of rebellion, insolence, sedition,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which we ourselves have plough'd for, sow'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">and scatter'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">By mingling them with us, the honour'd number,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who lack not virtue, no, nor power, but that</div>
                     <div class="line">Which they have given to beggars.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, no more.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">No more words, we beseech you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">How! no more!</div>
                     <div class="line">As for my country I have shed my blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">Not fearing outward force, so shall my lungs</div>
                     <div class="line">Coin words till their decay against those measles,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which we disdain should tatter us, yet sought</div>
                     <div class="line">The very way to catch them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">You speak o' the people,</div>
                     <div class="line">As if you were a god to punish, not</div>
                     <div class="line">A man of their infirmity.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">'Twere well</div>
                     <div class="line">We let the people know't.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">What, what? his choler?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Choler!</div>
                     <div class="line">Were I as patient as the midnight sleep,</div>
                     <div class="line">By Jove, 'twould be my mind!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">It is a mind</div>
                     <div class="line">That shall remain a poison where it is,</div>
                     <div class="line">Not poison any further.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall remain!</div>
                     <div class="line">Hear you this Triton of the minnows? mark you</div>
                     <div class="line">His absolute 'shall'?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">'Twas from the canon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">'Shall'!</div>
                     <div class="line">O good but most unwise patricians! why,</div>
                     <div class="line">You grave but reckless senators, have you thus</div>
                     <div class="line">Given Hydra here to choose an officer,</div>
                     <div class="line">That with his peremptory 'shall,' being but</div>
                     <div class="line">The horn and noise o' the monster's, wants not spirit</div>
                     <div class="line">To say he'll turn your current in a ditch,</div>
                     <div class="line">And make your channel his? If he have power</div>
                     <div class="line">Then vail your ignorance; if none, awake</div>
                     <div class="line">Your dangerous lenity. If you are learn'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Be not as common fools; if you are not,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let them have cushions by you. You are plebeians,</div>
                     <div class="line">If they be senators: and they are no less,</div>
                     <div class="line">When, both your voices blended, the great'st taste</div>
                     <div class="line">Most palates theirs. They choose their magistrate,</div>
                     <div class="line">And such a one as he, who puts his 'shall,'</div>
                     <div class="line">His popular 'shall' against a graver bench</div>
                     <div class="line">Than ever frown in Greece. By Jove himself!</div>
                     <div class="line">It makes the consuls base: and my soul aches</div>
                     <div class="line">To know, when two authorities are up,</div>
                     <div class="line">Neither supreme, how soon confusion</div>
                     <div class="line">May enter 'twixt the gap of both and take</div>
                     <div class="line">The one by the other.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, on to the market-place.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Whoever gave that counsel, to give forth</div>
                     <div class="line">The corn o' the storehouse gratis, as 'twas used</div>
                     <div class="line">Sometime in Greece,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, well, no more of that.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Though there the people had more absolute power,</div>
                     <div class="line">I say, they nourish'd disobedience, fed</div>
                     <div class="line">The ruin of the state.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, shall the people give</div>
                     <div class="line">One that speaks thus their voice?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll give my reasons,</div>
                     <div class="line">More worthier than their voices. They know the corn</div>
                     <div class="line">Was not our recompense, resting well assured</div>
                     <div class="line">That ne'er did service for't: being press'd to the war,</div>
                     <div class="line">Even when the navel of the state was touch'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">They would not thread the gates. This kind of service</div>
                     <div class="line">Did not deserve corn gratis. Being i' the war</div>
                     <div class="line">Their mutinies and revolts, wherein they show'd</div>
                     <div class="line">Most valour, spoke not for them: the accusation</div>
                     <div class="line">Which they have often made against the senate,</div>
                     <div class="line">All cause unborn, could never be the motive</div>
                     <div class="line">Of our so frank donation. Well, what then?</div>
                     <div class="line">How shall this bisson multitude digest</div>
                     <div class="line">The senate's courtesy? Let deeds express</div>
                     <div class="line">What's like to be their words: 'we did request it;</div>
                     <div class="line">We are the greater poll, and in true fear</div>
                     <div class="line">They gave us our demands.' Thus we debase</div>
                     <div class="line">The nature of our seats and make the rabble</div>
                     <div class="line">Call our cares fears; which will in time</div>
                     <div class="line">Break ope the locks o' the senate and bring in</div>
                     <div class="line">The crows to peck the eagles.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, enough.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Enough, with over-measure.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">No, take more:</div>
                     <div class="line">What may be sworn by, both divine and human,</div>
                     <div class="line">Seal what I end withal! This double worship,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where one part does disdain with cause, the other</div>
                     <div class="line">Insult without all reason, where gentry, title, wisdom,</div>
                     <div class="line">Cannot conclude but by the yea and no</div>
                     <div class="line">Of general ignorance,--it must omit</div>
                     <div class="line">Real necessities, and give way the while</div>
                     <div class="line">To unstable slightness: purpose so barr'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">it follows,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nothing is done to purpose. Therefore, beseech you,--</div>
                     <div class="line">You that will be less fearful than discreet,</div>
                     <div class="line">That love the fundamental part of state</div>
                     <div class="line">More than you doubt the change on't, that prefer</div>
                     <div class="line">A noble life before a long, and wish</div>
                     <div class="line">To jump a body with a dangerous physic</div>
                     <div class="line">That's sure of death without it, at once pluck out</div>
                     <div class="line">The multitudinous tongue; let them not lick</div>
                     <div class="line">The sweet which is their poison: your dishonour</div>
                     <div class="line">Mangles true judgment and bereaves the state</div>
                     <div class="line">Of that integrity which should become't,</div>
                     <div class="line">Not having the power to do the good it would,</div>
                     <div class="line">For the in which doth control't.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Has said enough.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Has spoken like a traitor, and shall answer</div>
                     <div class="line">As traitors do.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou wretch, despite o'erwhelm thee!</div>
                     <div class="line">What should the people do with these bald tribunes?</div>
                     <div class="line">On whom depending, their obedience fails</div>
                     <div class="line">To the greater bench: in a rebellion,</div>
                     <div class="line">When what's not meet, but what must be, was law,</div>
                     <div class="line">Then were they chosen: in a better hour,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let what is meet be said it must be meet,</div>
                     <div class="line">And throw their power i' the dust.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Manifest treason!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">This a consul? no.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">The aediles, ho!</div>
                     <p>Enter an AEdile</p>
                     <div class="line">Let him be apprehended.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, call the people:</div>
                     <p>Exit AEdile</p>
                     <div class="line">in whose name myself</div>
                     <div class="line">Attach thee as a traitorous innovator,</div>
                     <div class="line">A foe to the public weal: obey, I charge thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">And follow to thine answer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Hence, old goat!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Senators, &C</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll surety him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Aged sir, hands off.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Hence, rotten thing! or I shall shake thy bones</div>
                     <div class="line">Out of thy garments.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Help, ye citizens!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter a rabble of Citizens (Plebeians), with
the AEdiles</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">On both sides more respect.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Here's he that would take from you all your power.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Seize him, AEdiles!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Citizens</div>
                     <div class="line">Down with him! down with him!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Senators, &C</div>
                     <div class="line">Weapons, weapons, weapons!</div>
                     <p>They all bustle about CORIOLANUS, crying</p>
                     <div class="line">'Tribunes!' 'Patricians!' 'Citizens!' 'What, ho!'</div>
                     <div class="line">'Sicinius!' 'Brutus!' 'Coriolanus!' 'Citizens!'</div>
                     <div class="line">'Peace, peace, peace!' 'Stay, hold, peace!'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">What is about to be? I am out of breath;</div>
                     <div class="line">Confusion's near; I cannot speak. You, tribunes</div>
                     <div class="line">To the people! Coriolanus, patience!</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak, good Sicinius.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Hear me, people; peace!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Citizens</div>
                     <div class="line">Let's hear our tribune: peace Speak, speak, speak.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">You are at point to lose your liberties:</div>
                     <div class="line">Marcius would have all from you; Marcius,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whom late you have named for consul.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Fie, fie, fie!</div>
                     <div class="line">This is the way to kindle, not to quench.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">To unbuild the city and to lay all flat.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">What is the city but the people?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Citizens</div>
                     <div class="line">True,</div>
                     <div class="line">The people are the city.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">By the consent of all, we were establish'd</div>
                     <div class="line">The people's magistrates.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Citizens</div>
                     <div class="line">You so remain.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">And so are like to do.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">That is the way to lay the city flat;</div>
                     <div class="line">To bring the roof to the foundation,</div>
                     <div class="line">And bury all, which yet distinctly ranges,</div>
                     <div class="line">In heaps and piles of ruin.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">This deserves death.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Or let us stand to our authority,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or let us lose it. We do here pronounce,</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon the part o' the people, in whose power</div>
                     <div class="line">We were elected theirs, Marcius is worthy</div>
                     <div class="line">Of present death.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore lay hold of him;</div>
                     <div class="line">Bear him to the rock Tarpeian, and from thence</div>
                     <div class="line">Into destruction cast him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">AEdiles, seize him!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Citizens</div>
                     <div class="line">Yield, Marcius, yield!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Hear me one word;</div>
                     <div class="line">Beseech you, tribunes, hear me but a word.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AEdile</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace, peace!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>To BRUTUS</span>  Be that you seem, truly your</div>
                     <div class="line">country's friend,</div>
                     <div class="line">And temperately proceed to what you would</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus violently redress.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, those cold ways,</div>
                     <div class="line">That seem like prudent helps, are very poisonous</div>
                     <div class="line">Where the disease is violent. Lay hands upon him,</div>
                     <div class="line">And bear him to the rock.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">No, I'll die here.</div>
                     <p>Drawing his sword</p>
                     <div class="line">There's some among you have beheld me fighting:</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, try upon yourselves what you have seen me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Down with that sword! Tribunes, withdraw awhile.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Lay hands upon him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Help Marcius, help,</div>
                     <div class="line">You that be noble; help him, young and old!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Citizens</div>
                     <div class="line">Down with him, down with him!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>In this mutiny, the Tribunes, the AEdiles, and the
People, are beat in</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, get you to your house; be gone, away!</div>
                     <div class="line">All will be naught else.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">Get you gone.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Stand fast;</div>
                     <div class="line">We have as many friends as enemies.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Sham it be put to that?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">The gods forbid!</div>
                     <div class="line">I prithee, noble friend, home to thy house;</div>
                     <div class="line">Leave us to cure this cause.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">For 'tis a sore upon us,</div>
                     <div class="line">You cannot tent yourself: be gone, beseech you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, sir, along with us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I would they were barbarians--as they are,</div>
                     <div class="line">Though in Rome litter'd--not Romans--as they are not,</div>
                     <div class="line">Though calved i' the porch o' the Capitol--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Be gone;</div>
                     <div class="line">Put not your worthy rage into your tongue;</div>
                     <div class="line">One time will owe another.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">On fair ground</div>
                     <div class="line">I could beat forty of them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I could myself</div>
                     <div class="line">Take up a brace o' the best of them; yea, the</div>
                     <div class="line">two tribunes:</div>
                     <div class="line">But now 'tis odds beyond arithmetic;</div>
                     <div class="line">And manhood is call'd foolery, when it stands</div>
                     <div class="line">Against a falling fabric. Will you hence,</div>
                     <div class="line">Before the tag return? whose rage doth rend</div>
                     <div class="line">Like interrupted waters and o'erbear</div>
                     <div class="line">What they are used to bear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Pray you, be gone:</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll try whether my old wit be in request</div>
                     <div class="line">With those that have but little: this must be patch'd</div>
                     <div class="line">With cloth of any colour.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, come away.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt CORIOLANUS, COMINIUS, and others</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">A Patrician</div>
                     <div class="line">This man has marr'd his fortune.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">His nature is too noble for the world:</div>
                     <div class="line">He would not flatter Neptune for his trident,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or Jove for's power to thunder. His heart's his mouth:</div>
                     <div class="line">What his breast forges, that his tongue must vent;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, being angry, does forget that ever</div>
                     <div class="line">He heard the name of death.</div>
                     <p>A noise within</p>
                     <div class="line">Here's goodly work!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Patrician</div>
                     <div class="line">I would they were abed!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I would they were in Tiber! What the vengeance!</div>
                     <div class="line">Could he not speak 'em fair?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter BRUTUS and SICINIUS, with the rabble</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Where is this viper</div>
                     <div class="line">That would depopulate the city and</div>
                     <div class="line">Be every man himself?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">You worthy tribunes,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">He shall be thrown down the Tarpeian rock</div>
                     <div class="line">With rigorous hands: he hath resisted law,</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore law shall scorn him further trial</div>
                     <div class="line">Than the severity of the public power</div>
                     <div class="line">Which he so sets at nought.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">He shall well know</div>
                     <div class="line">The noble tribunes are the people's mouths,</div>
                     <div class="line">And we their hands.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Citizens</div>
                     <div class="line">He shall, sure on't.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, sir,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Do not cry havoc, where you should but hunt</div>
                     <div class="line">With modest warrant.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, how comes't that you</div>
                     <div class="line">Have holp to make this rescue?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Hear me speak:</div>
                     <div class="line">As I do know the consul's worthiness,</div>
                     <div class="line">So can I name his faults,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Consul! what consul?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">The consul Coriolanus.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">He consul!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Citizens</div>
                     <div class="line">No, no, no, no, no.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">If, by the tribunes' leave, and yours, good people,</div>
                     <div class="line">I may be heard, I would crave a word or two;</div>
                     <div class="line">The which shall turn you to no further harm</div>
                     <div class="line">Than so much loss of time.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak briefly then;</div>
                     <div class="line">For we are peremptory to dispatch</div>
                     <div class="line">This viperous traitor: to eject him hence</div>
                     <div class="line">Were but one danger, and to keep him here</div>
                     <div class="line">Our certain death: therefore it is decreed</div>
                     <div class="line">He dies to-night.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Now the good gods forbid</div>
                     <div class="line">That our renowned Rome, whose gratitude</div>
                     <div class="line">Towards her deserved children is enroll'd</div>
                     <div class="line">In Jove's own book, like an unnatural dam</div>
                     <div class="line">Should now eat up her own!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">He's a disease that must be cut away.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">O, he's a limb that has but a disease;</div>
                     <div class="line">Mortal, to cut it off; to cure it, easy.</div>
                     <div class="line">What has he done to Rome that's worthy death?</div>
                     <div class="line">Killing our enemies, the blood he hath lost--</div>
                     <div class="line">Which, I dare vouch, is more than that he hath,</div>
                     <div class="line">By many an ounce--he dropp'd it for his country;</div>
                     <div class="line">And what is left, to lose it by his country,</div>
                     <div class="line">Were to us all, that do't and suffer it,</div>
                     <div class="line">A brand to the end o' the world.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">This is clean kam.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Merely awry: when he did love his country,</div>
                     <div class="line">It honour'd him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">The service of the foot</div>
                     <div class="line">Being once gangrened, is not then respected</div>
                     <div class="line">For what before it was.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll hear no more.</div>
                     <div class="line">Pursue him to his house, and pluck him thence:</div>
                     <div class="line">Lest his infection, being of catching nature,</div>
                     <div class="line">Spread further.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">One word more, one word.</div>
                     <div class="line">This tiger-footed rage, when it shall find</div>
                     <div class="line">The harm of unscann'd swiftness, will too late</div>
                     <div class="line">Tie leaden pounds to's heels. Proceed by process;</div>
                     <div class="line">Lest parties, as he is beloved, break out,</div>
                     <div class="line">And sack great Rome with Romans.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">If it were so,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">What do ye talk?</div>
                     <div class="line">Have we not had a taste of his obedience?</div>
                     <div class="line">Our aediles smote? ourselves resisted? Come.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Consider this: he has been bred i' the wars</div>
                     <div class="line">Since he could draw a sword, and is ill school'd</div>
                     <div class="line">In bolted language; meal and bran together</div>
                     <div class="line">He throws without distinction. Give me leave,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll go to him, and undertake to bring him</div>
                     <div class="line">Where he shall answer, by a lawful form,</div>
                     <div class="line">In peace, to his utmost peril.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">Noble tribunes,</div>
                     <div class="line">It is the humane way: the other course</div>
                     <div class="line">Will prove too bloody, and the end of it</div>
                     <div class="line">Unknown to the beginning.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Noble Menenius,</div>
                     <div class="line">Be you then as the people's officer.</div>
                     <div class="line">Masters, lay down your weapons.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Go not home.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Meet on the market-place. We'll attend you there:</div>
                     <div class="line">Where, if you bring not Marcius, we'll proceed</div>
                     <div class="line">In our first way.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll bring him to you.</div>
                     <p>To the Senators</p>
                     <div class="line">Let me desire your company: he must come,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or what is worst will follow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">Pray you, let's to him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  A room in CORIOLANUS'S house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter CORIOLANUS with Patricians</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Let them puff all about mine ears, present me</div>
                     <div class="line">Death on the wheel or at wild horses' heels,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or pile ten hills on the Tarpeian rock,</div>
                     <div class="line">That the precipitation might down stretch</div>
                     <div class="line">Below the beam of sight, yet will I still</div>
                     <div class="line">Be thus to them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">A Patrician</div>
                     <div class="line">You do the nobler.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I muse my mother</div>
                     <div class="line">Does not approve me further, who was wont</div>
                     <div class="line">To call them woollen vassals, things created</div>
                     <div class="line">To buy and sell with groats, to show bare heads</div>
                     <div class="line">In congregations, to yawn, be still and wonder,</div>
                     <div class="line">When one but of my ordinance stood up</div>
                     <div class="line">To speak of peace or war.</div>
                     <p>Enter VOLUMNIA</p>
                     <div class="line">I talk of you:</div>
                     <div class="line">Why did you wish me milder? would you have me</div>
                     <div class="line">False to my nature? Rather say I play</div>
                     <div class="line">The man I am.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                     <div class="line">O, sir, sir, sir,</div>
                     <div class="line">I would have had you put your power well on,</div>
                     <div class="line">Before you had worn it out.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Let go.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                     <div class="line">You might have been enough the man you are,</div>
                     <div class="line">With striving less to be so; lesser had been</div>
                     <div class="line">The thwartings of your dispositions, if</div>
                     <div class="line">You had not show'd them how ye were disposed</div>
                     <div class="line">Ere they lack'd power to cross you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Let them hang.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">A Patrician</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, and burn too.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter MENENIUS and Senators</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, come, you have been too rough, something</div>
                     <div class="line">too rough;</div>
                     <div class="line">You must return and mend it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">There's no remedy;</div>
                     <div class="line">Unless, by not so doing, our good city</div>
                     <div class="line">Cleave in the midst, and perish.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Pray, be counsell'd:</div>
                     <div class="line">I have a heart as little apt as yours,</div>
                     <div class="line">But yet a brain that leads my use of anger</div>
                     <div class="line">To better vantage.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Well said, noble woman?</div>
                     <div class="line">Before he should thus stoop to the herd, but that</div>
                     <div class="line">The violent fit o' the time craves it as physic</div>
                     <div class="line">For the whole state, I would put mine armour on,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which I can scarcely bear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">What must I do?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Return to the tribunes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, what then? what then?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Repent what you have spoke.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">For them! I cannot do it to the gods;</div>
                     <div class="line">Must I then do't to them?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                     <div class="line">You are too absolute;</div>
                     <div class="line">Though therein you can never be too noble,</div>
                     <div class="line">But when extremities speak. I have heard you say,</div>
                     <div class="line">Honour and policy, like unsever'd friends,</div>
                     <div class="line">I' the war do grow together: grant that, and tell me,</div>
                     <div class="line">In peace what each of them by the other lose,</div>
                     <div class="line">That they combine not there.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Tush, tush!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">A good demand.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                     <div class="line">If it be honour in your wars to seem</div>
                     <div class="line">The same you are not, which, for your best ends,</div>
                     <div class="line">You adopt your policy, how is it less or worse,</div>
                     <div class="line">That it shall hold companionship in peace</div>
                     <div class="line">With honour, as in war, since that to both</div>
                     <div class="line">It stands in like request?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Why force you this?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Because that now it lies you on to speak</div>
                     <div class="line">To the people; not by your own instruction,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor by the matter which your heart prompts you,</div>
                     <div class="line">But with such words that are but rooted in</div>
                     <div class="line">Your tongue, though but bastards and syllables</div>
                     <div class="line">Of no allowance to your bosom's truth.</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, this no more dishonours you at all</div>
                     <div class="line">Than to take in a town with gentle words,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which else would put you to your fortune and</div>
                     <div class="line">The hazard of much blood.</div>
                     <div class="line">I would dissemble with my nature where</div>
                     <div class="line">My fortunes and my friends at stake required</div>
                     <div class="line">I should do so in honour: I am in this,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your wife, your son, these senators, the nobles;</div>
                     <div class="line">And you will rather show our general louts</div>
                     <div class="line">How you can frown than spend a fawn upon 'em,</div>
                     <div class="line">For the inheritance of their loves and safeguard</div>
                     <div class="line">Of what that want might ruin.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Noble lady!</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, go with us; speak fair: you may salve so,</div>
                     <div class="line">Not what is dangerous present, but the loss</div>
                     <div class="line">Of what is past.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                     <div class="line">I prithee now, my son,</div>
                     <div class="line">Go to them, with this bonnet in thy hand;</div>
                     <div class="line">And thus far having stretch'd it--here be with them--</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy knee bussing the stones--for in such business</div>
                     <div class="line">Action is eloquence, and the eyes of the ignorant</div>
                     <div class="line">More learned than the ears--waving thy head,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which often, thus, correcting thy stout heart,</div>
                     <div class="line">Now humble as the ripest mulberry</div>
                     <div class="line">That will not hold the handling: or say to them,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art their soldier, and being bred in broils</div>
                     <div class="line">Hast not the soft way which, thou dost confess,</div>
                     <div class="line">Were fit for thee to use as they to claim,</div>
                     <div class="line">In asking their good loves, but thou wilt frame</div>
                     <div class="line">Thyself, forsooth, hereafter theirs, so far</div>
                     <div class="line">As thou hast power and person.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">This but done,</div>
                     <div class="line">Even as she speaks, why, their hearts were yours;</div>
                     <div class="line">For they have pardons, being ask'd, as free</div>
                     <div class="line">As words to little purpose.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Prithee now,</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, and be ruled: although I know thou hadst rather</div>
                     <div class="line">Follow thine enemy in a fiery gulf</div>
                     <div class="line">Than flatter him in a bower. Here is Cominius.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter COMINIUS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I have been i' the market-place; and, sir,'tis fit</div>
                     <div class="line">You make strong party, or defend yourself</div>
                     <div class="line">By calmness or by absence: all's in anger.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Only fair speech.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I think 'twill serve, if he</div>
                     <div class="line">Can thereto frame his spirit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                     <div class="line">He must, and will</div>
                     <div class="line">Prithee now, say you will, and go about it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Must I go show them my unbarbed sconce?</div>
                     <div class="line">Must I with base tongue give my noble heart</div>
                     <div class="line">A lie that it must bear? Well, I will do't:</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet, were there but this single plot to lose,</div>
                     <div class="line">This mould of Marcius, they to dust should grind it</div>
                     <div class="line">And throw't against the wind. To the market-place!</div>
                     <div class="line">You have put me now to such a part which never</div>
                     <div class="line">I shall discharge to the life.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, come, we'll prompt you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                     <div class="line">I prithee now, sweet son, as thou hast said</div>
                     <div class="line">My praises made thee first a soldier, so,</div>
                     <div class="line">To have my praise for this, perform a part</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou hast not done before.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, I must do't:</div>
                     <div class="line">Away, my disposition, and possess me</div>
                     <div class="line">Some harlot's spirit! my throat of war be turn'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which quired with my drum, into a pipe</div>
                     <div class="line">Small as an eunuch, or the virgin voice</div>
                     <div class="line">That babies lulls asleep! the smiles of knaves</div>
                     <div class="line">Tent in my cheeks, and schoolboys' tears take up</div>
                     <div class="line">The glasses of my sight! a beggar's tongue</div>
                     <div class="line">Make motion through my lips, and my arm'd knees,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who bow'd but in my stirrup, bend like his</div>
                     <div class="line">That hath received an alms! I will not do't,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lest I surcease to honour mine own truth</div>
                     <div class="line">And by my body's action teach my mind</div>
                     <div class="line">A most inherent baseness.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                     <div class="line">At thy choice, then:</div>
                     <div class="line">To beg of thee, it is my more dishonour</div>
                     <div class="line">Than thou of them. Come all to ruin; let</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy mother rather feel thy pride than fear</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy dangerous stoutness, for I mock at death</div>
                     <div class="line">With as big heart as thou. Do as thou list</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy valiantness was mine, thou suck'dst it from me,</div>
                     <div class="line">But owe thy pride thyself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Pray, be content:</div>
                     <div class="line">Mother, I am going to the market-place;</div>
                     <div class="line">Chide me no more. I'll mountebank their loves,</div>
