                     <div class="line">Than when I first my wedded mistress saw</div>
                     <div class="line">Bestride my threshold. Why, thou Mars! I tell thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">We have a power on foot; and I had purpose</div>
                     <div class="line">Once more to hew thy target from thy brawn,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or lose mine arm fort: thou hast beat me out</div>
                     <div class="line">Twelve several times, and I have nightly since</div>
                     <div class="line">Dreamt of encounters 'twixt thyself and me;</div>
                     <div class="line">We have been down together in my sleep,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unbuckling helms, fisting each other's throat,</div>
                     <div class="line">And waked half dead with nothing. Worthy Marcius,</div>
                     <div class="line">Had we no quarrel else to Rome, but that</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art thence banish'd, we would muster all</div>
                     <div class="line">From twelve to seventy, and pouring war</div>
                     <div class="line">Into the bowels of ungrateful Rome,</div>
                     <div class="line">Like a bold flood o'er-bear. O, come, go in,</div>
                     <div class="line">And take our friendly senators by the hands;</div>
                     <div class="line">Who now are here, taking their leaves of me,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who am prepared against your territories,</div>
                     <div class="line">Though not for Rome itself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">You bless me, gods!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore, most absolute sir, if thou wilt have</div>
                     <div class="line">The leading of thine own revenges, take</div>
                     <div class="line">The one half of my commission; and set down--</div>
                     <div class="line">As best thou art experienced, since thou know'st</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy country's strength and weakness,--thine own ways;</div>
                     <div class="line">Whether to knock against the gates of Rome,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or rudely visit them in parts remote,</div>
                     <div class="line">To fright them, ere destroy. But come in:</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me commend thee first to those that shall</div>
                     <div class="line">Say yea to thy desires. A thousand welcomes!</div>
                     <div class="line">And more a friend than e'er an enemy;</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet, Marcius, that was much. Your hand: most welcome!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt CORIOLANUS and AUFIDIUS. The two
Servingmen come forward</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Servingman</div>
                     <div class="line">Here's a strange alteration!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Servingman</div>
                     <div class="line">By my hand, I had thought to have strucken him with</div>
                     <div class="line">a cudgel; and yet my mind gave me his clothes made a</div>
                     <div class="line">false report of him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Servingman</div>
                     <div class="line">What an arm he has! he turned me about with his</div>
                     <div class="line">finger and his thumb, as one would set up a top.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Servingman</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, I knew by his face that there was something in</div>
                     <div class="line">him: he had, sir, a kind of face, methought,--I</div>
                     <div class="line">cannot tell how to term it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Servingman</div>
                     <div class="line">He had so; looking as it were--would I were hanged,</div>
                     <div class="line">but I thought there was more in him than I could think.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Servingman</div>
                     <div class="line">So did I, I'll be sworn: he is simply the rarest</div>
                     <div class="line">man i' the world.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Servingman</div>
                     <div class="line">I think he is: but a greater soldier than he you wot on.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Servingman</div>
                     <div class="line">Who, my master?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Servingman</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, it's no matter for that.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Servingman</div>
                     <div class="line">Worth six on him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Servingman</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, not so neither: but I take him to be the</div>
                     <div class="line">greater soldier.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Servingman</div>
                     <div class="line">Faith, look you, one cannot tell how to say that:</div>
                     <div class="line">for the defence of a town, our general is excellent.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Servingman</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, and for an assault too.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter third Servingman</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Servingman</div>
                     <div class="line">O slaves, I can tell you news,-- news, you rascals!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Servingman</div>
                     <div class="speaker">Second Servingman</div>
                     <div class="line">What, what, what? let's partake.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Servingman</div>
                     <div class="line">I would not be a Roman, of all nations; I had as</div>
                     <div class="line">lieve be a condemned man.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Servingman</div>
                     <div class="speaker">Second Servingman</div>
                     <div class="line">Wherefore? wherefore?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Servingman</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, here's he that was wont to thwack our general,</div>
                     <div class="line">Caius Marcius.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Servingman</div>
                     <div class="line">Why do you say 'thwack our general '?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Servingman</div>
                     <div class="line">I do not say 'thwack our general;' but he was always</div>
                     <div class="line">good enough for him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Servingman</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, we are fellows and friends: he was ever too</div>
                     <div class="line">hard for him; I have heard him say so himself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Servingman</div>
                     <div class="line">He was too hard for him directly, to say the troth</div>
                     <div class="line">on't: before Corioli he scotched him and notched</div>
                     <div class="line">him like a carbon ado.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Servingman</div>
                     <div class="line">An he had been cannibally given, he might have</div>
                     <div class="line">broiled and eaten him too.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Servingman</div>
                     <div class="line">But, more of thy news?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Servingman</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, he is so made on here within, as if he were son</div>
                     <div class="line">and heir to Mars; set at upper end o' the table; no</div>
                     <div class="line">question asked him by any of the senators, but they</div>
                     <div class="line">stand bald before him: our general himself makes a</div>
                     <div class="line">mistress of him: sanctifies himself with's hand and</div>
                     <div class="line">turns up the white o' the eye to his discourse. But</div>
                     <div class="line">the bottom of the news is that our general is cut i'</div>
                     <div class="line">the middle and but one half of what he was</div>
                     <div class="line">yesterday; for the other has half, by the entreaty</div>
                     <div class="line">and grant of the whole table. He'll go, he says,</div>
                     <div class="line">and sowl the porter of Rome gates by the ears: he</div>
                     <div class="line">will mow all down before him, and leave his passage polled.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Servingman</div>
                     <div class="line">And he's as like to do't as any man I can imagine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Servingman</div>
                     <div class="line">Do't! he will do't; for, look you, sir, he has as</div>
                     <div class="line">many friends as enemies; which friends, sir, as it</div>
                     <div class="line">were, durst not, look you, sir, show themselves, as</div>
                     <div class="line">we term it, his friends whilst he's in directitude.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Servingman</div>
                     <div class="line">Directitude! what's that?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Servingman</div>
                     <div class="line">But when they shall see, sir, his crest up again,</div>
                     <div class="line">and the man in blood, they will out of their</div>
                     <div class="line">burrows, like conies after rain, and revel all with</div>
                     <div class="line">him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Servingman</div>
                     <div class="line">But when goes this forward?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Servingman</div>
                     <div class="line">To-morrow; to-day; presently; you shall have the</div>
                     <div class="line">drum struck up this afternoon: 'tis, as it were, a</div>
                     <div class="line">parcel of their feast, and to be executed ere they</div>
                     <div class="line">wipe their lips.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Servingman</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, then we shall have a stirring world again.</div>
                     <div class="line">This peace is nothing, but to rust iron, increase</div>
                     <div class="line">tailors, and breed ballad-makers.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Servingman</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me have war, say I; it exceeds peace as far as</div>
                     <div class="line">day does night; it's spritely, waking, audible, and</div>
                     <div class="line">full of vent. Peace is a very apoplexy, lethargy;</div>
                     <div class="line">mulled, deaf, sleepy, insensible; a getter of more</div>
                     <div class="line">bastard children than war's a destroyer of men.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Servingman</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis so: and as war, in some sort, may be said to</div>
                     <div class="line">be a ravisher, so it cannot be denied but peace is a</div>
                     <div class="line">great maker of cuckolds.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Servingman</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, and it makes men hate one another.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Servingman</div>
                     <div class="line">Reason; because they then less need one another.</div>
                     <div class="line">The wars for my money. I hope to see Romans as cheap</div>
                     <div class="line">as Volscians. They are rising, they are rising.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">All</div>
                     <div class="line">In, in, in, in!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.7">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>6. SCENE VI.  Rome. A public place.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter SICINIUS and BRUTUS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">We hear not of him, neither need we fear him;</div>
                     <div class="line">His remedies are tame i' the present peace</div>
                     <div class="line">And quietness of the people, which before</div>
                     <div class="line">Were in wild hurry. Here do we make his friends</div>
                     <div class="line">Blush that the world goes well, who rather had,</div>
                     <div class="line">Though they themselves did suffer by't, behold</div>
                     <div class="line">Dissentious numbers pestering streets than see</div>
                     <div class="line">Our tradesmen with in their shops and going</div>
                     <div class="line">About their functions friendly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">We stood to't in good time.</div>
                     <p>Enter MENENIUS</p>
                     <div class="line">Is this Menenius?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis he,'tis he: O, he is grown most kind of late.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Both Tribunes</div>
                     <div class="line">Hail sir!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Hail to you both!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Your Coriolanus</div>
                     <div class="line">Is not much miss'd, but with his friends:</div>
                     <div class="line">The commonwealth doth stand, and so would do,</div>
                     <div class="line">Were he more angry at it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">All's well; and might have been much better, if</div>
                     <div class="line">He could have temporized.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Where is he, hear you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, I hear nothing: his mother and his wife</div>
                     <div class="line">Hear nothing from him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter three or four Citizens</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Citizens</div>
                     <div class="line">The gods preserve you both!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">God-den, our neighbours.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">God-den to you all, god-den to you all.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">Ourselves, our wives, and children, on our knees,</div>
                     <div class="line">Are bound to pray for you both.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Live, and thrive!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell, kind neighbours: we wish'd Coriolanus</div>
                     <div class="line">Had loved you as we did.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Citizens</div>
                     <div class="line">Now the gods keep you!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Both Tribunes</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell, farewell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt Citizens</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">This is a happier and more comely time</div>
                     <div class="line">Than when these fellows ran about the streets,</div>
                     <div class="line">Crying confusion.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Caius Marcius was</div>
                     <div class="line">A worthy officer i' the war; but insolent,</div>
                     <div class="line">O'ercome with pride, ambitious past all thinking,</div>
                     <div class="line">Self-loving,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">And affecting one sole throne,</div>
                     <div class="line">Without assistance.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I think not so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">We should by this, to all our lamentation,</div>
                     <div class="line">If he had gone forth consul, found it so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">The gods have well prevented it, and Rome</div>
                     <div class="line">Sits safe and still without him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter an AEdile</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AEdile</div>
                     <div class="line">Worthy tribunes,</div>
                     <div class="line">There is a slave, whom we have put in prison,</div>
                     <div class="line">Reports, the Volsces with two several powers</div>
                     <div class="line">Are enter'd in the Roman territories,</div>
                     <div class="line">And with the deepest malice of the war</div>
                     <div class="line">Destroy what lies before 'em.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis Aufidius,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who, hearing of our Marcius' banishment,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thrusts forth his horns again into the world;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which were inshell'd when Marcius stood for Rome,</div>
                     <div class="line">And durst not once peep out.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, what talk you</div>
                     <div class="line">Of Marcius?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Go see this rumourer whipp'd. It cannot be</div>
                     <div class="line">The Volsces dare break with us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Cannot be!</div>
                     <div class="line">We have record that very well it can,</div>
                     <div class="line">And three examples of the like have been</div>
                     <div class="line">Within my age. But reason with the fellow,</div>
                     <div class="line">Before you punish him, where he heard this,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lest you shall chance to whip your information</div>
                     <div class="line">And beat the messenger who bids beware</div>
                     <div class="line">Of what is to be dreaded.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell not me:</div>
                     <div class="line">I know this cannot be.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Not possible.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter a Messenger</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">The nobles in great earnestness are going</div>
                     <div class="line">All to the senate-house: some news is come</div>
                     <div class="line">That turns their countenances.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis this slave;--</div>
                     <div class="line">Go whip him, 'fore the people's eyes:--his raising;</div>
                     <div class="line">Nothing but his report.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, worthy sir,</div>
                     <div class="line">The slave's report is seconded; and more,</div>
                     <div class="line">More fearful, is deliver'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">What more fearful?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">It is spoke freely out of many mouths--</div>
                     <div class="line">How probable I do not know--that Marcius,</div>
                     <div class="line">Join'd with Aufidius, leads a power 'gainst Rome,</div>
                     <div class="line">And vows revenge as spacious as between</div>
                     <div class="line">The young'st and oldest thing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">This is most likely!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Raised only, that the weaker sort may wish</div>
                     <div class="line">Good Marcius home again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">The very trick on't.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">This is unlikely:</div>
                     <div class="line">He and Aufidius can no more atone</div>
                     <div class="line">Than violentest contrariety.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter a second Messenger</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">You are sent for to the senate:</div>
                     <div class="line">A fearful army, led by Caius Marcius</div>
                     <div class="line">Associated with Aufidius, rages</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon our territories; and have already</div>
                     <div class="line">O'erborne their way, consumed with fire, and took</div>
                     <div class="line">What lay before them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter COMINIUS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">O, you have made good work!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">What news? what news?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">You have holp to ravish your own daughters and</div>
                     <div class="line">To melt the city leads upon your pates,</div>
                     <div class="line">To see your wives dishonour'd to your noses,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">What's the news? what's the news?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Your temples burned in their cement, and</div>
                     <div class="line">Your franchises, whereon you stood, confined</div>
                     <div class="line">Into an auger's bore.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Pray now, your news?</div>
                     <div class="line">You have made fair work, I fear me.--Pray, your news?--</div>
                     <div class="line">If Marcius should be join'd with Volscians,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">If!</div>
                     <div class="line">He is their god: he leads them like a thing</div>
                     <div class="line">Made by some other deity than nature,</div>
                     <div class="line">That shapes man better; and they follow him,</div>
                     <div class="line">Against us brats, with no less confidence</div>
                     <div class="line">Than boys pursuing summer butterflies,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or butchers killing flies.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">You have made good work,</div>
                     <div class="line">You and your apron-men; you that stood so up much</div>
                     <div class="line">on the voice of occupation and</div>
                     <div class="line">The breath of garlic-eaters!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">He will shake</div>
                     <div class="line">Your Rome about your ears.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">As Hercules</div>
                     <div class="line">Did shake down mellow fruit.</div>
                     <div class="line">You have made fair work!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">But is this true, sir?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay; and you'll look pale</div>
                     <div class="line">Before you find it other. All the regions</div>
                     <div class="line">Do smilingly revolt; and who resist</div>
                     <div class="line">Are mock'd for valiant ignorance,</div>
                     <div class="line">And perish constant fools. Who is't can blame him?</div>
                     <div class="line">Your enemies and his find something in him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">We are all undone, unless</div>
                     <div class="line">The noble man have mercy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Who shall ask it?</div>
                     <div class="line">The tribunes cannot do't for shame; the people</div>
                     <div class="line">Deserve such pity of him as the wolf</div>
                     <div class="line">Does of the shepherds: for his best friends, if they</div>
                     <div class="line">Should say 'Be good to Rome,' they charged him even</div>
                     <div class="line">As those should do that had deserved his hate,</div>
                     <div class="line">And therein show'd like enemies.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis true:</div>
                     <div class="line">If he were putting to my house the brand</div>
                     <div class="line">That should consume it, I have not the face</div>
                     <div class="line">To say 'Beseech you, cease.' You have made fair hands,</div>
                     <div class="line">You and your crafts! you have crafted fair!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">You have brought</div>
                     <div class="line">A trembling upon Rome, such as was never</div>
                     <div class="line">So incapable of help.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Both Tribunes</div>
                     <div class="line">Say not we brought it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">How! Was it we? we loved him but, like beasts</div>
                     <div class="line">And cowardly nobles, gave way unto your clusters,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who did hoot him out o' the city.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">But I fear</div>
                     <div class="line">They'll roar him in again. Tullus Aufidius,</div>
                     <div class="line">The second name of men, obeys his points</div>
                     <div class="line">As if he were his officer: desperation</div>
                     <div class="line">Is all the policy, strength and defence,</div>
                     <div class="line">That Rome can make against them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter a troop of Citizens</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Here come the clusters.</div>
                     <div class="line">And is Aufidius with him? You are they</div>
                     <div class="line">That made the air unwholesome, when you cast</div>
                     <div class="line">Your stinking greasy caps in hooting at</div>
                     <div class="line">Coriolanus' exile. Now he's coming;</div>
                     <div class="line">And not a hair upon a soldier's head</div>
                     <div class="line">Which will not prove a whip: as many coxcombs</div>
                     <div class="line">As you threw caps up will he tumble down,</div>
                     <div class="line">And pay you for your voices. 'Tis no matter;</div>
                     <div class="line">if he could burn us all into one coal,</div>
                     <div class="line">We have deserved it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Citizens</div>
                     <div class="line">Faith, we hear fearful news.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">For mine own part,</div>
                     <div class="line">When I said, banish him, I said 'twas pity.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">And so did I.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">And so did I; and, to say the truth, so did very</div>
                     <div class="line">many of us: that we did, we did for the best; and</div>
                     <div class="line">though we willingly consented to his banishment, yet</div>
                     <div class="line">it was against our will.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Ye re goodly things, you voices!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">You have made</div>
                     <div class="line">Good work, you and your cry! Shall's to the Capitol?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">O, ay, what else?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt COMINIUS and MENENIUS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, masters, get you home; be not dismay'd:</div>
                     <div class="line">These are a side that would be glad to have</div>
                     <div class="line">This true which they so seem to fear. Go home,</div>
                     <div class="line">And show no sign of fear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">The gods be good to us! Come, masters, let's home.</div>
                     <div class="line">I ever said we were i' the wrong when we banished</div>
                     <div class="line">him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">So did we all. But, come, let's home.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt Citizens</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I do not like this news.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor I.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Let's to the Capitol. Would half my wealth</div>
                     <div class="line">Would buy this for a lie!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Pray, let us go.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.8">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>7. SCENE VII.  A camp, at a small distance from Rome.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter AUFIDIUS and his Lieutenant</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Do they still fly to the Roman?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lieutenant</div>
                     <div class="line">I do not know what witchcraft's in him, but</div>
                     <div class="line">Your soldiers use him as the grace 'fore meat,</div>
                     <div class="line">Their talk at table, and their thanks at end;</div>
                     <div class="line">And you are darken'd in this action, sir,</div>
                     <div class="line">Even by your own.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I cannot help it now,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unless, by using means, I lame the foot</div>
                     <div class="line">Of our design. He bears himself more proudlier,</div>
                     <div class="line">Even to my person, than I thought he would</div>
                     <div class="line">When first I did embrace him: yet his nature</div>
                     <div class="line">In that's no changeling; and I must excuse</div>
                     <div class="line">What cannot be amended.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lieutenant</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet I wish, sir,--</div>
                     <div class="line">I mean for your particular,--you had not</div>
                     <div class="line">Join'd in commission with him; but either</div>
                     <div class="line">Had borne the action of yourself, or else</div>
                     <div class="line">To him had left it solely.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I understand thee well; and be thou sure,</div>
                     <div class="line">when he shall come to his account, he knows not</div>
                     <div class="line">What I can urge against him. Although it seems,</div>
                     <div class="line">And so he thinks, and is no less apparent</div>
                     <div class="line">To the vulgar eye, that he bears all things fairly.</div>
                     <div class="line">And shows good husbandry for the Volscian state,</div>
                     <div class="line">Fights dragon-like, and does achieve as soon</div>
                     <div class="line">As draw his sword; yet he hath left undone</div>
                     <div class="line">That which shall break his neck or hazard mine,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whene'er we come to our account.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lieutenant</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, I beseech you, think you he'll carry Rome?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">All places yield to him ere he sits down;</div>
                     <div class="line">And the nobility of Rome are his:</div>
                     <div class="line">The senators and patricians love him too:</div>
                     <div class="line">The tribunes are no soldiers; and their people</div>
                     <div class="line">Will be as rash in the repeal, as hasty</div>
                     <div class="line">To expel him thence. I think he'll be to Rome</div>
                     <div class="line">As is the osprey to the fish, who takes it</div>
                     <div class="line">By sovereignty of nature. First he was</div>
                     <div class="line">A noble servant to them; but he could not</div>
                     <div class="line">Carry his honours even: whether 'twas pride,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which out of daily fortune ever taints</div>
                     <div class="line">The happy man; whether defect of judgment,</div>
                     <div class="line">To fail in the disposing of those chances</div>
                     <div class="line">Which he was lord of; or whether nature,</div>
                     <div class="line">Not to be other than one thing, not moving</div>
                     <div class="line">From the casque to the cushion, but commanding peace</div>
                     <div class="line">Even with the same austerity and garb</div>
                     <div class="line">As he controll'd the war; but one of these--</div>
                     <div class="line">As he hath spices of them all, not all,</div>
                     <div class="line">For I dare so far free him--made him fear'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">So hated, and so banish'd: but he has a merit,</div>
                     <div class="line">To choke it in the utterance. So our virtues</div>
                     <div class="line">Lie in the interpretation of the time:</div>
                     <div class="line">And power, unto itself most commendable,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath not a tomb so evident as a chair</div>
                     <div class="line">To extol what it hath done.</div>
                     <div class="line">One fire drives out one fire; one nail, one nail;</div>
                     <div class="line">Rights by rights falter, strengths by strengths do fail.</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, let's away. When, Caius, Rome is thine,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art poor'st of all; then shortly art thou mine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.7">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 5. ACT V</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.2">1. SCENE I.  Rome. A public place.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.3">2. SCENE II.  Entrance of the Volscian camp before Rome. Two Sentinels on guard.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.4">3. SCENE III.  The tent of Coriolanus.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.5">4. SCENE IV.  Rome. A public place.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.6">5. SCENE V.  The same. A street near the gate.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.7">6. SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  Rome. A public place.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter MENENIUS, COMINIUS, SICINIUS, BRUTUS,
and others</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">No, I'll not go: you hear what he hath said</div>
                     <div class="line">Which was sometime his general; who loved him</div>
                     <div class="line">In a most dear particular. He call'd me father:</div>
                     <div class="line">But what o' that? Go, you that banish'd him;</div>
                     <div class="line">A mile before his tent fall down, and knee</div>
                     <div class="line">The way into his mercy: nay, if he coy'd</div>
                     <div class="line">To hear Cominius speak, I'll keep at home.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">He would not seem to know me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Do you hear?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet one time he did call me by my name:</div>
                     <div class="line">I urged our old acquaintance, and the drops</div>
                     <div class="line">That we have bled together. Coriolanus</div>
                     <div class="line">He would not answer to: forbad all names;</div>
                     <div class="line">He was a kind of nothing, titleless,</div>
                     <div class="line">Till he had forged himself a name o' the fire</div>
                     <div class="line">Of burning Rome.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, so: you have made good work!</div>
                     <div class="line">A pair of tribunes that have rack'd for Rome,</div>
                     <div class="line">To make coals cheap,--a noble memory!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I minded him how royal 'twas to pardon</div>
                     <div class="line">When it was less expected: he replied,</div>
                     <div class="line">It was a bare petition of a state</div>
                     <div class="line">To one whom they had punish'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Very well:</div>
                     <div class="line">Could he say less?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I offer'd to awaken his regard</div>
                     <div class="line">For's private friends: his answer to me was,</div>
                     <div class="line">He could not stay to pick them in a pile</div>
                     <div class="line">Of noisome musty chaff: he said 'twas folly,</div>
                     <div class="line">For one poor grain or two, to leave unburnt,</div>
                     <div class="line">And still to nose the offence.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">For one poor grain or two!</div>
                     <div class="line">I am one of those; his mother, wife, his child,</div>
                     <div class="line">And this brave fellow too, we are the grains:</div>
                     <div class="line">You are the musty chaff; and you are smelt</div>
                     <div class="line">Above the moon: we must be burnt for you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, pray, be patient: if you refuse your aid</div>
                     <div class="line">In this so never-needed help, yet do not</div>
                     <div class="line">Upbraid's with our distress. But, sure, if you</div>
                     <div class="line">Would be your country's pleader, your good tongue,</div>
                     <div class="line">More than the instant army we can make,</div>
                     <div class="line">Might stop our countryman.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">No, I'll not meddle.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Pray you, go to him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">What should I do?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Only make trial what your love can do</div>
                     <div class="line">For Rome, towards Marcius.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, and say that Marcius</div>
                     <div class="line">Return me, as Cominius is return'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unheard; what then?</div>
                     <div class="line">But as a discontented friend, grief-shot</div>
                     <div class="line">With his unkindness? say't be so?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet your good will</div>
                     <div class="line">must have that thanks from Rome, after the measure</div>
                     <div class="line">As you intended well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll undertake 't:</div>
                     <div class="line">I think he'll hear me. Yet, to bite his lip</div>
                     <div class="line">And hum at good Cominius, much unhearts me.</div>
                     <div class="line">He was not taken well; he had not dined:</div>
                     <div class="line">The veins unfill'd, our blood is cold, and then</div>
                     <div class="line">We pout upon the morning, are unapt</div>
                     <div class="line">To give or to forgive; but when we have stuff'd</div>
                     <div class="line">These and these conveyances of our blood</div>
                     <div class="line">With wine and feeding, we have suppler souls</div>
                     <div class="line">Than in our priest-like fasts: therefore I'll watch him</div>
                     <div class="line">Till he be dieted to my request,</div>
                     <div class="line">And then I'll set upon him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">You know the very road into his kindness,</div>
                     <div class="line">And cannot lose your way.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Good faith, I'll prove him,</div>
                     <div class="line">Speed how it will. I shall ere long have knowledge</div>
                     <div class="line">Of my success.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">He'll never hear him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Not?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I tell you, he does sit in gold, his eye</div>
                     <div class="line">Red as 'twould burn Rome; and his injury</div>
                     <div class="line">The gaoler to his pity. I kneel'd before him;</div>
                     <div class="line">'Twas very faintly he said 'Rise;' dismiss'd me</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus, with his speechless hand: what he would do,</div>
                     <div class="line">He sent in writing after me; what he would not,</div>
                     <div class="line">Bound with an oath to yield to his conditions:</div>
                     <div class="line">So that all hope is vain.</div>
                     <div class="line">Unless his noble mother, and his wife;</div>
                     <div class="line">Who, as I hear, mean to solicit him</div>
                     <div class="line">For mercy to his country. Therefore, let's hence,</div>
                     <div class="line">And with our fair entreaties haste them on.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  Entrance of the Volscian camp before Rome. Two Sentinels on guard.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter to them, MENENIUS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">Stay: whence are you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">Stand, and go back.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">You guard like men; 'tis well: but, by your leave,</div>
                     <div class="line">I am an officer of state, and come</div>
                     <div class="line">To speak with Coriolanus.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">From whence?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">From Rome.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">You may not pass, you must return: our general</div>
                     <div class="line">Will no more hear from thence.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">You'll see your Rome embraced with fire before</div>
                     <div class="line">You'll speak with Coriolanus.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Good my friends,</div>
                     <div class="line">If you have heard your general talk of Rome,</div>
                     <div class="line">And of his friends there, it is lots to blanks,</div>
                     <div class="line">My name hath touch'd your ears it is Menenius.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">Be it so; go back: the virtue of your name</div>
                     <div class="line">Is not here passable.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I tell thee, fellow,</div>
                     <div class="line">The general is my lover: I have been</div>
                     <div class="line">The book of his good acts, whence men have read</div>
                     <div class="line">His name unparallel'd, haply amplified;</div>
                     <div class="line">For I have ever verified my friends,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of whom he's chief, with all the size that verity</div>
                     <div class="line">Would without lapsing suffer: nay, sometimes,</div>
                     <div class="line">Like to a bowl upon a subtle ground,</div>
                     <div class="line">I have tumbled past the throw; and in his praise</div>
                     <div class="line">Have almost stamp'd the leasing: therefore, fellow,</div>
                     <div class="line">I must have leave to pass.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">Faith, sir, if you had told as many lies in his</div>
                     <div class="line">behalf as you have uttered words in your own, you</div>
                     <div class="line">should not pass here; no, though it were as virtuous</div>
                     <div class="line">to lie as to live chastely. Therefore, go back.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Prithee, fellow, remember my name is Menenius,</div>
                     <div class="line">always factionary on the party of your general.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">Howsoever you have been his liar, as you say you</div>
                     <div class="line">have, I am one that, telling true under him, must</div>
                     <div class="line">say, you cannot pass. Therefore, go back.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Has he dined, canst thou tell? for I would not</div>
                     <div class="line">speak with him till after dinner.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">You are a Roman, are you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I am, as thy general is.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">Then you should hate Rome, as he does. Can you,</div>
                     <div class="line">when you have pushed out your gates the very</div>
                     <div class="line">defender of them, and, in a violent popular</div>
                     <div class="line">ignorance, given your enemy your shield, think to</div>
                     <div class="line">front his revenges with the easy groans of old</div>
                     <div class="line">women, the virginal palms of your daughters, or with</div>
                     <div class="line">the palsied intercession of such a decayed dotant as</div>
                     <div class="line">you seem to be? Can you think to blow out the</div>
                     <div class="line">intended fire your city is ready to flame in, with</div>
                     <div class="line">such weak breath as this? No, you are deceived;</div>
                     <div class="line">therefore, back to Rome, and prepare for your</div>
                     <div class="line">execution: you are condemned, our general has sworn</div>
                     <div class="line">you out of reprieve and pardon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Sirrah, if thy captain knew I were here, he would</div>
                     <div class="line">use me with estimation.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, my captain knows you not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I mean, thy general.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">My general cares not for you. Back, I say, go; lest</div>
                     <div class="line">I let forth your half-pint of blood; back,--that's</div>
                     <div class="line">the utmost of your having: back.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, but, fellow, fellow,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter CORIOLANUS and AUFIDIUS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">What's the matter?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, you companion, I'll say an errand for you:</div>
                     <div class="line">You shall know now that I am in estimation; you shall</div>
                     <div class="line">perceive that a Jack guardant cannot office me from</div>
                     <div class="line">my son Coriolanus: guess, but by my entertainment</div>
                     <div class="line">with him, if thou standest not i' the state of</div>
                     <div class="line">hanging, or of some death more long in</div>
                     <div class="line">spectatorship, and crueller in suffering; behold now</div>
                     <div class="line">presently, and swoon for what's to come upon thee.</div>
                     <p>To CORIOLANUS</p>
                     <div class="line">The glorious gods sit in hourly synod about thy</div>
                     <div class="line">particular prosperity, and love thee no worse than</div>
                     <div class="line">thy old father Menenius does! O my son, my son!</div>
                     <div class="line">thou art preparing fire for us; look thee, here's</div>
                     <div class="line">water to quench it. I was hardly moved to come to</div>
                     <div class="line">thee; but being assured none but myself could move</div>
                     <div class="line">thee, I have been blown out of your gates with</div>
                     <div class="line">sighs; and conjure thee to pardon Rome, and thy</div>
                     <div class="line">petitionary countrymen. The good gods assuage thy</div>
                     <div class="line">wrath, and turn the dregs of it upon this varlet</div>
                     <div class="line">here,--this, who, like a block, hath denied my</div>
                     <div class="line">access to thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
