                     <div class="line">Away!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">How! away!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Wife, mother, child, I know not. My affairs</div>
                     <div class="line">Are servanted to others: though I owe</div>
                     <div class="line">My revenge properly, my remission lies</div>
                     <div class="line">In Volscian breasts. That we have been familiar,</div>
                     <div class="line">Ingrate forgetfulness shall poison, rather</div>
                     <div class="line">Than pity note how much. Therefore, be gone.</div>
                     <div class="line">Mine ears against your suits are stronger than</div>
                     <div class="line">Your gates against my force. Yet, for I loved thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">Take this along; I writ it for thy sake</div>
                     <p>Gives a letter</p>
                     <div class="line">And would have rent it. Another word, Menenius,</div>
                     <div class="line">I will not hear thee speak. This man, Aufidius,</div>
                     <div class="line">Was my beloved in Rome: yet thou behold'st!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">You keep a constant temper.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt CORIOLANUS and AUFIDIUS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, sir, is your name Menenius?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis a spell, you see, of much power: you know the</div>
                     <div class="line">way home again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">Do you hear how we are shent for keeping your</div>
                     <div class="line">greatness back?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">What cause, do you think, I have to swoon?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I neither care for the world nor your general: for</div>
                     <div class="line">such things as you, I can scarce think there's any,</div>
                     <div class="line">ye're so slight. He that hath a will to die by</div>
                     <div class="line">himself fears it not from another: let your general</div>
                     <div class="line">do his worst. For you, be that you are, long; and</div>
                     <div class="line">your misery increase with your age! I say to you,</div>
                     <div class="line">as I was said to, Away!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">A noble fellow, I warrant him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">The worthy fellow is our general: he's the rock, the</div>
                     <div class="line">oak not to be wind-shaken.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  The tent of Coriolanus.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter CORIOLANUS, AUFIDIUS, and others</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">We will before the walls of Rome tomorrow</div>
                     <div class="line">Set down our host. My partner in this action,</div>
                     <div class="line">You must report to the Volscian lords, how plainly</div>
                     <div class="line">I have borne this business.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Only their ends</div>
                     <div class="line">You have respected; stopp'd your ears against</div>
                     <div class="line">The general suit of Rome; never admitted</div>
                     <div class="line">A private whisper, no, not with such friends</div>
                     <div class="line">That thought them sure of you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">This last old man,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whom with a crack'd heart I have sent to Rome,</div>
                     <div class="line">Loved me above the measure of a father;</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, godded me, indeed. Their latest refuge</div>
                     <div class="line">Was to send him; for whose old love I have,</div>
                     <div class="line">Though I show'd sourly to him, once more offer'd</div>
                     <div class="line">The first conditions, which they did refuse</div>
                     <div class="line">And cannot now accept; to grace him only</div>
                     <div class="line">That thought he could do more, a very little</div>
                     <div class="line">I have yielded to: fresh embassies and suits,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor from the state nor private friends, hereafter</div>
                     <div class="line">Will I lend ear to. Ha! what shout is this?</div>
                     <p>Shout within</p>
                     <div class="line">Shall I be tempted to infringe my vow</div>
                     <div class="line">In the same time 'tis made? I will not.</div>
                     <p>Enter in mourning habits, VIRGILIA, VOLUMNIA,
leading young MARCIUS, VALERIA, and Attendants</p>
                     <div class="line">My wife comes foremost; then the honour'd mould</div>
                     <div class="line">Wherein this trunk was framed, and in her hand</div>
                     <div class="line">The grandchild to her blood. But, out, affection!</div>
                     <div class="line">All bond and privilege of nature, break!</div>
                     <div class="line">Let it be virtuous to be obstinate.</div>
                     <div class="line">What is that curt'sy worth? or those doves' eyes,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which can make gods forsworn? I melt, and am not</div>
                     <div class="line">Of stronger earth than others. My mother bows;</div>
                     <div class="line">As if Olympus to a molehill should</div>
                     <div class="line">In supplication nod: and my young boy</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath an aspect of intercession, which</div>
                     <div class="line">Great nature cries 'Deny not.' let the Volsces</div>
                     <div class="line">Plough Rome and harrow Italy: I'll never</div>
                     <div class="line">Be such a gosling to obey instinct, but stand,</div>
                     <div class="line">As if a man were author of himself</div>
                     <div class="line">And knew no other kin.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIRGILIA</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord and husband!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">These eyes are not the same I wore in Rome.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIRGILIA</div>
                     <div class="line">The sorrow that delivers us thus changed</div>
                     <div class="line">Makes you think so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Like a dull actor now,</div>
                     <div class="line">I have forgot my part, and I am out,</div>
                     <div class="line">Even to a full disgrace. Best of my flesh,</div>
                     <div class="line">Forgive my tyranny; but do not say</div>
                     <div class="line">For that 'Forgive our Romans.' O, a kiss</div>
                     <div class="line">Long as my exile, sweet as my revenge!</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, by the jealous queen of heaven, that kiss</div>
                     <div class="line">I carried from thee, dear; and my true lip</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath virgin'd it e'er since. You gods! I prate,</div>
                     <div class="line">And the most noble mother of the world</div>
                     <div class="line">Leave unsaluted: sink, my knee, i' the earth;</div>
                     <p>Kneels</p>
                     <div class="line">Of thy deep duty more impression show</div>
                     <div class="line">Than that of common sons.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                     <div class="line">O, stand up blest!</div>
                     <div class="line">Whilst, with no softer cushion than the flint,</div>
                     <div class="line">I kneel before thee; and unproperly</div>
                     <div class="line">Show duty, as mistaken all this while</div>
                     <div class="line">Between the child and parent.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Kneels</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">What is this?</div>
                     <div class="line">Your knees to me? to your corrected son?</div>
                     <div class="line">Then let the pebbles on the hungry beach</div>
                     <div class="line">Fillip the stars; then let the mutinous winds</div>
                     <div class="line">Strike the proud cedars 'gainst the fiery sun;</div>
                     <div class="line">Murdering impossibility, to make</div>
                     <div class="line">What cannot be, slight work.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art my warrior;</div>
                     <div class="line">I holp to frame thee. Do you know this lady?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">The noble sister of Publicola,</div>
                     <div class="line">The moon of Rome, chaste as the icicle</div>
                     <div class="line">That's curdied by the frost from purest snow</div>
                     <div class="line">And hangs on Dian's temple: dear Valeria!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                     <div class="line">This is a poor epitome of yours,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which by the interpretation of full time</div>
                     <div class="line">May show like all yourself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">The god of soldiers,</div>
                     <div class="line">With the consent of supreme Jove, inform</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy thoughts with nobleness; that thou mayst prove</div>
                     <div class="line">To shame unvulnerable, and stick i' the wars</div>
                     <div class="line">Like a great sea-mark, standing every flaw,</div>
                     <div class="line">And saving those that eye thee!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Your knee, sirrah.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">That's my brave boy!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Even he, your wife, this lady, and myself,</div>
                     <div class="line">Are suitors to you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I beseech you, peace:</div>
                     <div class="line">Or, if you'ld ask, remember this before:</div>
                     <div class="line">The thing I have forsworn to grant may never</div>
                     <div class="line">Be held by you denials. Do not bid me</div>
                     <div class="line">Dismiss my soldiers, or capitulate</div>
                     <div class="line">Again with Rome's mechanics: tell me not</div>
                     <div class="line">Wherein I seem unnatural: desire not</div>
                     <div class="line">To ally my rages and revenges with</div>
                     <div class="line">Your colder reasons.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                     <div class="line">O, no more, no more!</div>
                     <div class="line">You have said you will not grant us any thing;</div>
                     <div class="line">For we have nothing else to ask, but that</div>
                     <div class="line">Which you deny already: yet we will ask;</div>
                     <div class="line">That, if you fail in our request, the blame</div>
                     <div class="line">May hang upon your hardness: therefore hear us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Aufidius, and you Volsces, mark; for we'll</div>
                     <div class="line">Hear nought from Rome in private. Your request?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Should we be silent and not speak, our raiment</div>
                     <div class="line">And state of bodies would bewray what life</div>
                     <div class="line">We have led since thy exile. Think with thyself</div>
                     <div class="line">How more unfortunate than all living women</div>
                     <div class="line">Are we come hither: since that thy sight,</div>
                     <div class="line">which should</div>
                     <div class="line">Make our eyes flow with joy, hearts dance</div>
                     <div class="line">with comforts,</div>
                     <div class="line">Constrains them weep and shake with fear and sorrow;</div>
                     <div class="line">Making the mother, wife and child to see</div>
                     <div class="line">The son, the husband and the father tearing</div>
                     <div class="line">His country's bowels out. And to poor we</div>
                     <div class="line">Thine enmity's most capital: thou barr'st us</div>
                     <div class="line">Our prayers to the gods, which is a comfort</div>
                     <div class="line">That all but we enjoy; for how can we,</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, how can we for our country pray.</div>
                     <div class="line">Whereto we are bound, together with thy victory,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whereto we are bound? alack, or we must lose</div>
                     <div class="line">The country, our dear nurse, or else thy person,</div>
                     <div class="line">Our comfort in the country. We must find</div>
                     <div class="line">An evident calamity, though we had</div>
                     <div class="line">Our wish, which side should win: for either thou</div>
                     <div class="line">Must, as a foreign recreant, be led</div>
                     <div class="line">With manacles thorough our streets, or else</div>
                     <div class="line">triumphantly tread on thy country's ruin,</div>
                     <div class="line">And bear the palm for having bravely shed</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy wife and children's blood. For myself, son,</div>
                     <div class="line">I purpose not to wait on fortune till</div>
                     <div class="line">These wars determine: if I cannot persuade thee</div>
                     <div class="line">Rather to show a noble grace to both parts</div>
                     <div class="line">Than seek the end of one, thou shalt no sooner</div>
                     <div class="line">March to assault thy country than to tread--</div>
                     <div class="line">Trust to't, thou shalt not--on thy mother's womb,</div>
                     <div class="line">That brought thee to this world.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VIRGILIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, and mine,</div>
                     <div class="line">That brought you forth this boy, to keep your name</div>
                     <div class="line">Living to time.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Young MARCIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">A' shall not tread on me;</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll run away till I am bigger, but then I'll fight.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Not of a woman's tenderness to be,</div>
                     <div class="line">Requires nor child nor woman's face to see.</div>
                     <div class="line">I have sat too long.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Rising</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, go not from us thus.</div>
                     <div class="line">If it were so that our request did tend</div>
                     <div class="line">To save the Romans, thereby to destroy</div>
                     <div class="line">The Volsces whom you serve, you might condemn us,</div>
                     <div class="line">As poisonous of your honour: no; our suit</div>
                     <div class="line">Is that you reconcile them: while the Volsces</div>
                     <div class="line">May say 'This mercy we have show'd;' the Romans,</div>
                     <div class="line">'This we received;' and each in either side</div>
                     <div class="line">Give the all-hail to thee and cry 'Be blest</div>
                     <div class="line">For making up this peace!' Thou know'st, great son,</div>
                     <div class="line">The end of war's uncertain, but this certain,</div>
                     <div class="line">That, if thou conquer Rome, the benefit</div>
                     <div class="line">Which thou shalt thereby reap is such a name,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose repetition will be dogg'd with curses;</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose chronicle thus writ: 'The man was noble,</div>
                     <div class="line">But with his last attempt he wiped it out;</div>
                     <div class="line">Destroy'd his country, and his name remains</div>
                     <div class="line">To the ensuing age abhorr'd.' Speak to me, son:</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou hast affected the fine strains of honour,</div>
                     <div class="line">To imitate the graces of the gods;</div>
                     <div class="line">To tear with thunder the wide cheeks o' the air,</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet to charge thy sulphur with a bolt</div>
                     <div class="line">That should but rive an oak. Why dost not speak?</div>
                     <div class="line">Think'st thou it honourable for a noble man</div>
                     <div class="line">Still to remember wrongs? Daughter, speak you:</div>
                     <div class="line">He cares not for your weeping. Speak thou, boy:</div>
                     <div class="line">Perhaps thy childishness will move him more</div>
                     <div class="line">Than can our reasons. There's no man in the world</div>
                     <div class="line">More bound to 's mother; yet here he lets me prate</div>
                     <div class="line">Like one i' the stocks. Thou hast never in thy life</div>
                     <div class="line">Show'd thy dear mother any courtesy,</div>
                     <div class="line">When she, poor hen, fond of no second brood,</div>
                     <div class="line">Has cluck'd thee to the wars and safely home,</div>
                     <div class="line">Loaden with honour. Say my request's unjust,</div>
                     <div class="line">And spurn me back: but if it be not so,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art not honest; and the gods will plague thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">That thou restrain'st from me the duty which</div>
                     <div class="line">To a mother's part belongs. He turns away:</div>
                     <div class="line">Down, ladies; let us shame him with our knees.</div>
                     <div class="line">To his surname Coriolanus 'longs more pride</div>
                     <div class="line">Than pity to our prayers. Down: an end;</div>
                     <div class="line">This is the last: so we will home to Rome,</div>
                     <div class="line">And die among our neighbours. Nay, behold 's:</div>
                     <div class="line">This boy, that cannot tell what he would have</div>
                     <div class="line">But kneels and holds up bands for fellowship,</div>
                     <div class="line">Does reason our petition with more strength</div>
                     <div class="line">Than thou hast to deny 't. Come, let us go:</div>
                     <div class="line">This fellow had a Volscian to his mother;</div>
                     <div class="line">His wife is in Corioli and his child</div>
                     <div class="line">Like him by chance. Yet give us our dispatch:</div>
                     <div class="line">I am hush'd until our city be a-fire,</div>
                     <div class="line">And then I'll speak a little.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>He holds her by the hand, silent</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">O mother, mother!</div>
                     <div class="line">What have you done? Behold, the heavens do ope,</div>
                     <div class="line">The gods look down, and this unnatural scene</div>
                     <div class="line">They laugh at. O my mother, mother! O!</div>
                     <div class="line">You have won a happy victory to Rome;</div>
                     <div class="line">But, for your son,--believe it, O, believe it,</div>
                     <div class="line">Most dangerously you have with him prevail'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">If not most mortal to him. But, let it come.</div>
                     <div class="line">Aufidius, though I cannot make true wars,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll frame convenient peace. Now, good Aufidius,</div>
                     <div class="line">Were you in my stead, would you have heard</div>
                     <div class="line">A mother less? or granted less, Aufidius?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I was moved withal.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I dare be sworn you were:</div>
                     <div class="line">And, sir, it is no little thing to make</div>
                     <div class="line">Mine eyes to sweat compassion. But, good sir,</div>
                     <div class="line">What peace you'll make, advise me: for my part,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll not to Rome, I'll back with you; and pray you,</div>
                     <div class="line">Stand to me in this cause. O mother! wife!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  I am glad thou hast set thy mercy and</div>
                     <div class="line">thy honour</div>
                     <div class="line">At difference in thee: out of that I'll work</div>
                     <div class="line">Myself a former fortune.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>The Ladies make signs to CORIOLANUS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, by and by;</div>
                     <p>To VOLUMNIA, VIRGILIA, &c</p>
                     <div class="line">But we will drink together; and you shall bear</div>
                     <div class="line">A better witness back than words, which we,</div>
                     <div class="line">On like conditions, will have counter-seal'd.</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, enter with us. Ladies, you deserve</div>
                     <div class="line">To have a temple built you: all the swords</div>
                     <div class="line">In Italy, and her confederate arms,</div>
                     <div class="line">Could not have made this peace.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.5">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>4. SCENE IV.  Rome. A public place.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter MENENIUS and SICINIUS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">See you yond coign o' the Capitol, yond</div>
                     <div class="line">corner-stone?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, what of that?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">If it be possible for you to displace it with your</div>
                     <div class="line">little finger, there is some hope the ladies of</div>
                     <div class="line">Rome, especially his mother, may prevail with him.</div>
                     <div class="line">But I say there is no hope in't: our throats are</div>
                     <div class="line">sentenced and stay upon execution.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Is't possible that so short a time can alter the</div>
                     <div class="line">condition of a man!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">There is differency between a grub and a butterfly;</div>
                     <div class="line">yet your butterfly was a grub. This Marcius is grown</div>
                     <div class="line">from man to dragon: he has wings; he's more than a</div>
                     <div class="line">creeping thing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">He loved his mother dearly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">So did he me: and he no more remembers his mother</div>
                     <div class="line">now than an eight-year-old horse. The tartness</div>
                     <div class="line">of his face sours ripe grapes: when he walks, he</div>
                     <div class="line">moves like an engine, and the ground shrinks before</div>
                     <div class="line">his treading: he is able to pierce a corslet with</div>
                     <div class="line">his eye; talks like a knell, and his hum is a</div>
                     <div class="line">battery. He sits in his state, as a thing made for</div>
                     <div class="line">Alexander. What he bids be done is finished with</div>
                     <div class="line">his bidding. He wants nothing of a god but eternity</div>
                     <div class="line">and a heaven to throne in.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, mercy, if you report him truly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I paint him in the character. Mark what mercy his</div>
                     <div class="line">mother shall bring from him: there is no more mercy</div>
                     <div class="line">in him than there is milk in a male tiger; that</div>
                     <div class="line">shall our poor city find: and all this is long of</div>
                     <div class="line">you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">The gods be good unto us!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">No, in such a case the gods will not be good unto</div>
                     <div class="line">us. When we banished him, we respected not them;</div>
                     <div class="line">and, he returning to break our necks, they respect not us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter a Messenger</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, if you'ld save your life, fly to your house:</div>
                     <div class="line">The plebeians have got your fellow-tribune</div>
                     <div class="line">And hale him up and down, all swearing, if</div>
                     <div class="line">The Roman ladies bring not comfort home,</div>
                     <div class="line">They'll give him death by inches.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter a second Messenger</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">What's the news?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">Good news, good news; the ladies have prevail'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">The Volscians are dislodged, and Marcius gone:</div>
                     <div class="line">A merrier day did never yet greet Rome,</div>
                     <div class="line">No, not the expulsion of the Tarquins.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Friend,</div>
                     <div class="line">Art thou certain this is true? is it most certain?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">As certain as I know the sun is fire:</div>
                     <div class="line">Where have you lurk'd, that you make doubt of it?</div>
                     <div class="line">Ne'er through an arch so hurried the blown tide,</div>
                     <div class="line">As the recomforted through the gates. Why, hark you!</div>
                     <p>Trumpets; hautboys; drums beat; all together</p>
                     <div class="line">The trumpets, sackbuts, psalteries and fifes,</div>
                     <div class="line">Tabours and cymbals and the shouting Romans,</div>
                     <div class="line">Make the sun dance. Hark you!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>A shout within</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">This is good news:</div>
                     <div class="line">I will go meet the ladies. This Volumnia</div>
                     <div class="line">Is worth of consuls, senators, patricians,</div>
                     <div class="line">A city full; of tribunes, such as you,</div>
                     <div class="line">A sea and land full. You have pray'd well to-day:</div>
                     <div class="line">This morning for ten thousand of your throats</div>
                     <div class="line">I'd not have given a doit. Hark, how they joy!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Music still, with shouts</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">First, the gods bless you for your tidings; next,</div>
                     <div class="line">Accept my thankfulness.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, we have all</div>
                     <div class="line">Great cause to give great thanks.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">They are near the city?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">Almost at point to enter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">We will meet them,</div>
                     <div class="line">And help the joy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.6">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>5. SCENE V.  The same. A street near the gate.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter two Senators with VOLUMNIA, VIRGILIA,
VALERIA, &c. passing over the stage,
followed by Patricians and others</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">Behold our patroness, the life of Rome!</div>
                     <div class="line">Call all your tribes together, praise the gods,</div>
                     <div class="line">And make triumphant fires; strew flowers before them:</div>
                     <div class="line">Unshout the noise that banish'd Marcius,</div>
                     <div class="line">Repeal him with the welcome of his mother;</div>
                     <div class="line">Cry 'Welcome, ladies, welcome!'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">All</div>
                     <div class="line">Welcome, ladies, Welcome!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>A flourish with drums and trumpets. Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.7">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>6. SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter TULLUS AUFIDIUS, with Attendants</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Go tell the lords o' the city I am here:</div>
                     <div class="line">Deliver them this paper: having read it,</div>
                     <div class="line">Bid them repair to the market place; where I,</div>
                     <div class="line">Even in theirs and in the commons' ears,</div>
                     <div class="line">Will vouch the truth of it. Him I accuse</div>
                     <div class="line">The city ports by this hath enter'd and</div>
                     <div class="line">Intends to appear before the people, hoping</div>
                     <div class="line">To purge herself with words: dispatch.</div>
                     <p>Exeunt Attendants</p>
                     <p>Enter three or four Conspirators of AUFIDIUS' faction</p>
                     <div class="line">Most welcome!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Conspirator</div>
                     <div class="line">How is it with our general?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Even so</div>
                     <div class="line">As with a man by his own alms empoison'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">And with his charity slain.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Conspirator</div>
                     <div class="line">Most noble sir,</div>
                     <div class="line">If you do hold the same intent wherein</div>
                     <div class="line">You wish'd us parties, we'll deliver you</div>
                     <div class="line">Of your great danger.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, I cannot tell:</div>
                     <div class="line">We must proceed as we do find the people.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Conspirator</div>
                     <div class="line">The people will remain uncertain whilst</div>
                     <div class="line">'Twixt you there's difference; but the fall of either</div>
                     <div class="line">Makes the survivor heir of all.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I know it;</div>
                     <div class="line">And my pretext to strike at him admits</div>
                     <div class="line">A good construction. I raised him, and I pawn'd</div>
                     <div class="line">Mine honour for his truth: who being so heighten'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">He water'd his new plants with dews of flattery,</div>
                     <div class="line">Seducing so my friends; and, to this end,</div>
                     <div class="line">He bow'd his nature, never known before</div>
                     <div class="line">But to be rough, unswayable and free.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Conspirator</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, his stoutness</div>
                     <div class="line">When he did stand for consul, which he lost</div>
                     <div class="line">By lack of stooping,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">That I would have spoke of:</div>
                     <div class="line">Being banish'd for't, he came unto my hearth;</div>
                     <div class="line">Presented to my knife his throat: I took him;</div>
                     <div class="line">Made him joint-servant with me; gave him way</div>
                     <div class="line">In all his own desires; nay, let him choose</div>
                     <div class="line">Out of my files, his projects to accomplish,</div>
                     <div class="line">My best and freshest men; served his designments</div>
                     <div class="line">In mine own person; holp to reap the fame</div>
                     <div class="line">Which he did end all his; and took some pride</div>
                     <div class="line">To do myself this wrong: till, at the last,</div>
                     <div class="line">I seem'd his follower, not partner, and</div>
                     <div class="line">He waged me with his countenance, as if</div>
                     <div class="line">I had been mercenary.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Conspirator</div>
                     <div class="line">So he did, my lord:</div>
                     <div class="line">The army marvell'd at it, and, in the last,</div>
                     <div class="line">When he had carried Rome and that we look'd</div>
                     <div class="line">For no less spoil than glory,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">There was it:</div>
                     <div class="line">For which my sinews shall be stretch'd upon him.</div>
                     <div class="line">At a few drops of women's rheum, which are</div>
                     <div class="line">As cheap as lies, he sold the blood and labour</div>
                     <div class="line">Of our great action: therefore shall he die,</div>
                     <div class="line">And I'll renew me in his fall. But, hark!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Drums and trumpets sound, with great shouts of
the People</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Conspirator</div>
                     <div class="line">Your native town you enter'd like a post,</div>
                     <div class="line">And had no welcomes home: but he returns,</div>
                     <div class="line">Splitting the air with noise.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Conspirator</div>
                     <div class="line">And patient fools,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose children he hath slain, their base throats tear</div>
                     <div class="line">With giving him glory.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Conspirator</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore, at your vantage,</div>
                     <div class="line">Ere he express himself, or move the people</div>
                     <div class="line">With what he would say, let him feel your sword,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which we will second. When he lies along,</div>
                     <div class="line">After your way his tale pronounced shall bury</div>
                     <div class="line">His reasons with his body.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Say no more:</div>
                     <div class="line">Here come the lords.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter the Lords of the city</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">All The Lords</div>
                     <div class="line">You are most welcome home.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I have not deserved it.</div>
                     <div class="line">But, worthy lords, have you with heed perused</div>
                     <div class="line">What I have written to you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lords</div>
                     <div class="line">We have.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">And grieve to hear't.</div>
                     <div class="line">What faults he made before the last, I think</div>
                     <div class="line">Might have found easy fines: but there to end</div>
                     <div class="line">Where he was to begin and give away</div>
                     <div class="line">The benefit of our levies, answering us</div>
                     <div class="line">With our own charge, making a treaty where</div>
                     <div class="line">There was a yielding,--this admits no excuse.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">He approaches: you shall hear him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter CORIOLANUS, marching with drum and
colours; commoners being with him</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Hail, lords! I am return'd your soldier,</div>
                     <div class="line">No more infected with my country's love</div>
                     <div class="line">Than when I parted hence, but still subsisting</div>
                     <div class="line">Under your great command. You are to know</div>
                     <div class="line">That prosperously I have attempted and</div>
                     <div class="line">With bloody passage led your wars even to</div>
                     <div class="line">The gates of Rome. Our spoils we have brought home</div>
                     <div class="line">Do more than counterpoise a full third part</div>
                     <div class="line">The charges of the action. We have made peace</div>
                     <div class="line">With no less honour to the Antiates</div>
                     <div class="line">Than shame to the Romans: and we here deliver,</div>
                     <div class="line">Subscribed by the consuls and patricians,</div>
                     <div class="line">Together with the seal o' the senate, what</div>
                     <div class="line">We have compounded on.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Read it not, noble lords;</div>
                     <div class="line">But tell the traitor, in the high'st degree</div>
                     <div class="line">He hath abused your powers.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Traitor! how now!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, traitor, Marcius!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Marcius!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, Marcius, Caius Marcius: dost thou think</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll grace thee with that robbery, thy stol'n name</div>
                     <div class="line">Coriolanus in Corioli?</div>
                     <div class="line">You lords and heads o' the state, perfidiously</div>
                     <div class="line">He has betray'd your business, and given up,</div>
                     <div class="line">For certain drops of salt, your city Rome,</div>
                     <div class="line">I say 'your city,' to his wife and mother;</div>
                     <div class="line">Breaking his oath and resolution like</div>
                     <div class="line">A twist of rotten silk, never admitting</div>
                     <div class="line">Counsel o' the war, but at his nurse's tears</div>
                     <div class="line">He whined and roar'd away your victory,</div>
                     <div class="line">That pages blush'd at him and men of heart</div>
                     <div class="line">Look'd wondering each at other.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Hear'st thou, Mars?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Name not the god, thou boy of tears!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Ha!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">No more.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Measureless liar, thou hast made my heart</div>
                     <div class="line">Too great for what contains it. Boy! O slave!</div>
                     <div class="line">Pardon me, lords, 'tis the first time that ever</div>
                     <div class="line">I was forced to scold. Your judgments, my grave lords,</div>
                     <div class="line">Must give this cur the lie: and his own notion--</div>
                     <div class="line">Who wears my stripes impress'd upon him; that</div>
                     <div class="line">Must bear my beating to his grave--shall join</div>
                     <div class="line">To thrust the lie unto him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace, both, and hear me speak.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Cut me to pieces, Volsces; men and lads,</div>
                     <div class="line">Stain all your edges on me. Boy! false hound!</div>
                     <div class="line">If you have writ your annals true, 'tis there,</div>
                     <div class="line">That, like an eagle in a dove-cote, I</div>
                     <div class="line">Flutter'd your Volscians in Corioli:</div>
                     <div class="line">Alone I did it. Boy!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, noble lords,</div>
                     <div class="line">Will you be put in mind of his blind fortune,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which was your shame, by this unholy braggart,</div>
                     <div class="line">'Fore your own eyes and ears?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">All Conspirators</div>
                     <div class="line">Let him die for't.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">All The People</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tear him to pieces.' 'Do it presently.' 'He kill'd</div>
                     <div class="line">my son.' 'My daughter.' 'He killed my cousin</div>
                     <div class="line">Marcus.' 'He killed my father.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace, ho! no outrage: peace!</div>
                     <div class="line">The man is noble and his fame folds-in</div>
                     <div class="line">This orb o' the earth. His last offences to us</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall have judicious hearing. Stand, Aufidius,</div>
                     <div class="line">And trouble not the peace.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">O that I had him,</div>
                     <div class="line">With six Aufidiuses, or more, his tribe,</div>
                     <div class="line">To use my lawful sword!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Insolent villain!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">All Conspirators</div>
                     <div class="line">Kill, kill, kill, kill, kill him!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>The Conspirators draw, and kill CORIOLANUS:
AUFIDIUS stands on his body</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lords</div>
                     <div class="line">Hold, hold, hold, hold!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">My noble masters, hear me speak.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">O Tullus,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou hast done a deed whereat valour will weep.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Tread not upon him. Masters all, be quiet;</div>
                     <div class="line">Put up your swords.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">My lords, when you shall know--as in this rage,</div>
                     <div class="line">Provoked by him, you cannot--the great danger</div>
                     <div class="line">Which this man's life did owe you, you'll rejoice</div>
                     <div class="line">That he is thus cut off. Please it your honours</div>
                     <div class="line">To call me to your senate, I'll deliver</div>
                     <div class="line">Myself your loyal servant, or endure</div>
                     <div class="line">Your heaviest censure.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Bear from hence his body;</div>
                     <div class="line">And mourn you for him: let him be regarded</div>
                     <div class="line">As the most noble corse that ever herald</div>
                     <div class="line">Did follow to his urn.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">His own impatience</div>
                     <div class="line">Takes from Aufidius a great part of blame.</div>
                     <div class="line">Let's make the best of it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">My rage is gone;</div>
                     <div class="line">And I am struck with sorrow. Take him up.</div>
                     <div class="line">Help, three o' the chiefest soldiers; I'll be one.</div>
                     <div class="line">Beat thou the drum, that it speak mournfully:</div>
                     <div class="line">Trail your steel pikes. Though in this city he</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath widow'd and unchilded many a one,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which to this hour bewail the injury,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet he shall have a noble memory. Assist.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt, bearing the body of CORIOLANUS. A dead
march sounded</p>
            </section>
         </article>
      </article>
      <script src="../../resources/js/prism.js"/>
   </body>
</html>
<html>
   <head>
      <link href="../../resources/css/db-prism.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css"/>
      <link href="../../resources/css/default.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css"/>
      <link href="../../resources/css/prism.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css"/>
      <link href="../../resources/css/publishers.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css"/>
      <meta charset="utf-8"/>
      <meta content="DocBook XSL 2.0 Stylesheets Vxxx" name="generator"/>
      <script src="../../resources/js/dbmodnizr.js" type="text/javascript"/>
      <title>The Tragedy of Coriolanus</title>
   </head>
   <body>
      <article class="book" id="R.1">
         <header class="book-titlepage">
            <h1>The Tragedy of Coriolanus</h1>
         </header>
         <div class="lists-of-titles">
            <div class="toc">
               <p>
                  <b>Table of Contents</b>
               </p>
               <ul class="toc">
                  <li>
                     <span>
                        <a href="#R.1.2">1. Dramatis Personae</a>
                     </span>
                  </li>
                  <li>
                     <span>
                        <a href="#R.1.3">1. ACT I</a>
                     </span>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.2">1. SCENE I.  Rome. A street.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.3">2. SCENE II.  Corioli. The Senate-house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.4">3. SCENE III.  Rome. A room in Marcius' house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.5">4. SCENE IV.  Before Corioli.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.6">5. SCENE V.  Corioli. A street.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.7">6. SCENE VI.  Near the camp of Cominius.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.8">7. SCENE VII.  The gates of Corioli.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.9">8. SCENE VIII.  A field of battle.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.10">9. SCENE IX.  The Roman camp.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.11">10. SCENE X.  The camp of the Volsces.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </li>
                  <li>
                     <span>
                        <a href="#R.1.4">2. ACT II</a>
                     </span>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.2">1. SCENE I.  Rome. A public place.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.3">2. SCENE  II.  The same. The Capitol.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.4">3. SCENE III.  The same. The Forum.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </li>
                  <li>
                     <span>
                        <a href="#R.1.5">3. ACT III</a>
                     </span>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.5.2">1. SCENE I.  Rome. A street.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.5.3">2. SCENE II.  A room in CORIOLANUS'S house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.5.4">3. SCENE III.  The same. The Forum.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </li>
                  <li>
                     <span>
                        <a href="#R.1.6">4. ACT IV</a>
                     </span>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.2">1. SCENE I.  Rome. Before a gate of the city.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.3">2. SCENE II.  The same. A  street near the gate.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.4">3. SCENE III.  A highway between Rome and Antium.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.5">4. SCENE IV.  Antium. Before Aufidius's house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.6">5. SCENE V.  The same. A hall in Aufidius's house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.7">6. SCENE VI.  Rome. A public place.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.8">7. SCENE VII.  A camp, at a small distance from Rome.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </li>
                  <li>
                     <span>
                        <a href="#R.1.7">5. ACT V</a>
                     </span>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.2">1. SCENE I.  Rome. A public place.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.3">2. SCENE II.  Entrance of the Volscian camp before Rome. Two Sentinels on guard.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.4">3. SCENE III.  The tent of Coriolanus.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.5">4. SCENE IV.  Rome. A public place.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.6">5. SCENE V.  The same. A street near the gate.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.7">6. SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </li>
               </ul>
            </div>
         </div>
         <div class="content">
            <article class="preface" id="R.1.2">
               <header class="preface-titlepage">
                  <h2>Dramatis Personae</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="content">
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">CAIUS MARCIUS, Afterwards CAIUS MARCIUS CORIOLANUS.</span>
                  </p>
                  <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
                     <tr>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">
                              <span class="personname">TITUS LARTIUS</span>
                              <span class="personname">COMINIUS</span>
                           </span>
                        </td>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">generals against the Volscians.</span>
                        </td>
                     </tr>
                  </table>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">MENENIUS AGRIPPA, friend to Coriolanus. </span>
                  </p>
                  <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
                     <tr>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">
                              <span class="personname">SICINIUS VELUTUS</span>
                              <span class="personname">JUNIUS BRUTUS</span>
                           </span>
                        </td>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">tribunes of the people.</span>
                        </td>
                     </tr>
                  </table>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Young MARCUS, son to Coriolanus.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">A Roman Herald. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">TULLUS AUFIDIUS, general of the Volscians. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Lieutenant to Aufidius. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Conspirators with Aufidius.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">A Citizen of Antium.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Two Volscian Guards.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">VOLUMNIA, mother to Coriolanus.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">VIRGILIA, wife to Coriolanus.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">VALERIA, friend to Virgilia.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Gentlewoman, attending on Virgilia. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Roman and Volscian Senators, Patricians, Aediles, Lictors, Soldiers, Citizens, Messengers, Servants to Aufidius, and other Attendants.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>SCENE  Rome and the neighbourhood; Corioli and the neighbourhood; Antium.</p>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="chapter" id="R.1.3">
               <header class="chapter-titlepage">
                  <h2>Chapter 1. ACT I</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="lists-of-titles">
                  <div class="toc">
                     <p>
                        <b>Table of Contents</b>
                     </p>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.2">1. SCENE I.  Rome. A street.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.3">2. SCENE II.  Corioli. The Senate-house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
