                              <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Yonder comes news. A wager they have met.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LARTIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">My horse to yours, no.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis done.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LARTIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Agreed.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Say, has our general met the enemy?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">They lie in view; but have not spoke as yet.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LARTIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">So, the good horse is mine.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll buy him of you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LARTIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">No, I'll nor sell nor give him: lend you him I will</div>
                              <div class="line">For half a hundred years. Summon the town.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">How far off lie these armies?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">Within this mile and half.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Then shall we hear their 'larum, and they ours.</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, Mars, I prithee, make us quick in work,</div>
                              <div class="line">That we with smoking swords may march from hence,</div>
                              <div class="line">To help our fielded friends! Come, blow thy blast.</div>
                              <p>They sound a parley. Enter two Senators with others
on the walls</p>
                              <div class="line">Tutus Aufidius, is he within your walls?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                              <div class="line">No, nor a man that fears you less than he,</div>
                              <div class="line">That's lesser than a little.</div>
                              <p>Drums afar off</p>
                              <div class="line">Hark! our drums</div>
                              <div class="line">Are bringing forth our youth. We'll break our walls,</div>
                              <div class="line">Rather than they shall pound us up: our gates,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which yet seem shut, we, have but pinn'd with rushes;</div>
                              <div class="line">They'll open of themselves.</div>
                              <p>Alarum afar off</p>
                              <div class="line">Hark you. far off!</div>
                              <div class="line">There is Aufidius; list, what work he makes</div>
                              <div class="line">Amongst your cloven army.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">O, they are at it!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LARTIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Their noise be our instruction. Ladders, ho!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter the army of the Volsces</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">They fear us not, but issue forth their city.</div>
                              <div class="line">Now put your shields before your hearts, and fight</div>
                              <div class="line">With hearts more proof than shields. Advance,</div>
                              <div class="line">brave Titus:</div>
                              <div class="line">They do disdain us much beyond our thoughts,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which makes me sweat with wrath. Come on, my fellows:</div>
                              <div class="line">He that retires I'll take him for a Volsce,</div>
                              <div class="line">And he shall feel mine edge.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Alarum. The Romans are beat back to their
trenches. Re-enter MARCIUS cursing</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">All the contagion of the south light on you,</div>
                              <div class="line">You shames of Rome! you herd of--Boils and plagues</div>
                              <div class="line">Plaster you o'er, that you may be abhorr'd</div>
                              <div class="line">Further than seen and one infect another</div>
                              <div class="line">Against the wind a mile! You souls of geese,</div>
                              <div class="line">That bear the shapes of men, how have you run</div>
                              <div class="line">From slaves that apes would beat! Pluto and hell!</div>
                              <div class="line">All hurt behind; backs red, and faces pale</div>
                              <div class="line">With flight and agued fear! Mend and charge home,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or, by the fires of heaven, I'll leave the foe</div>
                              <div class="line">And make my wars on you: look to't: come on;</div>
                              <div class="line">If you'll stand fast, we'll beat them to their wives,</div>
                              <div class="line">As they us to our trenches followed.</div>
                              <p>Another alarum. The Volsces fly, and MARCIUS
follows them to the gates</p>
                              <div class="line">So, now the gates are ope: now prove good seconds:</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis for the followers fortune widens them,</div>
                              <div class="line">Not for the fliers: mark me, and do the like.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enters the gates</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                              <div class="line">Fool-hardiness; not I.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Soldier</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor I.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>MARCIUS is shut in</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                              <div class="line">See, they have shut him in.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">All</div>
                              <div class="line">To the pot, I warrant him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Alarum continues</p>
                        <p>Re-enter TITUS LARTIUS</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LARTIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">What is become of Marcius?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">All</div>
                              <div class="line">Slain, sir, doubtless.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                              <div class="line">Following the fliers at the very heels,</div>
                              <div class="line">With them he enters; who, upon the sudden,</div>
                              <div class="line">Clapp'd to their gates: he is himself alone,</div>
                              <div class="line">To answer all the city.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LARTIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">O noble fellow!</div>
                              <div class="line">Who sensibly outdares his senseless sword,</div>
                              <div class="line">And, when it bows, stands up. Thou art left, Marcius:</div>
                              <div class="line">A carbuncle entire, as big as thou art,</div>
                              <div class="line">Were not so rich a jewel. Thou wast a soldier</div>
                              <div class="line">Even to Cato's wish, not fierce and terrible</div>
                              <div class="line">Only in strokes; but, with thy grim looks and</div>
                              <div class="line">The thunder-like percussion of thy sounds,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou madst thine enemies shake, as if the world</div>
                              <div class="line">Were feverous and did tremble.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Re-enter MARCIUS, bleeding, assaulted by the enemy</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                              <div class="line">Look, sir.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LARTIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">O,'tis Marcius!</div>
                              <div class="line">Let's fetch him off, or make remain alike.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>They fight, and all enter the city</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.3.6">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>5. SCENE V.  Corioli. A street.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter certain Romans, with spoils</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Roman</div>
                              <div class="line">This will I carry to Rome.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Roman</div>
                              <div class="line">And I this.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Roman</div>
                              <div class="line">A murrain on't! I took this for silver.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Alarum continues still afar off</p>
                        <p>Enter MARCIUS and TITUS LARTIUS with a trumpet</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">See here these movers that do prize their hours</div>
                              <div class="line">At a crack'd drachm! Cushions, leaden spoons,</div>
                              <div class="line">Irons of a doit, doublets that hangmen would</div>
                              <div class="line">Bury with those that wore them, these base slaves,</div>
                              <div class="line">Ere yet the fight be done, pack up: down with them!</div>
                              <div class="line">And hark, what noise the general makes! To him!</div>
                              <div class="line">There is the man of my soul's hate, Aufidius,</div>
                              <div class="line">Piercing our Romans: then, valiant Titus, take</div>
                              <div class="line">Convenient numbers to make good the city;</div>
                              <div class="line">Whilst I, with those that have the spirit, will haste</div>
                              <div class="line">To help Cominius.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LARTIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Worthy sir, thou bleed'st;</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy exercise hath been too violent for</div>
                              <div class="line">A second course of fight.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir, praise me not;</div>
                              <div class="line">My work hath yet not warm'd me: fare you well:</div>
                              <div class="line">The blood I drop is rather physical</div>
                              <div class="line">Than dangerous to me: to Aufidius thus</div>
                              <div class="line">I will appear, and fight.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LARTIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Now the fair goddess, Fortune,</div>
                              <div class="line">Fall deep in love with thee; and her great charms</div>
                              <div class="line">Misguide thy opposers' swords! Bold gentleman,</div>
                              <div class="line">Prosperity be thy page!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy friend no less</div>
                              <div class="line">Than those she placeth highest! So, farewell.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LARTIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou worthiest Marcius!</div>
                              <p>Exit MARCIUS</p>
                              <div class="line">Go, sound thy trumpet in the market-place;</div>
                              <div class="line">Call thither all the officers o' the town,</div>
                              <div class="line">Where they shall know our mind: away!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.3.7">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>6. SCENE VI.  Near the camp of Cominius.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter COMINIUS, as it were in retire,
with soldiers</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Breathe you, my friends: well fought;</div>
                              <div class="line">we are come off</div>
                              <div class="line">Like Romans, neither foolish in our stands,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor cowardly in retire: believe me, sirs,</div>
                              <div class="line">We shall be charged again. Whiles we have struck,</div>
                              <div class="line">By interims and conveying gusts we have heard</div>
                              <div class="line">The charges of our friends. Ye Roman gods!</div>
                              <div class="line">Lead their successes as we wish our own,</div>
                              <div class="line">That both our powers, with smiling</div>
                              <div class="line">fronts encountering,</div>
                              <div class="line">May give you thankful sacrifice.</div>
                              <p>Enter a Messenger</p>
                              <div class="line">Thy news?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">The citizens of Corioli have issued,</div>
                              <div class="line">And given to Lartius and to Marcius battle:</div>
                              <div class="line">I saw our party to their trenches driven,</div>
                              <div class="line">And then I came away.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Though thou speak'st truth,</div>
                              <div class="line">Methinks thou speak'st not well.</div>
                              <div class="line">How long is't since?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">Above an hour, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis not a mile; briefly we heard their drums:</div>
                              <div class="line">How couldst thou in a mile confound an hour,</div>
                              <div class="line">And bring thy news so late?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">Spies of the Volsces</div>
                              <div class="line">Held me in chase, that I was forced to wheel</div>
                              <div class="line">Three or four miles about, else had I, sir,</div>
                              <div class="line">Half an hour since brought my report.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Who's yonder,</div>
                              <div class="line">That does appear as he were flay'd? O gods</div>
                              <div class="line">He has the stamp of Marcius; and I have</div>
                              <div class="line">Before-time seen him thus.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Within</span>                 Come I too late?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">The shepherd knows not thunder from a tabour</div>
                              <div class="line">More than I know the sound of Marcius' tongue</div>
                              <div class="line">From every meaner man.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter MARCIUS</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Come I too late?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, if you come not in the blood of others,</div>
                              <div class="line">But mantled in your own.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">O, let me clip ye</div>
                              <div class="line">In arms as sound as when I woo'd, in heart</div>
                              <div class="line">As merry as when our nuptial day was done,</div>
                              <div class="line">And tapers burn'd to bedward!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Flower of warriors,</div>
                              <div class="line">How is it with Titus Lartius?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">As with a man busied about decrees:</div>
                              <div class="line">Condemning some to death, and some to exile;</div>
                              <div class="line">Ransoming him, or pitying, threatening the other;</div>
                              <div class="line">Holding Corioli in the name of Rome,</div>
                              <div class="line">Even like a fawning greyhound in the leash,</div>
                              <div class="line">To let him slip at will.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Where is that slave</div>
                              <div class="line">Which told me they had beat you to your trenches?</div>
                              <div class="line">Where is he? call him hither.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Let him alone;</div>
                              <div class="line">He did inform the truth: but for our gentlemen,</div>
                              <div class="line">The common file--a plague! tribunes for them!--</div>
                              <div class="line">The mouse ne'er shunn'd the cat as they did budge</div>
                              <div class="line">From rascals worse than they.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">But how prevail'd you?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Will the time serve to tell? I do not think.</div>
                              <div class="line">Where is the enemy? are you lords o' the field?</div>
                              <div class="line">If not, why cease you till you are so?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Marcius,</div>
                              <div class="line">We have at disadvantage fought and did</div>
                              <div class="line">Retire to win our purpose.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">How lies their battle? know you on which side</div>
                              <div class="line">They have placed their men of trust?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">As I guess, Marcius,</div>
                              <div class="line">Their bands i' the vaward are the Antiates,</div>
                              <div class="line">Of their best trust; o'er them Aufidius,</div>
                              <div class="line">Their very heart of hope.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I do beseech you,</div>
                              <div class="line">By all the battles wherein we have fought,</div>
                              <div class="line">By the blood we have shed together, by the vows</div>
                              <div class="line">We have made to endure friends, that you directly</div>
                              <div class="line">Set me against Aufidius and his Antiates;</div>
                              <div class="line">And that you not delay the present, but,</div>
                              <div class="line">Filling the air with swords advanced and darts,</div>
                              <div class="line">We prove this very hour.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Though I could wish</div>
                              <div class="line">You were conducted to a gentle bath</div>
                              <div class="line">And balms applied to, you, yet dare I never</div>
                              <div class="line">Deny your asking: take your choice of those</div>
                              <div class="line">That best can aid your action.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Those are they</div>
                              <div class="line">That most are willing. If any such be here--</div>
                              <div class="line">As it were sin to doubt--that love this painting</div>
                              <div class="line">Wherein you see me smear'd; if any fear</div>
                              <div class="line">Lesser his person than an ill report;</div>
                              <div class="line">If any think brave death outweighs bad life</div>
                              <div class="line">And that his country's dearer than himself;</div>
                              <div class="line">Let him alone, or so many so minded,</div>
                              <div class="line">Wave thus, to express his disposition,</div>
                              <div class="line">And follow Marcius.</div>
                              <p>They all shout and wave their swords, take him up in
their arms, and cast up their caps</p>
                              <div class="line">O, me alone! make you a sword of me?</div>
                              <div class="line">If these shows be not outward, which of you</div>
                              <div class="line">But is four Volsces? none of you but is</div>
                              <div class="line">Able to bear against the great Aufidius</div>
                              <div class="line">A shield as hard as his. A certain number,</div>
                              <div class="line">Though thanks to all, must I select</div>
                              <div class="line">from all: the rest</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall bear the business in some other fight,</div>
                              <div class="line">As cause will be obey'd. Please you to march;</div>
                              <div class="line">And four shall quickly draw out my command,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which men are best inclined.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">March on, my fellows:</div>
                              <div class="line">Make good this ostentation, and you shall</div>
                              <div class="line">Divide in all with us.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.3.8">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>7. SCENE VII.  The gates of Corioli.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>TITUS LARTIUS, having set a guard upon
Corioli, going with drum and trumpet toward
COMINIUS and CAIUS MARCIUS, enters with
Lieutenant, other Soldiers, and a Scout</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LARTIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">So, let the ports be guarded: keep your duties,</div>
                              <div class="line">As I have set them down. If I do send, dispatch</div>
                              <div class="line">Those centuries to our aid: the rest will serve</div>
                              <div class="line">For a short holding: if we lose the field,</div>
                              <div class="line">We cannot keep the town.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lieutenant</div>
                              <div class="line">Fear not our care, sir.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LARTIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Hence, and shut your gates upon's.</div>
                              <div class="line">Our guider, come; to the Roman camp conduct us.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.3.9">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>8. SCENE VIII.  A field of battle.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Alarum as in battle. Enter, from opposite sides,
MARCIUS and AUFIDIUS</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll fight with none but thee; for I do hate thee</div>
                              <div class="line">Worse than a promise-breaker.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">We hate alike:</div>
                              <div class="line">Not Afric owns a serpent I abhor</div>
                              <div class="line">More than thy fame and envy. Fix thy foot.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Let the first budger die the other's slave,</div>
                              <div class="line">And the gods doom him after!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">If I fly, Marcius,</div>
                              <div class="line">Holloa me like a hare.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Within these three hours, Tullus,</div>
                              <div class="line">Alone I fought in your Corioli walls,</div>
                              <div class="line">And made what work I pleased: 'tis not my blood</div>
                              <div class="line">Wherein thou seest me mask'd; for thy revenge</div>
                              <div class="line">Wrench up thy power to the highest.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Wert thou the Hector</div>
                              <div class="line">That was the whip of your bragg'd progeny,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou shouldst not scape me here.</div>
                              <p>They fight, and certain Volsces come to the aid of
AUFIDIUS. MARCIUS fights till they be driven in
breathless</p>
                              <div class="line">Officious, and not valiant, you have shamed me</div>
                              <div class="line">In your condemned seconds.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.3.10">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>9. SCENE IX.  The Roman camp.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Flourish. Alarum. A retreat is sounded. Flourish.
Enter, from one side, COMINIUS with the Romans; from
the other side, MARCIUS, with his arm in a scarf</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">If I should tell thee o'er this thy day's work,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou'ldst not believe thy deeds: but I'll report it</div>
                              <div class="line">Where senators shall mingle tears with smiles,</div>
                              <div class="line">Where great patricians shall attend and shrug,</div>
                              <div class="line">I' the end admire, where ladies shall be frighted,</div>
                              <div class="line">And, gladly quaked, hear more; where the</div>
                              <div class="line">dull tribunes,</div>
                              <div class="line">That, with the fusty plebeians, hate thine honours,</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall say against their hearts 'We thank the gods</div>
                              <div class="line">Our Rome hath such a soldier.'</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet camest thou to a morsel of this feast,</div>
                              <div class="line">Having fully dined before.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter TITUS LARTIUS, with his power,
from the pursuit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LARTIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">O general,</div>
                              <div class="line">Here is the steed, we the caparison:</div>
                              <div class="line">Hadst thou beheld--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Pray now, no more: my mother,</div>
                              <div class="line">Who has a charter to extol her blood,</div>
                              <div class="line">When she does praise me grieves me. I have done</div>
                              <div class="line">As you have done; that's what I can; induced</div>
                              <div class="line">As you have been; that's for my country:</div>
                              <div class="line">He that has but effected his good will</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath overta'en mine act.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">You shall not be</div>
                              <div class="line">The grave of your deserving; Rome must know</div>
                              <div class="line">The value of her own: 'twere a concealment</div>
                              <div class="line">Worse than a theft, no less than a traducement,</div>
                              <div class="line">To hide your doings; and to silence that,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which, to the spire and top of praises vouch'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">Would seem but modest: therefore, I beseech you</div>
                              <div class="line">In sign of what you are, not to reward</div>
                              <div class="line">What you have done--before our army hear me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I have some wounds upon me, and they smart</div>
                              <div class="line">To hear themselves remember'd.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Should they not,</div>
                              <div class="line">Well might they fester 'gainst ingratitude,</div>
                              <div class="line">And tent themselves with death. Of all the horses,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whereof we have ta'en good and good store, of all</div>
                              <div class="line">The treasure in this field achieved and city,</div>
                              <div class="line">We render you the tenth, to be ta'en forth,</div>
                              <div class="line">Before the common distribution, at</div>
                              <div class="line">Your only choice.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I thank you, general;</div>
                              <div class="line">But cannot make my heart consent to take</div>
                              <div class="line">A bribe to pay my sword: I do refuse it;</div>
                              <div class="line">And stand upon my common part with those</div>
                              <div class="line">That have beheld the doing.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>A long flourish. They all cry 'Marcius! Marcius!'
cast up their caps and lances: COMINIUS and LARTIUS
stand bare</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARCIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">May these same instruments, which you profane,</div>
                              <div class="line">Never sound more! when drums and trumpets shall</div>
                              <div class="line">I' the field prove flatterers, let courts and cities be</div>
                              <div class="line">Made all of false-faced soothing!</div>
                              <div class="line">When steel grows soft as the parasite's silk,</div>
                              <div class="line">Let him be made a coverture for the wars!</div>
                              <div class="line">No more, I say! For that I have not wash'd</div>
                              <div class="line">My nose that bled, or foil'd some debile wretch.--</div>
                              <div class="line">Which, without note, here's many else have done,--</div>
                              <div class="line">You shout me forth</div>
                              <div class="line">In acclamations hyperbolical;</div>
                              <div class="line">As if I loved my little should be dieted</div>
                              <div class="line">In praises sauced with lies.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Too modest are you;</div>
                              <div class="line">More cruel to your good report than grateful</div>
                              <div class="line">To us that give you truly: by your patience,</div>
                              <div class="line">If 'gainst yourself you be incensed, we'll put you,</div>
                              <div class="line">Like one that means his proper harm, in manacles,</div>
                              <div class="line">Then reason safely with you. Therefore, be it known,</div>
                              <div class="line">As to us, to all the world, that Caius Marcius</div>
                              <div class="line">Wears this war's garland: in token of the which,</div>
                              <div class="line">My noble steed, known to the camp, I give him,</div>
                              <div class="line">With all his trim belonging; and from this time,</div>
                              <div class="line">For what he did before Corioli, call him,</div>
                              <div class="line">With all the applause and clamour of the host,</div>
                              <div class="line">CAIUS MARCIUS CORIOLANUS! Bear</div>
                              <div class="line">The addition nobly ever!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Flourish. Trumpets sound, and drums</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">All</div>
                              <div class="line">Caius Marcius Coriolanus!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I will go wash;</div>
                              <div class="line">And when my face is fair, you shall perceive</div>
                              <div class="line">Whether I blush or no: howbeit, I thank you.</div>
                              <div class="line">I mean to stride your steed, and at all times</div>
                              <div class="line">To undercrest your good addition</div>
                              <div class="line">To the fairness of my power.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">So, to our tent;</div>
                              <div class="line">Where, ere we do repose us, we will write</div>
                              <div class="line">To Rome of our success. You, Titus Lartius,</div>
                              <div class="line">Must to Corioli back: send us to Rome</div>
                              <div class="line">The best, with whom we may articulate,</div>
                              <div class="line">For their own good and ours.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LARTIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I shall, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">The gods begin to mock me. I, that now</div>
                              <div class="line">Refused most princely gifts, am bound to beg</div>
                              <div class="line">Of my lord general.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Take't; 'tis yours. What is't?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I sometime lay here in Corioli</div>
                              <div class="line">At a poor man's house; he used me kindly:</div>
                              <div class="line">He cried to me; I saw him prisoner;</div>
                              <div class="line">But then Aufidius was within my view,</div>
                              <div class="line">And wrath o'erwhelm'd my pity: I request you</div>
                              <div class="line">To give my poor host freedom.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">O, well begg'd!</div>
                              <div class="line">Were he the butcher of my son, he should</div>
                              <div class="line">Be free as is the wind. Deliver him, Titus.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LARTIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Marcius, his name?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">By Jupiter! forgot.</div>
                              <div class="line">I am weary; yea, my memory is tired.</div>
                              <div class="line">Have we no wine here?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Go we to our tent:</div>
                              <div class="line">The blood upon your visage dries; 'tis time</div>
                              <div class="line">It should be look'd to: come.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.3.11">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>10. SCENE X.  The camp of the Volsces.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>A flourish. Cornets. Enter TULLUS AUFIDIUS,
bloody, with two or three Soldiers</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">The town is ta'en!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                              <div class="line">'Twill be deliver'd back on good condition.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Condition!</div>
                              <div class="line">I would I were a Roman; for I cannot,</div>
                              <div class="line">Being a Volsce, be that I am. Condition!</div>
                              <div class="line">What good condition can a treaty find</div>
                              <div class="line">I' the part that is at mercy? Five times, Marcius,</div>
                              <div class="line">I have fought with thee: so often hast thou beat me,</div>
                              <div class="line">And wouldst do so, I think, should we encounter</div>
                              <div class="line">As often as we eat. By the elements,</div>
                              <div class="line">If e'er again I meet him beard to beard,</div>
                              <div class="line">He's mine, or I am his: mine emulation</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath not that honour in't it had; for where</div>
                              <div class="line">I thought to crush him in an equal force,</div>
                              <div class="line">True sword to sword, I'll potch at him some way</div>
                              <div class="line">Or wrath or craft may get him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                              <div class="line">He's the devil.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Bolder, though not so subtle. My valour's poison'd</div>
                              <div class="line">With only suffering stain by him; for him</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall fly out of itself: nor sleep nor sanctuary,</div>
                              <div class="line">Being naked, sick, nor fane nor Capitol,</div>
                              <div class="line">The prayers of priests nor times of sacrifice,</div>
                              <div class="line">Embarquements all of fury, shall lift up</div>
                              <div class="line">Their rotten privilege and custom 'gainst</div>
                              <div class="line">My hate to Marcius: where I find him, were it</div>
                              <div class="line">At home, upon my brother's guard, even there,</div>
                              <div class="line">Against the hospitable canon, would I</div>
                              <div class="line">Wash my fierce hand in's heart. Go you to the city;</div>
                              <div class="line">Learn how 'tis held; and what they are that must</div>
                              <div class="line">Be hostages for Rome.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                              <div class="line">Will not you go?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I am attended at the cypress grove: I pray you--</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis south the city mills--bring me word thither</div>
                              <div class="line">How the world goes, that to the pace of it</div>
                              <div class="line">I may spur on my journey.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                              <div class="line">I shall, sir.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="chapter" id="R.1.4">
               <header class="chapter-titlepage">
                  <h2>Chapter 2. ACT II</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="lists-of-titles">
                  <div class="toc">
                     <p>
                        <b>Table of Contents</b>
                     </p>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.2">1. SCENE I.  Rome. A public place.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.3">2. SCENE  II.  The same. The Capitol.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.4">3. SCENE III.  The same. The Forum.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="content">
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.4.2">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>1. SCENE I.  Rome. A public place.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter MENENIUS with the two Tribunes of the people,
SICINIUS and BRUTUS.</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">The augurer tells me we shall have news to-night.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Good or bad?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Not according to the prayer of the people, for they</div>
                              <div class="line">love not Marcius.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Nature teaches beasts to know their friends.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Pray you, who does the wolf love?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">The lamb.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, to devour him; as the hungry plebeians would the</div>
                              <div class="line">noble Marcius.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                              <div class="line">He's a lamb indeed, that baes like a bear.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">He's a bear indeed, that lives like a lamb. You two</div>
                              <div class="line">are old men: tell me one thing that I shall ask you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Both</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, sir.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">In what enormity is Marcius poor in, that you two</div>
                              <div class="line">have not in abundance?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                              <div class="line">He's poor in no one fault, but stored with all.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Especially in pride.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                              <div class="line">And topping all others in boasting.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">This is strange now: do you two know how you are</div>
                              <div class="line">censured here in the city, I mean of us o' the</div>
                              <div class="line">right-hand file? do you?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Both</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, how are we censured?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Because you talk of pride now,--will you not be angry?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Both</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, well, sir, well.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, 'tis no great matter; for a very little thief of</div>
                              <div class="line">occasion will rob you of a great deal of patience:</div>
                              <div class="line">give your dispositions the reins, and be angry at</div>
                              <div class="line">your pleasures; at the least if you take it as a</div>
                              <div class="line">pleasure to you in being so. You blame Marcius for</div>
                              <div class="line">being proud?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                              <div class="line">We do it not alone, sir.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I know you can do very little alone; for your helps</div>
                              <div class="line">are many, or else your actions would grow wondrous</div>
                              <div class="line">single: your abilities are too infant-like for</div>
                              <div class="line">doing much alone. You talk of pride: O that you</div>
                              <div class="line">could turn your eyes toward the napes of your necks,</div>
                              <div class="line">and make but an interior survey of your good selves!</div>
                              <div class="line">O that you could!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                              <div class="line">What then, sir?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, then you should discover a brace of unmeriting,</div>
                              <div class="line">proud, violent, testy magistrates, alias fools, as</div>
                              <div class="line">any in Rome.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Menenius, you are known well enough too.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I am known to be a humorous patrician, and one that</div>
                              <div class="line">loves a cup of hot wine with not a drop of allaying</div>
                              <div class="line">Tiber in't; said to be something imperfect in</div>
                              <div class="line">favouring the first complaint; hasty and tinder-like</div>
                              <div class="line">upon too trivial motion; one that converses more</div>
                              <div class="line">with the buttock of the night than with the forehead</div>
                              <div class="line">of the morning: what I think I utter, and spend my</div>
                              <div class="line">malice in my breath. Meeting two such wealsmen as</div>
                              <div class="line">you are--I cannot call you Lycurguses--if the drink</div>
                              <div class="line">you give me touch my palate adversely, I make a</div>
                              <div class="line">crooked face at it. I can't say your worships have</div>
                              <div class="line">delivered the matter well, when I find the ass in</div>
                              <div class="line">compound with the major part of your syllables: and</div>
                              <div class="line">though I must be content to bear with those that say</div>
                              <div class="line">you are reverend grave men, yet they lie deadly that</div>
                              <div class="line">tell you you have good faces. If you see this in</div>
                              <div class="line">the map of my microcosm, follows it that I am known</div>
                              <div class="line">well enough too? what barm can your bisson</div>
                              <div class="line">conspectuities glean out of this character, if I be</div>
                              <div class="line">known well enough too?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, sir, come, we know you well enough.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">You know neither me, yourselves nor any thing. You</div>
                              <div class="line">are ambitious for poor knaves' caps and legs: you</div>
                              <div class="line">wear out a good wholesome forenoon in hearing a</div>
                              <div class="line">cause between an orange wife and a fosset-seller;</div>
                              <div class="line">and then rejourn the controversy of three pence to a</div>
                              <div class="line">second day of audience. When you are hearing a</div>
                              <div class="line">matter between party and party, if you chance to be</div>
                              <div class="line">pinched with the colic, you make faces like</div>
                              <div class="line">mummers; set up the bloody flag against all</div>
                              <div class="line">patience; and, in roaring for a chamber-pot,</div>
                              <div class="line">dismiss the controversy bleeding the more entangled</div>
                              <div class="line">by your hearing: all the peace you make in their</div>
                              <div class="line">cause is, calling both the parties knaves. You are</div>
                              <div class="line">a pair of strange ones.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, come, you are well understood to be a</div>
                              <div class="line">perfecter giber for the table than a necessary</div>
                              <div class="line">bencher in the Capitol.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Our very priests must become mockers, if they shall</div>
                              <div class="line">encounter such ridiculous subjects as you are. When</div>
                              <div class="line">you speak best unto the purpose, it is not worth the</div>
                              <div class="line">wagging of your beards; and your beards deserve not</div>
                              <div class="line">so honourable a grave as to stuff a botcher's</div>
                              <div class="line">cushion, or to be entombed in an ass's pack-</div>
                              <div class="line">saddle. Yet you must be saying, Marcius is proud;</div>
                              <div class="line">who in a cheap estimation, is worth predecessors</div>
                              <div class="line">since Deucalion, though peradventure some of the</div>
                              <div class="line">best of 'em were hereditary hangmen. God-den to</div>
                              <div class="line">your worships: more of your conversation would</div>
                              <div class="line">infect my brain, being the herdsmen of the beastly</div>
                              <div class="line">plebeians: I will be bold to take my leave of you.</div>
                              <p>BRUTUS and SICINIUS go aside</p>
                              <p>Enter VOLUMNIA, VIRGILIA, and VALERIA</p>
                              <div class="line">How now, my as fair as noble ladies,--and the moon,</div>
                              <div class="line">were she earthly, no nobler,--whither do you follow</div>
                              <div class="line">your eyes so fast?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
