                              <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Honourable Menenius, my boy Marcius approaches; for</div>
                              <div class="line">the love of Juno, let's go.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Ha! Marcius coming home!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, worthy Menenius; and with most prosperous</div>
                              <div class="line">approbation.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Take my cap, Jupiter, and I thank thee. Hoo!</div>
                              <div class="line">Marcius coming home!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                              <div class="speaker">VIRGILIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay,'tis true.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Look, here's a letter from him: the state hath</div>
                              <div class="line">another, his wife another; and, I think, there's one</div>
                              <div class="line">at home for you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I will make my very house reel tonight: a letter for</div>
                              <div class="line">me!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VIRGILIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Yes, certain, there's a letter for you; I saw't.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">A letter for me! it gives me an estate of seven</div>
                              <div class="line">years' health; in which time I will make a lip at</div>
                              <div class="line">the physician: the most sovereign prescription in</div>
                              <div class="line">Galen is but empiricutic, and, to this preservative,</div>
                              <div class="line">of no better report than a horse-drench. Is he</div>
                              <div class="line">not wounded? he was wont to come home wounded.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VIRGILIA</div>
                              <div class="line">O, no, no, no.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                              <div class="line">O, he is wounded; I thank the gods for't.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">So do I too, if it be not too much: brings a'</div>
                              <div class="line">victory in his pocket? the wounds become him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                              <div class="line">On's brows: Menenius, he comes the third time home</div>
                              <div class="line">with the oaken garland.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Has he disciplined Aufidius soundly?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Titus Lartius writes, they fought together, but</div>
                              <div class="line">Aufidius got off.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">And 'twas time for him too, I'll warrant him that:</div>
                              <div class="line">an he had stayed by him, I would not have been so</div>
                              <div class="line">fidiused for all the chests in Corioli, and the gold</div>
                              <div class="line">that's in them. Is the senate possessed of this?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Good ladies, let's go. Yes, yes, yes; the senate</div>
                              <div class="line">has letters from the general, wherein he gives my</div>
                              <div class="line">son the whole name of the war: he hath in this</div>
                              <div class="line">action outdone his former deeds doubly</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VALERIA</div>
                              <div class="line">In troth, there's wondrous things spoke of him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Wondrous! ay, I warrant you, and not without his</div>
                              <div class="line">true purchasing.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VIRGILIA</div>
                              <div class="line">The gods grant them true!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                              <div class="line">True! pow, wow.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">True! I'll be sworn they are true.</div>
                              <div class="line">Where is he wounded?</div>
                              <p>To the Tribunes</p>
                              <div class="line">God save your good worships! Marcius is coming</div>
                              <div class="line">home: he has more cause to be proud. Where is he wounded?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                              <div class="line">I' the shoulder and i' the left arm there will be</div>
                              <div class="line">large cicatrices to show the people, when he shall</div>
                              <div class="line">stand for his place. He received in the repulse of</div>
                              <div class="line">Tarquin seven hurts i' the body.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">One i' the neck, and two i' the thigh,--there's</div>
                              <div class="line">nine that I know.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                              <div class="line">He had, before this last expedition, twenty-five</div>
                              <div class="line">wounds upon him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Now it's twenty-seven: every gash was an enemy's grave.</div>
                              <p>A shout and flourish</p>
                              <div class="line">Hark! the trumpets.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                              <div class="line">These are the ushers of Marcius: before him he</div>
                              <div class="line">carries noise, and behind him he leaves tears:</div>
                              <div class="line">Death, that dark spirit, in 's nervy arm doth lie;</div>
                              <div class="line">Which, being advanced, declines, and then men die.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>A sennet. Trumpets sound. Enter COMINIUS the
general, and TITUS LARTIUS; between them, CORIOLANUS,
crowned with an oaken garland; with Captains and
Soldiers, and a Herald</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Herald</div>
                              <div class="line">Know, Rome, that all alone Marcius did fight</div>
                              <div class="line">Within Corioli gates: where he hath won,</div>
                              <div class="line">With fame, a name to Caius Marcius; these</div>
                              <div class="line">In honour follows Coriolanus.</div>
                              <div class="line">Welcome to Rome, renowned Coriolanus!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Flourish</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">All</div>
                              <div class="line">Welcome to Rome, renowned Coriolanus!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">No more of this; it does offend my heart:</div>
                              <div class="line">Pray now, no more.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Look, sir, your mother!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">O,</div>
                              <div class="line">You have, I know, petition'd all the gods</div>
                              <div class="line">For my prosperity!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Kneels</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, my good soldier, up;</div>
                              <div class="line">My gentle Marcius, worthy Caius, and</div>
                              <div class="line">By deed-achieving honour newly named,--</div>
                              <div class="line">What is it?--Coriolanus must I call thee?--</div>
                              <div class="line">But O, thy wife!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">My gracious silence, hail!</div>
                              <div class="line">Wouldst thou have laugh'd had I come coffin'd home,</div>
                              <div class="line">That weep'st to see me triumph? Ay, my dear,</div>
                              <div class="line">Such eyes the widows in Corioli wear,</div>
                              <div class="line">And mothers that lack sons.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, the gods crown thee!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">And live you yet?</div>
                              <p>To VALERIA</p>
                              <div class="line">O my sweet lady, pardon.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                              <div class="line">I know not where to turn: O, welcome home:</div>
                              <div class="line">And welcome, general: and ye're welcome all.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">A hundred thousand welcomes. I could weep</div>
                              <div class="line">And I could laugh, I am light and heavy. Welcome.</div>
                              <div class="line">A curse begin at very root on's heart,</div>
                              <div class="line">That is not glad to see thee! You are three</div>
                              <div class="line">That Rome should dote on: yet, by the faith of men,</div>
                              <div class="line">We have some old crab-trees here</div>
                              <div class="line">at home that will not</div>
                              <div class="line">Be grafted to your relish. Yet welcome, warriors:</div>
                              <div class="line">We call a nettle but a nettle and</div>
                              <div class="line">The faults of fools but folly.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Ever right.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Menenius ever, ever.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Herald</div>
                              <div class="line">Give way there, and go on!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>To VOLUMNIA and VIRGILIA</span>  Your hand, and yours:</div>
                              <div class="line">Ere in our own house I do shade my head,</div>
                              <div class="line">The good patricians must be visited;</div>
                              <div class="line">From whom I have received not only greetings,</div>
                              <div class="line">But with them change of honours.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                              <div class="line">I have lived</div>
                              <div class="line">To see inherited my very wishes</div>
                              <div class="line">And the buildings of my fancy: only</div>
                              <div class="line">There's one thing wanting, which I doubt not but</div>
                              <div class="line">Our Rome will cast upon thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Know, good mother,</div>
                              <div class="line">I had rather be their servant in my way,</div>
                              <div class="line">Than sway with them in theirs.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">On, to the Capitol!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Flourish. Cornets. Exeunt in state, as before.
BRUTUS and SICINIUS come forward</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                              <div class="line">All tongues speak of him, and the bleared sights</div>
                              <div class="line">Are spectacled to see him: your prattling nurse</div>
                              <div class="line">Into a rapture lets her baby cry</div>
                              <div class="line">While she chats him: the kitchen malkin pins</div>
                              <div class="line">Her richest lockram 'bout her reechy neck,</div>
                              <div class="line">Clambering the walls to eye him: stalls, bulks, windows,</div>
                              <div class="line">Are smother'd up, leads fill'd, and ridges horsed</div>
                              <div class="line">With variable complexions, all agreeing</div>
                              <div class="line">In earnestness to see him: seld-shown flamens</div>
                              <div class="line">Do press among the popular throngs and puff</div>
                              <div class="line">To win a vulgar station: or veil'd dames</div>
                              <div class="line">Commit the war of white and damask in</div>
                              <div class="line">Their nicely-gawded cheeks to the wanton spoil</div>
                              <div class="line">Of Phoebus' burning kisses: such a pother</div>
                              <div class="line">As if that whatsoever god who leads him</div>
                              <div class="line">Were slily crept into his human powers</div>
                              <div class="line">And gave him graceful posture.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">On the sudden,</div>
                              <div class="line">I warrant him consul.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Then our office may,</div>
                              <div class="line">During his power, go sleep.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">He cannot temperately transport his honours</div>
                              <div class="line">From where he should begin and end, but will</div>
                              <div class="line">Lose those he hath won.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                              <div class="line">In that there's comfort.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Doubt not</div>
                              <div class="line">The commoners, for whom we stand, but they</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon their ancient malice will forget</div>
                              <div class="line">With the least cause these his new honours, which</div>
                              <div class="line">That he will give them make I as little question</div>
                              <div class="line">As he is proud to do't.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I heard him swear,</div>
                              <div class="line">Were he to stand for consul, never would he</div>
                              <div class="line">Appear i' the market-place nor on him put</div>
                              <div class="line">The napless vesture of humility;</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor showing, as the manner is, his wounds</div>
                              <div class="line">To the people, beg their stinking breaths.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis right.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                              <div class="line">It was his word: O, he would miss it rather</div>
                              <div class="line">Than carry it but by the suit of the gentry to him,</div>
                              <div class="line">And the desire of the nobles.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I wish no better</div>
                              <div class="line">Than have him hold that purpose and to put it</div>
                              <div class="line">In execution.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis most like he will.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">It shall be to him then as our good wills,</div>
                              <div class="line">A sure destruction.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                              <div class="line">So it must fall out</div>
                              <div class="line">To him or our authorities. For an end,</div>
                              <div class="line">We must suggest the people in what hatred</div>
                              <div class="line">He still hath held them; that to's power he would</div>
                              <div class="line">Have made them mules, silenced their pleaders and</div>
                              <div class="line">Dispropertied their freedoms, holding them,</div>
                              <div class="line">In human action and capacity,</div>
                              <div class="line">Of no more soul nor fitness for the world</div>
                              <div class="line">Than camels in the war, who have their provand</div>
                              <div class="line">Only for bearing burdens, and sore blows</div>
                              <div class="line">For sinking under them.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">This, as you say, suggested</div>
                              <div class="line">At some time when his soaring insolence</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall touch the people--which time shall not want,</div>
                              <div class="line">If he be put upon 't; and that's as easy</div>
                              <div class="line">As to set dogs on sheep--will be his fire</div>
                              <div class="line">To kindle their dry stubble; and their blaze</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall darken him for ever.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter a Messenger</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                              <div class="line">What's the matter?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">You are sent for to the Capitol. 'Tis thought</div>
                              <div class="line">That Marcius shall be consul:</div>
                              <div class="line">I have seen the dumb men throng to see him and</div>
                              <div class="line">The blind to bear him speak: matrons flung gloves,</div>
                              <div class="line">Ladies and maids their scarfs and handkerchers,</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon him as he pass'd: the nobles bended,</div>
                              <div class="line">As to Jove's statue, and the commons made</div>
                              <div class="line">A shower and thunder with their caps and shouts:</div>
                              <div class="line">I never saw the like.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Let's to the Capitol;</div>
                              <div class="line">And carry with us ears and eyes for the time,</div>
                              <div class="line">But hearts for the event.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Have with you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.4.3">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>2. SCENE  II.  The same. The Capitol.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter two Officers, to lay cushions</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Officer</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, come, they are almost here. How many stand</div>
                              <div class="line">for consulships?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Officer</div>
                              <div class="line">Three, they say: but 'tis thought of every one</div>
                              <div class="line">Coriolanus will carry it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Officer</div>
                              <div class="line">That's a brave fellow; but he's vengeance proud, and</div>
                              <div class="line">loves not the common people.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Officer</div>
                              <div class="line">Faith, there had been many great men that have</div>
                              <div class="line">flattered the people, who ne'er loved them; and there</div>
                              <div class="line">be many that they have loved, they know not</div>
                              <div class="line">wherefore: so that, if they love they know not why,</div>
                              <div class="line">they hate upon no better a ground: therefore, for</div>
                              <div class="line">Coriolanus neither to care whether they love or hate</div>
                              <div class="line">him manifests the true knowledge he has in their</div>
                              <div class="line">disposition; and out of his noble carelessness lets</div>
                              <div class="line">them plainly see't.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Officer</div>
                              <div class="line">If he did not care whether he had their love or no,</div>
                              <div class="line">he waved indifferently 'twixt doing them neither</div>
                              <div class="line">good nor harm: but he seeks their hate with greater</div>
                              <div class="line">devotion than can render it him; and leaves</div>
                              <div class="line">nothing undone that may fully discover him their</div>
                              <div class="line">opposite. Now, to seem to affect the malice and</div>
                              <div class="line">displeasure of the people is as bad as that which he</div>
                              <div class="line">dislikes, to flatter them for their love.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Officer</div>
                              <div class="line">He hath deserved worthily of his country: and his</div>
                              <div class="line">ascent is not by such easy degrees as those who,</div>
                              <div class="line">having been supple and courteous to the people,</div>
                              <div class="line">bonneted, without any further deed to have them at</div>
                              <div class="line">an into their estimation and report: but he hath so</div>
                              <div class="line">planted his honours in their eyes, and his actions</div>
                              <div class="line">in their hearts, that for their tongues to be</div>
                              <div class="line">silent, and not confess so much, were a kind of</div>
                              <div class="line">ingrateful injury; to report otherwise, were a</div>
                              <div class="line">malice, that, giving itself the lie, would pluck</div>
                              <div class="line">reproof and rebuke from every ear that heard it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Officer</div>
                              <div class="line">No more of him; he is a worthy man: make way, they</div>
                              <div class="line">are coming.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>A sennet. Enter, with actors before them, COMINIUS
the consul, MENENIUS, CORIOLANUS, Senators,
SICINIUS and BRUTUS. The Senators take their
places; the Tribunes take their Places by
themselves. CORIOLANUS stands</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Having determined of the Volsces and</div>
                              <div class="line">To send for Titus Lartius, it remains,</div>
                              <div class="line">As the main point of this our after-meeting,</div>
                              <div class="line">To gratify his noble service that</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath thus stood for his country: therefore,</div>
                              <div class="line">please you,</div>
                              <div class="line">Most reverend and grave elders, to desire</div>
                              <div class="line">The present consul, and last general</div>
                              <div class="line">In our well-found successes, to report</div>
                              <div class="line">A little of that worthy work perform'd</div>
                              <div class="line">By Caius Marcius Coriolanus, whom</div>
                              <div class="line">We met here both to thank and to remember</div>
                              <div class="line">With honours like himself.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                              <div class="line">Speak, good Cominius:</div>
                              <div class="line">Leave nothing out for length, and make us think</div>
                              <div class="line">Rather our state's defective for requital</div>
                              <div class="line">Than we to stretch it out.</div>
                              <p>To the Tribunes</p>
                              <div class="line">Masters o' the people,</div>
                              <div class="line">We do request your kindest ears, and after,</div>
                              <div class="line">Your loving motion toward the common body,</div>
                              <div class="line">To yield what passes here.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">We are convented</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon a pleasing treaty, and have hearts</div>
                              <div class="line">Inclinable to honour and advance</div>
                              <div class="line">The theme of our assembly.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Which the rather</div>
                              <div class="line">We shall be blest to do, if he remember</div>
                              <div class="line">A kinder value of the people than</div>
                              <div class="line">He hath hereto prized them at.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">That's off, that's off;</div>
                              <div class="line">I would you rather had been silent. Please you</div>
                              <div class="line">To hear Cominius speak?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Most willingly;</div>
                              <div class="line">But yet my caution was more pertinent</div>
                              <div class="line">Than the rebuke you give it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">He loves your people</div>
                              <div class="line">But tie him not to be their bedfellow.</div>
                              <div class="line">Worthy Cominius, speak.</div>
                              <p>CORIOLANUS offers to go away</p>
                              <div class="line">Nay, keep your place.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                              <div class="line">Sit, Coriolanus; never shame to hear</div>
                              <div class="line">What you have nobly done.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Your horror's pardon:</div>
                              <div class="line">I had rather have my wounds to heal again</div>
                              <div class="line">Than hear say how I got them.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir, I hope</div>
                              <div class="line">My words disbench'd you not.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">No, sir: yet oft,</div>
                              <div class="line">When blows have made me stay, I fled from words.</div>
                              <div class="line">You soothed not, therefore hurt not: but</div>
                              <div class="line">your people,</div>
                              <div class="line">I love them as they weigh.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Pray now, sit down.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I had rather have one scratch my head i' the sun</div>
                              <div class="line">When the alarum were struck than idly sit</div>
                              <div class="line">To hear my nothings monster'd.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Masters of the people,</div>
                              <div class="line">Your multiplying spawn how can he flatter--</div>
                              <div class="line">That's thousand to one good one--when you now see</div>
                              <div class="line">He had rather venture all his limbs for honour</div>
                              <div class="line">Than one on's ears to hear it? Proceed, Cominius.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I shall lack voice: the deeds of Coriolanus</div>
                              <div class="line">Should not be utter'd feebly. It is held</div>
                              <div class="line">That valour is the chiefest virtue, and</div>
                              <div class="line">Most dignifies the haver: if it be,</div>
                              <div class="line">The man I speak of cannot in the world</div>
                              <div class="line">Be singly counterpoised. At sixteen years,</div>
                              <div class="line">When Tarquin made a head for Rome, he fought</div>
                              <div class="line">Beyond the mark of others: our then dictator,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whom with all praise I point at, saw him fight,</div>
                              <div class="line">When with his Amazonian chin he drove</div>
                              <div class="line">The bristled lips before him: be bestrid</div>
                              <div class="line">An o'er-press'd Roman and i' the consul's view</div>
                              <div class="line">Slew three opposers: Tarquin's self he met,</div>
                              <div class="line">And struck him on his knee: in that day's feats,</div>
                              <div class="line">When he might act the woman in the scene,</div>
                              <div class="line">He proved best man i' the field, and for his meed</div>
                              <div class="line">Was brow-bound with the oak. His pupil age</div>
                              <div class="line">Man-enter'd thus, he waxed like a sea,</div>
                              <div class="line">And in the brunt of seventeen battles since</div>
                              <div class="line">He lurch'd all swords of the garland. For this last,</div>
                              <div class="line">Before and in Corioli, let me say,</div>
                              <div class="line">I cannot speak him home: he stopp'd the fliers;</div>
                              <div class="line">And by his rare example made the coward</div>
                              <div class="line">Turn terror into sport: as weeds before</div>
                              <div class="line">A vessel under sail, so men obey'd</div>
                              <div class="line">And fell below his stem: his sword, death's stamp,</div>
                              <div class="line">Where it did mark, it took; from face to foot</div>
                              <div class="line">He was a thing of blood, whose every motion</div>
                              <div class="line">Was timed with dying cries: alone he enter'd</div>
                              <div class="line">The mortal gate of the city, which he painted</div>
                              <div class="line">With shunless destiny; aidless came off,</div>
                              <div class="line">And with a sudden reinforcement struck</div>
                              <div class="line">Corioli like a planet: now all's his:</div>
                              <div class="line">When, by and by, the din of war gan pierce</div>
                              <div class="line">His ready sense; then straight his doubled spirit</div>
                              <div class="line">Re-quicken'd what in flesh was fatigate,</div>
                              <div class="line">And to the battle came he; where he did</div>
                              <div class="line">Run reeking o'er the lives of men, as if</div>
                              <div class="line">'Twere a perpetual spoil: and till we call'd</div>
                              <div class="line">Both field and city ours, he never stood</div>
                              <div class="line">To ease his breast with panting.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Worthy man!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                              <div class="line">He cannot but with measure fit the honours</div>
                              <div class="line">Which we devise him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Our spoils he kick'd at,</div>
                              <div class="line">And look'd upon things precious as they were</div>
                              <div class="line">The common muck of the world: he covets less</div>
                              <div class="line">Than misery itself would give; rewards</div>
                              <div class="line">His deeds with doing them, and is content</div>
                              <div class="line">To spend the time to end it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">He's right noble:</div>
                              <div class="line">Let him be call'd for.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                              <div class="line">Call Coriolanus.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Officer</div>
                              <div class="line">He doth appear.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Re-enter CORIOLANUS</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">The senate, Coriolanus, are well pleased</div>
                              <div class="line">To make thee consul.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I do owe them still</div>
                              <div class="line">My life and services.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">It then remains</div>
                              <div class="line">That you do speak to the people.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I do beseech you,</div>
                              <div class="line">Let me o'erleap that custom, for I cannot</div>
                              <div class="line">Put on the gown, stand naked and entreat them,</div>
                              <div class="line">For my wounds' sake, to give their suffrage: please you</div>
                              <div class="line">That I may pass this doing.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir, the people</div>
                              <div class="line">Must have their voices; neither will they bate</div>
                              <div class="line">One jot of ceremony.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Put them not to't:</div>
                              <div class="line">Pray you, go fit you to the custom and</div>
                              <div class="line">Take to you, as your predecessors have,</div>
                              <div class="line">Your honour with your form.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">It is apart</div>
                              <div class="line">That I shall blush in acting, and might well</div>
                              <div class="line">Be taken from the people.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Mark you that?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">To brag unto them, thus I did, and thus;</div>
                              <div class="line">Show them the unaching scars which I should hide,</div>
                              <div class="line">As if I had received them for the hire</div>
                              <div class="line">Of their breath only!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Do not stand upon't.</div>
                              <div class="line">We recommend to you, tribunes of the people,</div>
                              <div class="line">Our purpose to them: and to our noble consul</div>
                              <div class="line">Wish we all joy and honour.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Senators</div>
                              <div class="line">To Coriolanus come all joy and honour!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Flourish of cornets. Exeunt all but SICINIUS
and BRUTUS</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                              <div class="line">You see how he intends to use the people.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">May they perceive's intent! He will require them,</div>
                              <div class="line">As if he did contemn what he requested</div>
                              <div class="line">Should be in them to give.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, we'll inform them</div>
                              <div class="line">Of our proceedings here: on the marketplace,</div>
                              <div class="line">I know, they do attend us.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.4.4">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>3. SCENE III.  The same. The Forum.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter seven or eight Citizens</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">Once, if he do require our voices, we ought not to deny him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">We may, sir, if we will.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">We have power in ourselves to do it, but it is a</div>
                              <div class="line">power that we have no power to do; for if he show us</div>
                              <div class="line">his wounds and tell us his deeds, we are to put our</div>
                              <div class="line">tongues into those wounds and speak for them; so, if</div>
                              <div class="line">he tell us his noble deeds, we must also tell him</div>
                              <div class="line">our noble acceptance of them. Ingratitude is</div>
                              <div class="line">monstrous, and for the multitude to be ingrateful,</div>
                              <div class="line">were to make a monster of the multitude: of the</div>
                              <div class="line">which we being members, should bring ourselves to be</div>
                              <div class="line">monstrous members.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">And to make us no better thought of, a little help</div>
                              <div class="line">will serve; for once we stood up about the corn, he</div>
                              <div class="line">himself stuck not to call us the many-headed multitude.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">We have been called so of many; not that our heads</div>
                              <div class="line">are some brown, some black, some auburn, some bald,</div>
                              <div class="line">but that our wits are so diversely coloured: and</div>
                              <div class="line">truly I think if all our wits were to issue out of</div>
                              <div class="line">one skull, they would fly east, west, north, south,</div>
                              <div class="line">and their consent of one direct way should be at</div>
                              <div class="line">once to all the points o' the compass.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">Think you so? Which way do you judge my wit would</div>
                              <div class="line">fly?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, your wit will not so soon out as another man's</div>
                              <div class="line">will;'tis strongly wedged up in a block-head, but</div>
                              <div class="line">if it were at liberty, 'twould, sure, southward.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">Why that way?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">To lose itself in a fog, where being three parts</div>
                              <div class="line">melted away with rotten dews, the fourth would return</div>
                              <div class="line">for conscience sake, to help to get thee a wife.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">You are never without your tricks: you may, you may.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">Are you all resolved to give your voices? But</div>
                              <div class="line">that's no matter, the greater part carries it. I</div>
                              <div class="line">say, if he would incline to the people, there was</div>
                              <div class="line">never a worthier man.</div>
                              <p>Enter CORIOLANUS in a gown of humility, with MENENIUS</p>
                              <div class="line">Here he comes, and in the gown of humility: mark his</div>
                              <div class="line">behavior. We are not to stay all together, but to</div>
                              <div class="line">come by him where he stands, by ones, by twos, and</div>
                              <div class="line">by threes. He's to make his requests by</div>
                              <div class="line">particulars; wherein every one of us has a single</div>
                              <div class="line">honour, in giving him our own voices with our own</div>
                              <div class="line">tongues: therefore follow me, and I direct you how</div>
                              <div class="line">you shall go by him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">All</div>
                              <div class="line">Content, content.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt Citizens</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">O sir, you are not right: have you not known</div>
                              <div class="line">The worthiest men have done't?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">What must I say?</div>
                              <div class="line">'I Pray, sir'--Plague upon't! I cannot bring</div>
                              <div class="line">My tongue to such a pace:--'Look, sir, my wounds!</div>
                              <div class="line">I got them in my country's service, when</div>
                              <div class="line">Some certain of your brethren roar'd and ran</div>
                              <div class="line">From the noise of our own drums.'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">O me, the gods!</div>
                              <div class="line">You must not speak of that: you must desire them</div>
                              <div class="line">To think upon you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Think upon me! hang 'em!</div>
                              <div class="line">I would they would forget me, like the virtues</div>
                              <div class="line">Which our divines lose by 'em.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">You'll mar all:</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll leave you: pray you, speak to 'em, I pray you,</div>
                              <div class="line">In wholesome manner.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Bid them wash their faces</div>
                              <div class="line">And keep their teeth clean.</div>
                              <p>Re-enter two of the Citizens</p>
                              <div class="line">So, here comes a brace.</div>
                              <p>Re-enter a third Citizen</p>
                              <div class="line">You know the cause, air, of my standing here.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">We do, sir; tell us what hath brought you to't.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Mine own desert.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">Your own desert!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, but not mine own desire.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">How not your own desire?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">No, sir,'twas never my desire yet to trouble the</div>
                              <div class="line">poor with begging.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">You must think, if we give you any thing, we hope to</div>
                              <div class="line">gain by you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Well then, I pray, your price o' the consulship?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">The price is to ask it kindly.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Kindly! Sir, I pray, let me ha't: I have wounds to</div>
                              <div class="line">show you, which shall be yours in private. Your</div>
                              <div class="line">good voice, sir; what say you?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">You shall ha' it, worthy sir.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">A match, sir. There's in all two worthy voices</div>
                              <div class="line">begged. I have your alms: adieu.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">But this is something odd.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">An 'twere to give again,--but 'tis no matter.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt the three Citizens</p>
                        <p>Re-enter two other Citizens</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Pray you now, if it may stand with the tune of your</div>
                              <div class="line">voices that I may be consul, I have here the</div>
                              <div class="line">customary gown.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Fourth Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">You have deserved nobly of your country, and you</div>
                              <div class="line">have not deserved nobly.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Your enigma?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Fourth Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">You have been a scourge to her enemies, you have</div>
                              <div class="line">been a rod to her friends; you have not indeed loved</div>
                              <div class="line">the common people.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">You should account me the more virtuous that I have</div>
                              <div class="line">not been common in my love. I will, sir, flatter my</div>
                              <div class="line">sworn brother, the people, to earn a dearer</div>
                              <div class="line">estimation of them; 'tis a condition they account</div>
                              <div class="line">gentle: and since the wisdom of their choice is</div>
                              <div class="line">rather to have my hat than my heart, I will practise</div>
                              <div class="line">the insinuating nod and be off to them most</div>
                              <div class="line">counterfeitly; that is, sir, I will counterfeit the</div>
                              <div class="line">bewitchment of some popular man and give it</div>
                              <div class="line">bountiful to the desirers. Therefore, beseech you,</div>
                              <div class="line">I may be consul.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Fifth Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">We hope to find you our friend; and therefore give</div>
