                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.5">4. SCENE IV.  Antium. Before Aufidius's house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.6">5. SCENE V.  The same. A hall in Aufidius's house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.7">6. SCENE VI.  Rome. A public place.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.8">7. SCENE VII.  A camp, at a small distance from Rome.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="content">
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.6.2">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>1. SCENE I.  Rome. Before a gate of the city.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter CORIOLANUS, VOLUMNIA, VIRGILIA, MENENIUS,
COMINIUS, with the young Nobility of Rome</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, leave your tears: a brief farewell: the beast</div>
                              <div class="line">With many heads butts me away. Nay, mother,</div>
                              <div class="line">Where is your ancient courage? you were used</div>
                              <div class="line">To say extremity was the trier of spirits;</div>
                              <div class="line">That common chances common men could bear;</div>
                              <div class="line">That when the sea was calm all boats alike</div>
                              <div class="line">Show'd mastership in floating; fortune's blows,</div>
                              <div class="line">When most struck home, being gentle wounded, craves</div>
                              <div class="line">A noble cunning: you were used to load me</div>
                              <div class="line">With precepts that would make invincible</div>
                              <div class="line">The heart that conn'd them.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VIRGILIA</div>
                              <div class="line">O heavens! O heavens!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay! prithee, woman,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Now the red pestilence strike all trades in Rome,</div>
                              <div class="line">And occupations perish!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">What, what, what!</div>
                              <div class="line">I shall be loved when I am lack'd. Nay, mother.</div>
                              <div class="line">Resume that spirit, when you were wont to say,</div>
                              <div class="line">If you had been the wife of Hercules,</div>
                              <div class="line">Six of his labours you'ld have done, and saved</div>
                              <div class="line">Your husband so much sweat. Cominius,</div>
                              <div class="line">Droop not; adieu. Farewell, my wife, my mother:</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll do well yet. Thou old and true Menenius,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy tears are salter than a younger man's,</div>
                              <div class="line">And venomous to thine eyes. My sometime general,</div>
                              <div class="line">I have seen thee stem, and thou hast oft beheld</div>
                              <div class="line">Heart-hardening spectacles; tell these sad women</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis fond to wail inevitable strokes,</div>
                              <div class="line">As 'tis to laugh at 'em. My mother, you wot well</div>
                              <div class="line">My hazards still have been your solace: and</div>
                              <div class="line">Believe't not lightly--though I go alone,</div>
                              <div class="line">Like to a lonely dragon, that his fen</div>
                              <div class="line">Makes fear'd and talk'd of more than seen--your son</div>
                              <div class="line">Will or exceed the common or be caught</div>
                              <div class="line">With cautelous baits and practise.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                              <div class="line">My first son.</div>
                              <div class="line">Whither wilt thou go? Take good Cominius</div>
                              <div class="line">With thee awhile: determine on some course,</div>
                              <div class="line">More than a wild exposture to each chance</div>
                              <div class="line">That starts i' the way before thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">O the gods!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">COMINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll follow thee a month, devise with thee</div>
                              <div class="line">Where thou shalt rest, that thou mayst hear of us</div>
                              <div class="line">And we of thee: so if the time thrust forth</div>
                              <div class="line">A cause for thy repeal, we shall not send</div>
                              <div class="line">O'er the vast world to seek a single man,</div>
                              <div class="line">And lose advantage, which doth ever cool</div>
                              <div class="line">I' the absence of the needer.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Fare ye well:</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou hast years upon thee; and thou art too full</div>
                              <div class="line">Of the wars' surfeits, to go rove with one</div>
                              <div class="line">That's yet unbruised: bring me but out at gate.</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, my sweet wife, my dearest mother, and</div>
                              <div class="line">My friends of noble touch, when I am forth,</div>
                              <div class="line">Bid me farewell, and smile. I pray you, come.</div>
                              <div class="line">While I remain above the ground, you shall</div>
                              <div class="line">Hear from me still, and never of me aught</div>
                              <div class="line">But what is like me formerly.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">That's worthily</div>
                              <div class="line">As any ear can hear. Come, let's not weep.</div>
                              <div class="line">If I could shake off but one seven years</div>
                              <div class="line">From these old arms and legs, by the good gods,</div>
                              <div class="line">I'ld with thee every foot.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Give me thy hand: Come.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.6.3">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>2. SCENE II.  The same. A  street near the gate.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter SICINIUS, BRUTUS, and an AEdile</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Bid them all home; he's gone, and we'll no further.</div>
                              <div class="line">The nobility are vex'd, whom we see have sided</div>
                              <div class="line">In his behalf.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Now we have shown our power,</div>
                              <div class="line">Let us seem humbler after it is done</div>
                              <div class="line">Than when it was a-doing.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Bid them home:</div>
                              <div class="line">Say their great enemy is gone, and they</div>
                              <div class="line">Stand in their ancient strength.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Dismiss them home.</div>
                              <p>Exit AEdile</p>
                              <div class="line">Here comes his mother.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Let's not meet her.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Why?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">They say she's mad.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                              <div class="line">They have ta'en note of us: keep on your way.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter VOLUMNIA, VIRGILIA, and MENENIUS</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                              <div class="line">O, ye're well met: the hoarded plague o' the gods</div>
                              <div class="line">Requite your love!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Peace, peace; be not so loud.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                              <div class="line">If that I could for weeping, you should hear,--</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, and you shall hear some.</div>
                              <p>To BRUTUS</p>
                              <div class="line">Will you be gone?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VIRGILIA</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>To SICINIUS</span>  You shall stay too: I would I had the power</div>
                              <div class="line">To say so to my husband.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Are you mankind?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, fool; is that a shame? Note but this fool.</div>
                              <div class="line">Was not a man my father? Hadst thou foxship</div>
                              <div class="line">To banish him that struck more blows for Rome</div>
                              <div class="line">Than thou hast spoken words?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">O blessed heavens!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                              <div class="line">More noble blows than ever thou wise words;</div>
                              <div class="line">And for Rome's good. I'll tell thee what; yet go:</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, but thou shalt stay too: I would my son</div>
                              <div class="line">Were in Arabia, and thy tribe before him,</div>
                              <div class="line">His good sword in his hand.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">What then?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VIRGILIA</div>
                              <div class="line">What then!</div>
                              <div class="line">He'ld make an end of thy posterity.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Bastards and all.</div>
                              <div class="line">Good man, the wounds that he does bear for Rome!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, come, peace.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I would he had continued to his country</div>
                              <div class="line">As he began, and not unknit himself</div>
                              <div class="line">The noble knot he made.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I would he had.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                              <div class="line">'I would he had'! 'Twas you incensed the rabble:</div>
                              <div class="line">Cats, that can judge as fitly of his worth</div>
                              <div class="line">As I can of those mysteries which heaven</div>
                              <div class="line">Will not have earth to know.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Pray, let us go.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, pray, sir, get you gone:</div>
                              <div class="line">You have done a brave deed. Ere you go, hear this:--</div>
                              <div class="line">As far as doth the Capitol exceed</div>
                              <div class="line">The meanest house in Rome, so far my son--</div>
                              <div class="line">This lady's husband here, this, do you see--</div>
                              <div class="line">Whom you have banish'd, does exceed you all.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRUTUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, well, we'll leave you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SICINIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Why stay we to be baited</div>
                              <div class="line">With one that wants her wits?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Take my prayers with you.</div>
                              <p>Exeunt Tribunes</p>
                              <div class="line">I would the gods had nothing else to do</div>
                              <div class="line">But to confirm my curses! Could I meet 'em</div>
                              <div class="line">But once a-day, it would unclog my heart</div>
                              <div class="line">Of what lies heavy to't.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">You have told them home;</div>
                              <div class="line">And, by my troth, you have cause. You'll sup with me?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VOLUMNIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Anger's my meat; I sup upon myself,</div>
                              <div class="line">And so shall starve with feeding. Come, let's go:</div>
                              <div class="line">Leave this faint puling and lament as I do,</div>
                              <div class="line">In anger, Juno-like. Come, come, come.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENENIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Fie, fie, fie!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.6.4">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>3. SCENE III.  A highway between Rome and Antium.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter a Roman and a Volsce, meeting</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Roman</div>
                              <div class="line">I know you well, sir, and you know</div>
                              <div class="line">me: your name, I think, is Adrian.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Volsce</div>
                              <div class="line">It is so, sir: truly, I have forgot you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Roman</div>
                              <div class="line">I am a Roman; and my services are,</div>
                              <div class="line">as you are, against 'em: know you me yet?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Volsce</div>
                              <div class="line">Nicanor? no.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Roman</div>
                              <div class="line">The same, sir.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Volsce</div>
                              <div class="line">You had more beard when I last saw you; but your</div>
                              <div class="line">favour is well approved by your tongue. What's the</div>
                              <div class="line">news in Rome? I have a note from the Volscian state,</div>
                              <div class="line">to find you out there: you have well saved me a</div>
                              <div class="line">day's journey.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Roman</div>
                              <div class="line">There hath been in Rome strange insurrections; the</div>
                              <div class="line">people against the senators, patricians, and nobles.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Volsce</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath been! is it ended, then? Our state thinks not</div>
                              <div class="line">so: they are in a most warlike preparation, and</div>
                              <div class="line">hope to come upon them in the heat of their division.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Roman</div>
                              <div class="line">The main blaze of it is past, but a small thing</div>
                              <div class="line">would make it flame again: for the nobles receive</div>
                              <div class="line">so to heart the banishment of that worthy</div>
                              <div class="line">Coriolanus, that they are in a ripe aptness to take</div>
                              <div class="line">all power from the people and to pluck from them</div>
                              <div class="line">their tribunes for ever. This lies glowing, I can</div>
                              <div class="line">tell you, and is almost mature for the violent</div>
                              <div class="line">breaking out.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Volsce</div>
                              <div class="line">Coriolanus banished!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Roman</div>
                              <div class="line">Banished, sir.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Volsce</div>
                              <div class="line">You will be welcome with this intelligence, Nicanor.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Roman</div>
                              <div class="line">The day serves well for them now. I have heard it</div>
                              <div class="line">said, the fittest time to corrupt a man's wife is</div>
                              <div class="line">when she's fallen out with her husband. Your noble</div>
                              <div class="line">Tullus Aufidius will appear well in these wars, his</div>
                              <div class="line">great opposer, Coriolanus, being now in no request</div>
                              <div class="line">of his country.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Volsce</div>
                              <div class="line">He cannot choose. I am most fortunate, thus</div>
                              <div class="line">accidentally to encounter you: you have ended my</div>
                              <div class="line">business, and I will merrily accompany you home.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Roman</div>
                              <div class="line">I shall, between this and supper, tell you most</div>
                              <div class="line">strange things from Rome; all tending to the good of</div>
                              <div class="line">their adversaries. Have you an army ready, say you?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Volsce</div>
                              <div class="line">A most royal one; the centurions and their charges,</div>
                              <div class="line">distinctly billeted, already in the entertainment,</div>
                              <div class="line">and to be on foot at an hour's warning.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Roman</div>
                              <div class="line">I am joyful to hear of their readiness, and am the</div>
                              <div class="line">man, I think, that shall set them in present action.</div>
                              <div class="line">So, sir, heartily well met, and most glad of your company.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Volsce</div>
                              <div class="line">You take my part from me, sir; I have the most cause</div>
                              <div class="line">to be glad of yours.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Roman</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, let us go together.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.6.5">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>4. SCENE IV.  Antium. Before Aufidius's house.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter CORIOLANUS in mean apparel, disguised
and muffled</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">A goodly city is this Antium. City,</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis I that made thy widows: many an heir</div>
                              <div class="line">Of these fair edifices 'fore my wars</div>
                              <div class="line">Have I heard groan and drop: then know me not,</div>
                              <div class="line">Lest that thy wives with spits and boys with stones</div>
                              <div class="line">In puny battle slay me.</div>
                              <p>Enter a Citizen</p>
                              <div class="line">Save you, sir.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">And you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Direct me, if it be your will,</div>
                              <div class="line">Where great Aufidius lies: is he in Antium?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">He is, and feasts the nobles of the state</div>
                              <div class="line">At his house this night.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Which is his house, beseech you?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">This, here before you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Thank you, sir: farewell.</div>
                              <p>Exit Citizen</p>
                              <div class="line">O world, thy slippery turns! Friends now fast sworn,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose double bosoms seem to wear one heart,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose house, whose bed, whose meal, and exercise,</div>
                              <div class="line">Are still together, who twin, as 'twere, in love</div>
                              <div class="line">Unseparable, shall within this hour,</div>
                              <div class="line">On a dissension of a doit, break out</div>
                              <div class="line">To bitterest enmity: so, fellest foes,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose passions and whose plots have broke their sleep,</div>
                              <div class="line">To take the one the other, by some chance,</div>
                              <div class="line">Some trick not worth an egg, shall grow dear friends</div>
                              <div class="line">And interjoin their issues. So with me:</div>
                              <div class="line">My birth-place hate I, and my love's upon</div>
                              <div class="line">This enemy town. I'll enter: if he slay me,</div>
                              <div class="line">He does fair justice; if he give me way,</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll do his country service.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.6.6">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>5. SCENE V.  The same. A hall in Aufidius's house.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Music within. Enter a Servingman</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">Wine, wine, wine! What service</div>
                              <div class="line">is here! I think our fellows are asleep.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <p>Enter a second Servingman</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">Where's Cotus? my master calls</div>
                              <div class="line">for him. Cotus!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <p>Enter CORIOLANUS</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">A goodly house: the feast smells well; but I</div>
                              <div class="line">Appear not like a guest.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Re-enter the first Servingman</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">What would you have, friend? whence are you?</div>
                              <div class="line">Here's no place for you: pray, go to the door.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I have deserved no better entertainment,</div>
                              <div class="line">In being Coriolanus.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Re-enter second Servingman</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">Whence are you, sir? Has the porter his eyes in his</div>
                              <div class="line">head; that he gives entrance to such companions?</div>
                              <div class="line">Pray, get you out.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Away!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">Away! get you away.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Now thou'rt troublesome.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">Are you so brave? I'll have you talked with anon.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter a third Servingman. The first meets him</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">What fellow's this?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">A strange one as ever I looked on: I cannot get him</div>
                              <div class="line">out of the house: prithee, call my master to him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Retires</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">What have you to do here, fellow? Pray you, avoid</div>
                              <div class="line">the house.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Let me but stand; I will not hurt your hearth.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">What are you?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">A gentleman.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">A marvellous poor one.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">True, so I am.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">Pray you, poor gentleman, take up some other</div>
                              <div class="line">station; here's no place for you; pray you, avoid: come.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Follow your function, go, and batten on cold bits.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Pushes him away</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">What, you will not? Prithee, tell my master what a</div>
                              <div class="line">strange guest he has here.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">And I shall.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">Where dwellest thou?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Under the canopy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">Under the canopy!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">Where's that?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I' the city of kites and crows.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">I' the city of kites and crows! What an ass it is!</div>
                              <div class="line">Then thou dwellest with daws too?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">No, I serve not thy master.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">How, sir! do you meddle with my master?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay; 'tis an honester service than to meddle with thy</div>
                              <div class="line">mistress. Thou pratest, and pratest; serve with thy</div>
                              <div class="line">trencher, hence!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Beats him away. Exit third Servingman</p>
                        <p>Enter AUFIDIUS with the second Servingman</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Where is this fellow?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">Here, sir: I'ld have beaten him like a dog, but for</div>
                              <div class="line">disturbing the lords within.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Retires</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Whence comest thou? what wouldst thou? thy name?</div>
                              <div class="line">Why speak'st not? speak, man: what's thy name?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">If, Tullus,</div>
                              <p>Unmuffling</p>
                              <div class="line">Not yet thou knowest me, and, seeing me, dost not</div>
                              <div class="line">Think me for the man I am, necessity</div>
                              <div class="line">Commands me name myself.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">What is thy name?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">A name unmusical to the Volscians' ears,</div>
                              <div class="line">And harsh in sound to thine.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Say, what's thy name?</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou hast a grim appearance, and thy face</div>
                              <div class="line">Bears a command in't; though thy tackle's torn.</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou show'st a noble vessel: what's thy name?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Prepare thy brow to frown: know'st</div>
                              <div class="line">thou me yet?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I know thee not: thy name?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">My name is Caius Marcius, who hath done</div>
                              <div class="line">To thee particularly and to all the Volsces</div>
                              <div class="line">Great hurt and mischief; thereto witness may</div>
                              <div class="line">My surname, Coriolanus: the painful service,</div>
                              <div class="line">The extreme dangers and the drops of blood</div>
                              <div class="line">Shed for my thankless country are requited</div>
                              <div class="line">But with that surname; a good memory,</div>
                              <div class="line">And witness of the malice and displeasure</div>
                              <div class="line">Which thou shouldst bear me: only that name remains;</div>
                              <div class="line">The cruelty and envy of the people,</div>
                              <div class="line">Permitted by our dastard nobles, who</div>
                              <div class="line">Have all forsook me, hath devour'd the rest;</div>
                              <div class="line">And suffer'd me by the voice of slaves to be</div>
                              <div class="line">Whoop'd out of Rome. Now this extremity</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath brought me to thy hearth; not out of hope--</div>
                              <div class="line">Mistake me not--to save my life, for if</div>
                              <div class="line">I had fear'd death, of all the men i' the world</div>
                              <div class="line">I would have 'voided thee, but in mere spite,</div>
                              <div class="line">To be full quit of those my banishers,</div>
                              <div class="line">Stand I before thee here. Then if thou hast</div>
                              <div class="line">A heart of wreak in thee, that wilt revenge</div>
                              <div class="line">Thine own particular wrongs and stop those maims</div>
                              <div class="line">Of shame seen through thy country, speed</div>
                              <div class="line">thee straight,</div>
                              <div class="line">And make my misery serve thy turn: so use it</div>
                              <div class="line">That my revengeful services may prove</div>
                              <div class="line">As benefits to thee, for I will fight</div>
                              <div class="line">Against my canker'd country with the spleen</div>
                              <div class="line">Of all the under fiends. But if so be</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou darest not this and that to prove more fortunes</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou'rt tired, then, in a word, I also am</div>
                              <div class="line">Longer to live most weary, and present</div>
                              <div class="line">My throat to thee and to thy ancient malice;</div>
                              <div class="line">Which not to cut would show thee but a fool,</div>
                              <div class="line">Since I have ever follow'd thee with hate,</div>
                              <div class="line">Drawn tuns of blood out of thy country's breast,</div>
                              <div class="line">And cannot live but to thy shame, unless</div>
                              <div class="line">It be to do thee service.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">O Marcius, Marcius!</div>
                              <div class="line">Each word thou hast spoke hath weeded from my heart</div>
                              <div class="line">A root of ancient envy. If Jupiter</div>
                              <div class="line">Should from yond cloud speak divine things,</div>
                              <div class="line">And say 'Tis true,' I'ld not believe them more</div>
                              <div class="line">Than thee, all noble Marcius. Let me twine</div>
                              <div class="line">Mine arms about that body, where against</div>
                              <div class="line">My grained ash an hundred times hath broke</div>
                              <div class="line">And scarr'd the moon with splinters: here I clip</div>
                              <div class="line">The anvil of my sword, and do contest</div>
                              <div class="line">As hotly and as nobly with thy love</div>
                              <div class="line">As ever in ambitious strength I did</div>
                              <div class="line">Contend against thy valour. Know thou first,</div>
                              <div class="line">I loved the maid I married; never man</div>
                              <div class="line">Sigh'd truer breath; but that I see thee here,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou noble thing! more dances my rapt heart</div>
                              <div class="line">Than when I first my wedded mistress saw</div>
                              <div class="line">Bestride my threshold. Why, thou Mars! I tell thee,</div>
                              <div class="line">We have a power on foot; and I had purpose</div>
                              <div class="line">Once more to hew thy target from thy brawn,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or lose mine arm fort: thou hast beat me out</div>
                              <div class="line">Twelve several times, and I have nightly since</div>
                              <div class="line">Dreamt of encounters 'twixt thyself and me;</div>
                              <div class="line">We have been down together in my sleep,</div>
                              <div class="line">Unbuckling helms, fisting each other's throat,</div>
                              <div class="line">And waked half dead with nothing. Worthy Marcius,</div>
                              <div class="line">Had we no quarrel else to Rome, but that</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou art thence banish'd, we would muster all</div>
                              <div class="line">From twelve to seventy, and pouring war</div>
                              <div class="line">Into the bowels of ungrateful Rome,</div>
                              <div class="line">Like a bold flood o'er-bear. O, come, go in,</div>
                              <div class="line">And take our friendly senators by the hands;</div>
                              <div class="line">Who now are here, taking their leaves of me,</div>
                              <div class="line">Who am prepared against your territories,</div>
                              <div class="line">Though not for Rome itself.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIOLANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">You bless me, gods!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AUFIDIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Therefore, most absolute sir, if thou wilt have</div>
                              <div class="line">The leading of thine own revenges, take</div>
                              <div class="line">The one half of my commission; and set down--</div>
                              <div class="line">As best thou art experienced, since thou know'st</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy country's strength and weakness,--thine own ways;</div>
                              <div class="line">Whether to knock against the gates of Rome,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or rudely visit them in parts remote,</div>
                              <div class="line">To fright them, ere destroy. But come in:</div>
                              <div class="line">Let me commend thee first to those that shall</div>
                              <div class="line">Say yea to thy desires. A thousand welcomes!</div>
                              <div class="line">And more a friend than e'er an enemy;</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet, Marcius, that was much. Your hand: most welcome!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt CORIOLANUS and AUFIDIUS. The two
Servingmen come forward</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">Here's a strange alteration!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">By my hand, I had thought to have strucken him with</div>
                              <div class="line">a cudgel; and yet my mind gave me his clothes made a</div>
                              <div class="line">false report of him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">What an arm he has! he turned me about with his</div>
                              <div class="line">finger and his thumb, as one would set up a top.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, I knew by his face that there was something in</div>
                              <div class="line">him: he had, sir, a kind of face, methought,--I</div>
                              <div class="line">cannot tell how to term it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">He had so; looking as it were--would I were hanged,</div>
                              <div class="line">but I thought there was more in him than I could think.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">So did I, I'll be sworn: he is simply the rarest</div>
                              <div class="line">man i' the world.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">I think he is: but a greater soldier than he you wot on.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">Who, my master?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, it's no matter for that.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">Worth six on him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, not so neither: but I take him to be the</div>
                              <div class="line">greater soldier.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">Faith, look you, one cannot tell how to say that:</div>
                              <div class="line">for the defence of a town, our general is excellent.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, and for an assault too.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Re-enter third Servingman</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">O slaves, I can tell you news,-- news, you rascals!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Servingman</div>
                              <div class="speaker">Second Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">What, what, what? let's partake.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">I would not be a Roman, of all nations; I had as</div>
                              <div class="line">lieve be a condemned man.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Servingman</div>
                              <div class="speaker">Second Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">Wherefore? wherefore?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, here's he that was wont to thwack our general,</div>
                              <div class="line">Caius Marcius.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">Why do you say 'thwack our general '?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">I do not say 'thwack our general;' but he was always</div>
                              <div class="line">good enough for him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, we are fellows and friends: he was ever too</div>
                              <div class="line">hard for him; I have heard him say so himself.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">He was too hard for him directly, to say the troth</div>
                              <div class="line">on't: before Corioli he scotched him and notched</div>
                              <div class="line">him like a carbon ado.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">An he had been cannibally given, he might have</div>
                              <div class="line">broiled and eaten him too.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">But, more of thy news?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, he is so made on here within, as if he were son</div>
                              <div class="line">and heir to Mars; set at upper end o' the table; no</div>
                              <div class="line">question asked him by any of the senators, but they</div>
                              <div class="line">stand bald before him: our general himself makes a</div>
                              <div class="line">mistress of him: sanctifies himself with's hand and</div>
                              <div class="line">turns up the white o' the eye to his discourse. But</div>
                              <div class="line">the bottom of the news is that our general is cut i'</div>
                              <div class="line">the middle and but one half of what he was</div>
                              <div class="line">yesterday; for the other has half, by the entreaty</div>
                              <div class="line">and grant of the whole table. He'll go, he says,</div>
                              <div class="line">and sowl the porter of Rome gates by the ears: he</div>
                              <div class="line">will mow all down before him, and leave his passage polled.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">And he's as like to do't as any man I can imagine.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">Do't! he will do't; for, look you, sir, he has as</div>
                              <div class="line">many friends as enemies; which friends, sir, as it</div>
                              <div class="line">were, durst not, look you, sir, show themselves, as</div>
                              <div class="line">we term it, his friends whilst he's in directitude.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">Directitude! what's that?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">But when they shall see, sir, his crest up again,</div>
                              <div class="line">and the man in blood, they will out of their</div>
                              <div class="line">burrows, like conies after rain, and revel all with</div>
                              <div class="line">him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">But when goes this forward?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">To-morrow; to-day; presently; you shall have the</div>
                              <div class="line">drum struck up this afternoon: 'tis, as it were, a</div>
                              <div class="line">parcel of their feast, and to be executed ere they</div>
                              <div class="line">wipe their lips.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, then we shall have a stirring world again.</div>
                              <div class="line">This peace is nothing, but to rust iron, increase</div>
                              <div class="line">tailors, and breed ballad-makers.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">Let me have war, say I; it exceeds peace as far as</div>
                              <div class="line">day does night; it's spritely, waking, audible, and</div>
                              <div class="line">full of vent. Peace is a very apoplexy, lethargy;</div>
                              <div class="line">mulled, deaf, sleepy, insensible; a getter of more</div>
                              <div class="line">bastard children than war's a destroyer of men.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis so: and as war, in some sort, may be said to</div>
                              <div class="line">be a ravisher, so it cannot be denied but peace is a</div>
                              <div class="line">great maker of cuckolds.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Servingman</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, and it makes men hate one another.</div>
                           </div>
